news_headline: Maruti Suzuki advises vendors to sell non-core businesses: Report
news_article: Maruti Suzuki has reportedly advised its highly-leveraged component vendors and suppliers to sell some of its non-core businesses and increase promoter stakes to improve cash flow and ramp up production. Maruti has also asked suppliers to build sizeable inventories to prevent shortages, as per reports. In June, Suzuki Chairman Osamu Suzuki had written to Indian parts suppliers on the same.

news_headline: NASA announces discovery of water on sunlit surface of Moon
news_article: NASA on Monday announced that its Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) has confirmed there's water on the sunlit surface of the Moon. This discovery indicates that water may be distributed across the lunar surface, and not limited to cold, shadowed places. SOFIA has detected water molecules (H2O) in Clavius Crater, one of the largest craters visible from Earth.

news_headline: US' health protection agency updates definition of COVID-19 'close contact'
news_article: US' health protection agency CDC has updated its definition of 'close contact' of someone with coronavirus. According to the previous definition, close contact meant spending 15 minutes within 6 feet of an infected person. It's been changed to a total of 15 minutes or more, meaning multiple encounters that add up to 15 minutes over a 24-hour period also count.

news_headline: Scientists measure the shortest interval of time ever recorded
news_article: Atomic physicists at Goethe University Frankfurt, the Fritz Haber Institute of the Max Planck Society in Berlin and DESY have measured that it takes 247 'zeptoseconds' for a photon to travel across a hydrogen molecule. It's the shortest time span that has been successfully measured to date. A zeptosecond is a trillionth of a billionth of a second.

news_headline: PUBG Mobile to stop working for users in India from today
news_article: PUBG Mobile announced that it is terminating service and access for users in India from today, two months after the government banned the game. PUBG Mobile had remained accessible for Indian users who already had it installed. Earlier, South Korea's PUBG Corp said it will no longer give China's Tencent Games the rights to publish the mobile game in India.

news_headline: Selena, Aniston ask Google CEO Pichai to stop disinformation on US elections
news_article: Singer Selena Gomez and actress Jennifer Aniston have accused Google of spreading disinformation on US elections and urged Google CEO Sundar Pichai to stop the same. Selena shared a message she wrote to Pichai on Instagram and the same was shared by Aniston. It said, "Google is making millions of dollars putting ads on websites that spread disinformation about elections."

news_headline: Risk of civil unrest in days leading up to US election result: Zuckerberg
news_article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg warned about the risk of civil unrest in the US as votes are tallied for presidential election. "I'm worried that with our nation so divided, and results potentially taking days or weeks to be finalised, there's a risk of civil unrest...Given this, companies like ours need to go well beyond what we've done before," he said.

news_headline: Car that can transform into a plane within 3 minutes completes test flight
news_article: A car that can transform itself into a plane within three minutes flew 1,500 feet in the air over Slovakia as part of a test flight. The vehicle, AirCar, has been developed by Slovakian firm KleinVision which released the video of the test flight. The two-seat model weighs 1,100 kg and can carry an additional load of 200 kg/flight.

news_headline: ISRO must pay $1.2 billion to Bengaluru startup, rules US court
news_article: A US court has ordered ISRO's commercial arm Antrix Corporation to pay $1.2 billion compensation to Bengaluru-based startup Devas Multimedia for cancelling a 2005 satellite deal. As per the agreement, Antrix agreed to build and operate two satellites and make available the space band spectrum, using which Devas would provide communication services in India. The deal was cancelled in 2011.

news_headline: Apple loses $100 bn in value as iPhone sales fall due to late launch
news_article: Apple shares fell over 5% in after-hours trade on Thursday, wiping $100 billion from its market value after it reported that iPhone sales dropped 21% in September quarter. iPhone sales fell on anticipation of the new models, which arrived a month later than usual this year. The delayed launch meant no opening-weekend iPhone sales are included in September quarter results.

news_headline: Twitter tenders verbal apology for showing Leh and J&K as part of China
news_article: Twitter representatives tendered a verbal apology before a joint parliamentary committee on personal data protection over the location tag in a live broadcast showing Leh and J&K as part of China. The panel showed strong displeasure over it and asked Twitter to tender a written apology. Earlier, the panel had said Twitter's explanation for the blunder was "inadequate".

news_headline: Malaysia's ex-PM's tweet justifying beheadings in France deleted by Twitter
news_article: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad's tweet justifying the recent beheading attacks in France has been deleted by Twitter. "Muslims have a right to be angry and to kill millions of French people for the massacres of the past," he had tweeted. Twitter removed the tweet by Mohamad for glorifying violence.

news_headline: TikTok, ByteDance file lawsuit against video sharing app Triller
news_article: TikTok and its parent company ByteDance have filed a lawsuit against Triller in a US federal court in response to a patent infringement lawsuit filed by Triller in July. ByteDance is requesting a court order that it, its products, and its users don't infringe the patent and that none of them are liable for damages or injunctive relief.

news_headline: London gallery allows guests to view art show through robots
news_article: The Saatchi Gallery in London is holding a private viewing of Philip Colbert's "Lobsteropolis" for people via remote-controlled telepresence robots on wheels. The robots navigate through the gallery, allowing guests to view Colbert's works on the cartoon lobster through cameras and a tablet. Colbert said that he wanted to stage the exhibition like "a sci-fi vision of a possible future".

news_headline: How can Google be a neutral platform if it has control button: Lekhi
news_article: BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi questioned Google's neutrality as a platform, after deposing the company's executives on the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019. "Google itself has the control button to which...news will flash and which will be suppressed," Lekhi added. The Parliamentary panel reportedly also questioned Google if it was violating fundamental rights by controlling its users' choices.

news_headline: Facebook employees get 3 days off to 'take a break': Report
news_article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has given three days off to his employees worldwide as a reward for working through "unprecedented challenges" this year, CNBC reported. "The idea here is to give as many people as possible a break," Zuckerberg wrote in an email. Facebook employees in the US have received the entire week of Thanksgiving off.

news_headline: UPI developer NPCI plans to take digital payments to Myanmar: Report
news_article: UPI developer NPCI's subsidiary NPCI International Payments Limited (NIPL) has submitted a bid to the Central Bank of Myanmar to build Myanmar's proposed Real-Time Retail Payments System and a QR-code Generation and Repository System, the Economic Times reported. The bid, jointly submitted by NIPL and US-based fintech Euronet, could reportedly face competition from Visa and Mastercard.

news_headline: Parliamentary panel deposes Amazon, questions its revenue and taxes
news_article: Amazon's top executives were deposed before the Parliamentary panel on the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019. The committee, chaired by BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi, questioned Amazon on the amount of revenue it generated, the share of revenue it reinvested in India and the amount of tax it paid. The committee has also issued summons to Jio, Airtel, Ola and Uber.

news_headline: Ant Group's Shanghai listing oversubscribed 872 times
news_article: Ant Group's $17.2 billion Shanghai listing was oversubscribed 872 times, drawing $2.83 trillion in bids from investors. Alibaba-backed Ant Group has decided to exercise 15% overallotment option, increasing number of shares on offer to 1.92 billion from the initial 1.67 billion. The institutional order books for the Hong Kong listing were closed one day ahead of schedule due to oversubscription.

news_headline: France asks Twitter to suspend Ex-Malaysian PM Mahathir's account
news_article:
France's Secretary for Digital Sector Cédric O has asked Twitter to suspend former Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad's account following his tweets justifying a knife attack in Nice. "If not, Twitter would be an accomplice to a formal call for murder," he added. 
Mahathir on Thursday had tweeted that "Muslims have right to be angry & kill millions of French people".

news_headline: Muralitharan biopic director claims threat to life, asks Tamil Nadu CM for help
news_article: Tamil director Seenu Ramasamy has claimed he has been getting death threats after actor Vijay Sethupathi was asked to withdraw from Muttiah Muralitharan's biopic. He took to Twitter to request Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami for help, calling the matter "urgent". Vijay had opted out of film after Muralitharan said the film could cause harm to his career.

news_headline: Juhi Chawla prays for KKR during CSK's run chase, picture goes viral
news_article: Bollywood actress and Kolkata Knight Riders' (KKR) co-owner Juhi Chawla was spotted praying at the Dubai stadium on Thursday night during the final over of Chennai Super Kings' run chase. Pictures of her praying have gone viral on social media. However, CSK beat KKR by six wickets after successfully chasing down the target of 173 runs.

news_headline: Gayle throws his bat in frustration after getting out on 99, video surfaces
news_article: KXIP batsman Chris Gayle threw away his bat in frustration after getting out on 99 against RR on Friday. This is the first time in his T20 career that he got out on 99. "To the guys who I promised a century today, I missed out but in my mind it's a century. I scored a hundred," he later said.

news_headline: RR chase down 186-run target in 17.3 overs, end KXIP's 5-match winning streak
news_article: Rajasthan Royals chased down the 186-run target against Kings XI Punjab to register their second consecutive win. With the victory, RR ended KXIP's five-match winning streak and jumped to the fifth position on the IPL 2020 points table. The match witnessed KXIP's Chris Gayle become the first batsman in T20 cricket to reach 1,000 sixes.

news_headline: Which 5 Indian batsmen have hit six off the last ball to win a match in IPL history?
news_article: CSK's Ravindra Jadeja on Thursday became the fifth Indian to slam a six off the last ball to win a match in IPL history. Jadeja slammed two sixes off the last two balls to help CSK chase down the 173-run target against KKR. Rohit Sharma, Ambati Rayudu, Saurabh Tiwary and MS Dhoni are the other Indians to have done so.

news_headline: Jadeja slams 2 sixes off last 2 balls to help CSK beat KKR, MI qualify for playoffs
news_article: CSK all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed two sixes off the last two balls to help CSK chase down the target of 173 against KKR. The defeat is KKR's second in a row, while CSK, who are out of the playoffs race, registered their fifth victory. With KKR's defeat, MI became the first team to qualify for IPL 2020 playoffs.

news_headline: Dhoni gives tips to Varun after being dismissed twice by him in IPL, KKR shares video
news_article: CSK captain MS Dhoni was seen giving tips to KKR spinner Varun Chakravarthy after their IPL 2020 match on Thursday. KKR shared a video of the duo with the caption, "From admiring him from the stands at Chepauk, to now...Varun's fairytale continues!" Varun dismissed Dhoni in both of their matches this season.

news_headline: Gayle becomes first cricketer in history to smash 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket
news_article: KXIP batsman Chris Gayle has become the first-ever batsman to smash 1,000 sixes in the history of T20 cricket, achieving the feat in his 402nd T20 innings today. Gayle reached 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket after smashing his seventh six in the match against RR. Gayle is followed by Kieron Pollard, who has hit 690 sixes in T20 cricket.

news_headline: He tried to strangle me with pillow in hotel, twisted my arms: Ex-girlfriend on Zverev
news_article: World number seven men's tennis player Alexander Zverev's ex-girlfriend Olga Sharypova has accused the German tennis player of domestic violence. She said that Zverev strangled her with a pillow in a hotel room in New York last year and hit her head against the wall. "He twisted my arms and...I was really afraid for my life," she further claimed.

news_headline: 2 Pak batsmen run towards same end & 1 dives to reach first; video goes viral
news_article: During the 26th over of their innings in the first ODI against Zimbabwe, Pakistan batsmen Imam ul Haq and Haris Sohail ran towards the same end with Imam diving to reach first to avoid getting run-out. However, the wicketkeeper missed the throw. The square-leg fielder gathered the ball and threw it towards the bowler, who dislodged stumps at non-striker's end.

news_headline: Gambhir criticises Karthik for leaving KKR captaincy mid-IPL 2020, gives his example
news_article: Ex-KKR captain Gautam Gambhir has criticised Dinesh Karthik for leaving KKR captaincy mid-IPL 2020. "It just shows the mindset. You left captaincy because you wanted to concentrate on batting...but then it hasn’t worked," he said. He added, "When I was through a [bad] phase in 2014...I got three straight ducks...It was captaincy that helped me...get back into form."

news_headline: Ruturaj Gaikwad is a young superstar in the making: Watson
news_article: Praising teammate Ruturaj Gaikwad, CSK's Shane Watson said that the 23-year-old is a "young superstar in the making". "He's so calm and composed at the crease. And the shots that he plays, not premeditating anything, wherever the ball is bowled, he takes the game on. It has been an absolute pleasure to be able to bat [with him]," Watson stated.

news_headline: I'd rather be in bio-bubble playing cricket than sit at home: Stokes
news_article: Talking about life in bio-bubble, RR all-rounder Ben Stokes said that it's "challenging" but he'd rather be in bio-bubble playing cricket than sit at home. "Being away from the family, being in the same place for a long time, it can get a bit monotonous...[but]...it's a responsibility...as professional cricketers...to keep the game going on the TV screens," he added.

news_headline: 3 defeats don't make us a bad team: DC's Ajinkya Rahane
news_article: Talking about their three consecutive defeats, DC opener Ajinkya Rahane said that results were not as per what they wanted but "this...happens in a tournament like IPL". "Losses don't make us a bad team. It's all about playing to our strength and backing each and every individual...We're really looking forward to playing against MI now and then RCB," he added.

news_headline: KXIP look different since Chris Gayle's inclusion: Graeme Swann
news_article: Former England cricketer Graeme Swann has said that since the inclusion of Chris Gayle in the playing XI of the KXIP, the franchise has looked like a "completely different" team. KXIP have won five matches in a row after Gayle's inclusion after having lost six of their seven matches. Currently, KXIP are fourth in IPL points table with 12 points.

news_headline: KXIP on rise but it's not easy to win 6 matches in a row: Aakash
news_article: Ahead of KXIP's match against RR on Friday, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said that the KL Rahul-led side, who have won five matches in a row, are on "the rise" and another win will bring them close to qualification. "[It's] a fairytale story that we are seeing...[however] it's not easy to win six...consecutive matches as this is the IPL," he added.

news_headline: Doesn't feel like we're out of the tournament: CSK's Gaikwad
news_article: After CSK defeated KKR on Thursday, batsman Ruturaj Gaikwad said that the atmosphere in their dressing room is "pretty relaxed" and it doesn't feel that they are out of the tournament. "Hopefully, we finish the tournament with a win and continue the momentum next year," he added. With 10 points from 13 matches, CSK are out of the playoffs race.

news_headline: Nobby Stiles, World Cup winner with England in 1966, dies aged 78
news_article: Former Manchester United midfielder Nobby Stiles, who lifted the 1966 World Cup with England, died aged 78 after a long illness, his family has announced. Stiles had prostate cancer and advanced dementia. He earned 28 caps for England and made 395 appearances for Manchester United between 1960-71, scoring 19 times. Stiles also served as United's youth coach for four years.

news_headline: Wasn't expecting it: Rahul on being named India vice-captain for Aus tour
news_article: On being named India limited-overs vice-captain against Australia, KL Rahul said that though he wasn't "expecting it", it's a "happy and proud moment". "I am ready for responsibility and challenge and I'll try to do my best for my team," he added. Rohit Sharma has not been included in any of Team India's squads for Australia tour over injury concerns.

news_headline: Dhoni should play some super-competitive cricket before IPL 2021: Sangakkara
news_article: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Kumar Sangakkara said that CSK captain MS Dhoni, who has scored 200 runs in 13 matches, would be "disappointed with his personal form" this IPL season and should play "some super-competitive cricket" before IPL 2021. "You can't have long gaps between your IPL seasons, not playing international cricket or not playing regional or first-class cricket," Sangakkara stated.

news_headline: Absolutely no chance: Steve Smith on playing in BBL 10
news_article: Australia batsman Steve Smith has ruled out playing in the BBL 10, citing concerns over prolonged stay in bio-secure bubbles in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. "I'll be honest with you, absolutely no chance," he stated when asked about his participation. Smith has been in bio-bubble since Australia's limited-overs tour of England in early September.

news_headline: 7.0-magnitude quake in Aegean Sea felt in Turkey & Greece
news_article: A 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck the Aegean Sea on Friday and was felt in both Turkey and Greece, the US Geological Survey said. Videos on social media showed collapsed buildings in Turkey as a result of the earthquake. Reports said the earthquake was also felt on the Greek island of Crete.

news_headline: Death toll from earthquake in Turkey and Greece rises to 19
news_article: Nineteen people have been killed in Turkey and Greece after a 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck the Aegean Sea on Friday. Turkey's disaster management agency said 17 people died, while 709 people were injured. On the Greek island of Samos, two teenagers, a boy and a girl, were found dead in an area where a wall had collapsed.

news_headline: US rapper adopts dog thrown at him by woman during racist attack
news_article: A rapper based in US' Chicago has adopted a dog that was thrown at him by a woman during a racist attack. "First thing I did was pick up the dog, make sure she was ok, and took her with me," Abel Goshu said. "I was sitting in my car, parked. The woman popped up out [of] nowhere," he added.

news_headline: Ant Man actor Paul Rudd gives cookies in rain to US voters in queue; video surfaces
news_article: A video has gone viral on social media, showing 'Ant Man' actor Paul Rudd giving out cookies to people queued up outside a New York voting centre to participate in early voting amid rain. He also got pictures clicked with the voters while sporting an 'I Voted' sticker on his jacket. Several people praised the actor for his efforts.

news_headline: What is WHO's COVID-19 vaccine insurance scheme for poor countries?
news_article: A vaccine scheme co-led by WHO is setting up a compensation fund for people in 92 low-income countries who might suffer any side-effects from COVID-19 vaccines. It would pay a lump sum based on the severity of the harm to victims from side-effects. It would be funded with a levy on vaccines distributed to poor countries and from other sources.

news_headline: There's going to be a whole lot of pain: Fauci warns of COVID-19 spread in US
news_article: Top US infectious diseases expert Dr Anthony Fauci has warned of "unrelenting" spread of coronavirus in the US, adding that the country is "going in the wrong direction". "If things don't change...there’s going to be a whole lot of pain in this country with regard to additional cases and hospitalisations, and deaths," he warned.

news_headline: Police remove posters of French Prez pasted on Mumbai road by protestors
news_article: Mumbai Police has removed the posters of French President Emmanuel Macron which were pasted by protestors on a road. Videos of people walking and cars driving on the posters have surfaced on social media. Protestors called Macron sinful after he termed the Nice knife attack in which a woman was beheaded in a church as an "Islamist terrorist attack".

news_headline: Gamer's livestream captures moment earthquake hits Turkey, video viral
news_article: Footage from a Turkish gamer's livestream has gone viral after it captured the moment a 7.0 magnitude earthquake hit the coastal city of Izmir on Friday. In the footage, 22-year-old Arda Can Özel can be seen sprinting out of the room as he feels the ground beginning to shake. He later said he and his family survived the quake unharmed.

news_headline: Video shows the moment a building collapsed in Turkey during earthquake
news_article: Witnesses have captured the moment a building fell in İzmir during a magnitude 7.0 earthquake in Turkey's Aegean region on Friday. The nation's disaster agency said the quake occurred at 2.51pm at a depth of 10 miles. "Our state has taken action with all its institutions starting from the moment of the earthquake to help those affected," Turkish President said.

news_headline: Paris sees 700-km traffic jams hours before second lockdown
news_article: Paris region saw traffic jams with a combined length of around 700 kilometres on Thursday evening, just hours before France entered its second coronavirus lockdown. Traffic jams were also reported around the cities of Lyon and Bordeaux in the hours prior to the lockdown taking effect. Many Parisians left the city to spend lockdown in the countryside, French media reported.

news_headline: 1st doses of COVID-19 vaccines could be available in Dec, Jan: Fauci
news_article: Top US infectious diseases expert Dr Anthony Fauci said if everything goes well, the first doses of COVID-19 vaccines will be available to some high-risk Americans in late December or early January. "The first interim look (at trial results) should be, we hope, within the next few weeks," he added. US has reported over 89 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

news_headline: Kenya joins global trial of Oxford's COVID-19 vaccine candidate
news_article: Kenya Medical Research Institute has said that Kenya has joined the global clinical trial of Oxford University's vaccine candidate against coronavirus. The candidate, which was jointly developed with AstraZeneca, is already being evaluated in Britain, South Africa and Brazil. The trial in Kenya will initially involve 40 frontline workers while another 360 volunteers will join at a later stage.

news_headline: Policies used in India helped stop abuse before US polls: Zuckerberg
news_article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the policies that Facebook used during elections in countries like India and Indonesia have helped in stopping abuse ahead of US elections. Zuckerberg noted that the next week will be a test for Facebook in the US. He added Facebook is focused on issues like voter suppression and has worked with experts in the space.

news_headline: Walmart removes firearms from US store floors ahead of election
news_article: Walmart has temporarily removed firearms and ammunition from the sales floors of its US stores as a precaution, citing isolated incidents of civil unrest in some areas. The move comes days ahead of the November 3 presidential election. In June, the retailer pulled the firearms from some stores amid protests over black man George Floyd's death in police custody.

news_headline: Remains of 59 bodies found in hidden graves in Mexico
news_article: The remains of 59 bodies, mostly belonging to young people, have been discovered in hidden graves in the Mexican state of Guanajuato, national authorities said on Wednesday. Violence in Guanajuato has increased in recent months amid a raging turf war between rival drug cartels. The state reported over 2,250 homicides in the first eight months of this year.

news_headline: 6 killed, millions without power as Hurricane Zeta hits US Gulf Coast
news_article: At least six people have been killed in the southeast of the United States after Hurricane Zeta hit the Gulf Coast on Wednesday. Over two million people were left without electricity on Thursday after the power lines snapped due to strong winds and heavy rain. Hurricane Zeta weakened into a tropical storm on Thursday and has moved northeast.

news_headline: 1,119 military personnel killed in conflict so far: Nagorno-Karabakh
news_article: The defence ministry of the Nagorno-Karabakh region on Thursday said that 51 more casualties have taken its military death toll to 1,119. The fighting between Armenian and Azerbaijani forces began on September 27. Earlier, both nations had accused each other of killing civilians by shelling cities in and around the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh.

news_headline: US seizes Iranian missiles, sanctions 11 entities over Iran oil dealings
news_article: The US Justice Department on Thursday revealed that the country had seized Iranian missiles shipped to Yemen and sold 1.1 million barrels of previously seized Iranian oil that was bound for Venezuela. The announcement came on the same day that US Treasury Department and State Department imposed sanctions on 11 entities for buying and selling Iranian petrochemicals.

news_headline: Former Turkish Prime Minister Mesut Yilmaz passes away at 72
news_article: Former Turkish Prime Minister Mesut Yilmaz has passed away aged 72 after a long battle with lung cancer, the official Anadolu news agency reported. He died on Friday in an Istanbul hospital where he was receiving treatment. Yilmaz served as the prime minister three times in the 1990s and had also led the Motherland Party from 1991 to 2002.

news_headline: We're in war against Islamist ideology, more attacks likely: France
news_article: More attacks on the French soil are likely as France is engaged in a "war against Islamist ideology", the country's Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said. "We are in a war against an enemy that is both inside and outside," he added. His comments came a day after a woman was beheaded in a knife attack at a church in Nice.

news_headline: Vote for President Trump is a vote for a better America: Melania
news_article: Speaking at her first joint rally with her husband Donald Trump this year, First Lady Melania Trump said "a vote for President Trump is a vote for a better America." "We've a law and order president. Donald fights to protect and support all our people," she added. She further said that "economy soared and unemployment shrank" during his presidency.

news_headline: Armenia, Azerbaijan meet mediators in Geneva to resolve conflict
news_article: The foreign ministers of Armenia and Azerbaijan met international mediators in Geneva on Friday to resolve the conflict in the Nagorno-Karabakh region. Three previous ceasefires, brokered by Russia and the US, have failed to halt the fighting that began on September 27. Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan said he believed the principle of 'remedial secession' should be applied to Nagorno-Karabakh.

news_headline: 4 killed, 120 injured after 7.0 magnitude earthquake hits Turkey
news_article: Turkey's disaster management authority on Friday said that at least four people were killed and 120 injured after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Aegean coast of the country. The death toll included one person who had drowned. Around six buildings collapsed in coastal city of Izmir, the interior ministry said. The earthquake was also felt in parts of Greece.

news_headline: Tanzanian Prez Magufuli wins re-election; opposition alleges fraud
news_article: Tanzania's President John Magufuli has won re-election with a landslide victory that the opposition dismissed as a "travesty". The Election Commission said Magufuli received 12.5 million votes, while his main rival Tundu Lissu secured 1.9 million votes.  Lissu rejected the presidential election results alleging "widespread irregularities" and called for peaceful protests against it.

news_headline: France church attack suspect identified as 21-yr-old Tunisian man
news_article: The man suspected of killing three people in a knife attack at a church in France's Nice on Thursday has been identified as a Tunisian migrant born in 1999. Chief anti-terrorist prosecutor Jean-Francois Ricard said he had arrived in France earlier this month. Tunisia opened an investigation into the suspicion that a Tunisian committed "a terrorist crime" outside national borders.

news_headline: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Keshubhai Patel passes away at 92
news_article: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Keshubhai Patel passed away on Thursday at the age of 92. He was admitted to Sterling Hospital in Ahmedabad following difficulty in breathing. Patel had tested positive for COVID-19 in September however he later tested negative.  Patel served as the Chief Minister of Gujarat in 1995 and from 1998 to 2001.

news_headline: Vijayvargiya's 'Chunnu-Munnu' remark for Nath, Digvijaya violated poll code: EC
news_article: The Election Commission on Friday said the "Chunnu-Munnu" remarks made by BJP's Kailash Vijayvargiya against Congress' Digvijaya Singh and Kamal Nath were in violation of the poll code provisions ahead of bypolls in Madhya Pradesh. Vijayvargiya also called the two leaders traitors. EC advised him not to use "any such word" in his public utterances during the model code period.

news_headline: Project took 9 yrs, 2 govts, 8 chairmen: Gadkari to officials over delay
news_article: While inaugurating the new NHAI headquarters, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari asked, "How can I congratulate you when it took 9 years to finish the project?" Gadkari said two governments and eight chairmen had passed through the organisation. Stating that the current chairman is unrelated to the delay, he requested "photos of the great personalities" responsible for it to be displayed.

news_headline: Keshubhai mentored me, I'm deeply pained: PM on ex-Guj CM's demise
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday took to Twitter to pay his condolences after the demise of former Gujarat Chief Minister Keshubhai Patel. He wrote, "Keshubhai mentored and groomed many younger Karyakartas including me...I am deeply pained and saddened." PM Modi added, "He resisted the Emergency tooth and nail. Issues of farmer welfare were closest to his heart."

news_headline: WB Deputy Speaker Sukumar Hansda passes away; CM offers condolences
news_article: West Bengal Assembly Deputy Speaker Sukumar Hansda died of cancer at a private hospital in Kolkata on Thursday, a report said. Hansda was diagnosed with prostate cancer earlier this year and was being treated for the last few months, Assembly Speaker Biman Banerjee said. "His relentless service for people shall always be remembered," CM Mamata Banerjee tweeted.

news_headline: Centre has turned J&K into a big jail: Mehbooba Mufti
news_article: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti on Thursday said the Central government is using all its powers to oppress Kashmiris and has turned J&K into a jail. The party leaders were arrested on Thursday morning after they tried to stage a protest against land laws issued by the Centre. "They are not allowing anyone to talk. Their approach is communal," Mufti added.

news_headline: Didn't think Bihar CM could stoop so low: Chirag on viral video
news_article: Reacting to the viral video that showed him instructing a cameraman how to shoot his video in front of his late father Ram Vilas Paswan's portrait, LJP President Chirag Paswan said, "Didn't think that (Bihar's) Chief Minister could stoop so low. It's surprising." "Do I need to prove Nitish Kumar how sad I am about my father's death," Chirag asked.

news_headline: CPI(M) leader's son taken into custody by ED in B'luru drug case
news_article: Bineesh Kodiyeri, son of CPI(M) leader Kodiyeri Balakrishnan, was on Thursday taken into custody by the ED in Bengaluru for his links to an accused in the drug peddling cases. Bineesh has been questioned two times by the ED in relation to this case. His name surfaced when Anoop Mohammed, a native of Kochi, was held by NCB and questioned.

news_headline: Rahul Gandhi has no political 'aukaat' left, says RS Prasad
news_article: Addressing a rally in Bihar amid the Assembly elections on Wednesday, Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "Rahul Gandhi has no political 'aukaat' left... Nobody takes him seriously." Prasad made the statement after Rahul Gandhi said that "It is a matter of worry that the PM’s effigy was being torched" instead of Ravana's during Dussehra.

news_headline: 5 BSP MLAs withdraw support to party’s Rajya Sabha nominee
news_article: Five BSP legislators have withdrawn their support to the party's official candidate, Ramji Gautam, for the Rajya Sabha elections. Aslam Raini, Aslam Chaudhary, Mujtaba Siddiqui, Hakim Lal Bind and Hargovind Bhargava informed the returning officers that their signatures as proposers for Gautam were forged. The by-election to 10 Rajya Sabha seats in Uttar Pradesh will be held on November 9.

news_headline: Digvijaya told me to withdraw: SP bypoll candidate on alleged audio clip
news_article: After a purported audio clip of MP Congress leader Digvijaya Singh allegedly asking SP's Gwalior bypoll candidate Roshan Mirza to withdraw his candidature went viral, Mirza said, "Digvijaya Singh called me and told me to withdraw...He said he will give me the councillor's ticket." However, Mirza added, "I told him I will not withdraw and will contest the bypoll."

news_headline: Farooq Abdullah stopped from leaving house to offer prayers: NC
news_article: The National Conference (NC) on Friday claimed that Jammu and Kashmir administration prevented its president Farooq Abdullah from leaving his residence to offer prayers at the Hazratbal shrine in Srinagar, on the occasion of Milad-un-Nabi. The administration "blocked" Abdullah's residence, the party said. "JKNC condemns this infringement of fundamental right to pray," it added.

news_headline: FIR against Bihar minister for coming to vote in mask with BJP symbol
news_article: An FIR has been lodged against Bihar's Agriculture Minister Prem Kumar for violating the model code of conduct, after he went to cast his vote in the state Assembly elections wearing a mask with the BJP's lotus symbol. Kumar said, "I went to vote forgetting to remove the mask with the BJP symbol lotus. Soon after realising, I removed it."

news_headline: Everyone free to choose their party: Pilot as Scindia called 'traitor'
news_article: When asked about Congress leaders calling BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia a traitor, Congress' Sachin Pilot responded, "I believe everyone is free to decide which party they want to be in." Pilot added, "The public ultimately decides who is wrong or right." Scindia had quit the Congress to join the BJP earlier this year.

news_headline: Yediyurappa won't be Karnataka CM after Bihar polls: Siddaramaiah
news_article: Leader of Opposition in Karnataka Siddaramaiah said that BS Yediyurappa will not remain the Karnataka CM after the Bihar Assembly elections. "I have accurate information from New Delhi...don't know if the BJP government will complete its term after Yediyurappa is made to resign," he added. "In case the government cannot continue, we are ready to fight elections," Siddaramaiah further said.

news_headline: Rahul tweets seeking votes on polling day in Bihar, BJP complains to EC
news_article: The BJP has filed a complaint to Election Commission against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his tweet in which he asked for votes even as polling began for the Bihar Assembly Elections. "This time for justice, employment, farmers-workers, your vote should be only for 'Mahagathbandhan'," Gandhi tweeted. BJP sought legal action against him for violation of Model Code of Conduct.

news_headline: Mayawati suspends 7 MLAs for opposing BSP's Rajya Sabha nominee
news_article: BSP chief Mayawati has suspended seven MLAs with immediate effect, citing their involvement in anti-party activities. The suspended MLAs include Chaudhary Aslam Ali, Hakim Lal Bind, Mohammad Mujtaba Siddiqui, Aslam Rainee, Sushma Patel, Hargovind Bhargava, and Bandana Singh. They had opposed the nomination of the party's official candidate Ramji Gautam for the elections to the Rajya Sabha.

news_headline: Don't want to react: Tejashwi on PM's 'Yuvraj of Jungle Raj' remark
news_article: Commenting on PM Narendra Modi's 'Yuvraj of Jungle Raj' remark, RJD's Tejashwi Yadav said that he doesn't want to react to it and added that PM should have spoken on issues like poverty, farmers, unemployment. Tejashwi added, "It is the world's biggest party (BJP), they are using 30 helicopters...if their PM talks like this, the public knows everything."

news_headline: Will even vote for BJP to defeat SP in future MLC polls: Mayawati
news_article: BSP chief Mayawati has said her party will leave no stone unturned to ensure Samajwadi Party's defeat in future Member of Legislative Council elections in Uttar Pradesh. "Even if we have to give our vote to a BJP candidate or any other party candidate, we'll do it," she added. SP is "revealing its true anti-Dalit face once again", Mayawati alleged.

news_headline: US rapper adopts dog thrown at him by woman during racist attack
news_article: A rapper based in US' Chicago has adopted a dog that was thrown at him by a woman during a racist attack. "First thing I did was pick up the dog, make sure she was ok, and took her with me," Abel Goshu said. "I was sitting in my car, parked. The woman popped up out [of] nowhere," he added.

news_headline: I was molested at the age of 3: Fatima Sana Shaikh
news_article: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh has revealed she was molested at the age of three. "[That's] how deep sexism goes. It's a battle we fight on everyday basis. Every woman, every minority fights it everyday," she added. Fatima further said, "I've faced people telling me...the only way to get a job is through sex. So that has also happened to me."

news_headline: Kajal Aggarwal gets married to Gautam Kitchlu, first pic surfaces
news_article: Actress Kajal Aggarwal tied the knot with entrepreneur Gautam Kitchlu in Mumbai on Friday. The first picture from their wedding ceremony has surfaced online, showing Kajal in a scarlet bridal ensemble styled with a pale pink embellished dupatta. Around 50 guests including friends and family members attended the wedding.

news_headline: Kajal Aggarwal shares pic with lehenga in background ahead of her wedding
news_article: Actress Kajal Aggarwal, who is set to tie the knot with entrepreneur Gautam Kitchlu today, took to Instagram to share a picture of herself with lehenga in the background. "Calm before the storm #kajgautkitched," she captioned the picture. Commenting on the picture, actor Sonu Sood wrote, "Congratulations buddy...party is due."

news_headline: Don't know about upbringing his mom gave him: Kumar Sanu on son's remark on Marathi
news_article: Singer Kumar Sanu has apologised for his son Jaan's remark on Marathi language in 'Bigg Boss 14'. Jaan had reportedly asked fellow contestant Nikki Tamboli to not speak in Marathi as it irked him. "Don't know about the upbringing his mother gave him...I fail to understand how Jaan could've said [it]. As a father I can only apologise," Sanu said.

news_headline: Mahesh's sister, nephew seek written apology, ₹90L in damages from Luviena
news_article: Mahesh Bhatt's sister Kumkum Saigal and her son, Sahil, have moved the Mumbai City Civil Court, seeking a permanent injunction against Luviena Lodh from making defamatory statements against them, a written apology and ₹90 lakh in damages. Luviena, in a video, had accused Mahesh and his family of harassing her. She also called Mahesh "the biggest don of the industry".

news_headline: Will rectify scene: Mirzapur 2 makers apologise to author Surender Mohan Pathak
news_article: The makers of 'Mirzapur 2' have apologised to author Surender Mohan Pathak who had accused them of depicting his book 'Dhabba' as "sheer porno" in the show. Excel Entertainment shared a statement on Twitter which was signed by the show's creator Puneet Krishna. "We'd like to assure you that to rectify this situation...we'll blur...book-cover...or remove...VO within...3 weeks," the statement read.

news_headline: Ant Man actor Paul Rudd gives cookies in rain to US voters in queue; video surfaces
news_article: A video has gone viral on social media, showing 'Ant Man' actor Paul Rudd giving out cookies to people queued up outside a New York voting centre to participate in early voting amid rain. He also got pictures clicked with the voters while sporting an 'I Voted' sticker on his jacket. Several people praised the actor for his efforts.

news_headline: I was told 'You would never be a heroine, you don't look like Deepika': Fatima
news_article: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh recently opened up about facing rejections in the film industry. She said, "I was told, 'You would never be a heroine. You don't look like Deepika, you don't look like Aishwarya'." Fatima added, "But there are opportunities now, there are films being made for people like me, who don't look like supermodels, who look normal, average."

news_headline: I can't do these gimmicks & fall in my own eyes: Sukhwinder on fake likes controversy
news_article: Reacting to musicians and singers buying fake views and likes in exchange of money, singer Sukhwinder Singh said, "The singing and the liveliness of the voice can’t be bought by any amount of money." He added, "In today’s time, there’s only one king, Sukhwinder Singh, who can’t do these harkatein (gimmicks) and fall in his own eyes," he added.

news_headline: Had forgotten how to face camera: Ananya on resuming work after 6 months
news_article: Talking about resuming work after six months, actress Ananya Panday, who's shooting for her upcoming film with Deepika Padukone and Siddhant Chaturvedi in Goa, said that she was a little nervous and afraid on the first day. She added that she had forgotten how to face the camera. "But it was smooth sailing from day one," Ananya further said.

news_headline: I love laughing at myself: Renuka on 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun' memes
news_article: Reacting to the memes featuring her character's death scene from the 1994 film 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun', actress Renuka Shahane said she loves laughing at herself. "I don't take the characters too seriously or feel offended if people use it in quirky ways," she added. She said the memes are keeping the scene alive in people's minds.

news_headline: Whedon denies Fisher's claim that he altered 'Justice League' actor's skin tone
news_article: 'Justice League' director Joss Whedon has denied Ray Fisher's claim that the complexion of an actor of colour was digitally altered in the film. Joss' spokesperson said, "The individual who offered this statement acknowledged that this was just something...he heard from someone else...when in fact simple research would prove...it was false." Earlier, Ray had accused Joss of toxic on-set behaviour.

news_headline: Excited to work with Ishaan, Mrunal & Priyanshu: 'Pippa' director
news_article: Director Raja Krishna Menon has said he's very excited to work with Mrunal Thakur, Priyanshu Painyuli and Ishaan Khatter in the upcoming film 'Pippa'. "With Mrunal and Priyanshu joining Ishaan, we've three of...most exciting young actors coming together," he added. "I'm very excited to work with such extraordinary young talent and look forward to...energy they bring to 'Pippa'," Raja said.

news_headline: Tara Sutaria to team up with Tiger Shroff for 'Heropanti 2'
news_article: Actress Tara Sutaria will reunite with her 'Student of the Year 2' co-star Tiger Shroff for the second instalment of his action film 'Heropanti'. Announcing the news on social media, Tara wrote, "Thank you Sajid sir, for believing in me...Heropanti 2, here we go." The film will be directed by Ahmed Khan and shooting will reportedly begin in December.

news_headline: My parents' achievements gave me a comfortable life: Sikandar Kher
news_article: Speaking about the advantages of being a star kid in Bollywood, actor Sikandar Kher said, "Whatever my parents (Kirron Kher and Anupam Kher) have achieved in their lives has given me a more comfortable life." When asked about being compared to his parents, he said, "Those things don't bother me...if I start worrying about that then I am finished."

news_headline: Actress Payal Ghosh tests negative for COVID-19
news_article: Actress Payal Ghosh took to Twitter on Friday to announce that she has tested negative for coronavirus. "Thank you, everyone, for all your love...stay safe & take care of yourself," she wrote. The actress took the test after she joined the Republican Party of India (A) in the presence of Union Minister Ramdas Athawale, who tested positive for the virus.

news_headline: Salman shot London Dreams concert scenes in spite of losing his dogs: Director
news_article: Director Vipul Amrutlal Shah, while recalling the shooting of his 2009 film 'London Dreams', said, "We'd two days of shooting sequences of musical concerts, one month apart from each other." He added, "Both...times, Salman (Khan) lost his dogs. In spite of losing dogs...he continued to shoot and after pack up at 6-7 am, he...completed the funeral...and reported back...at 4 pm."

news_headline: Don't need a man opposite Katrina in the superhero film: Director Ali
news_article: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar, who has collaborated with Katrina Kaif for a superhero film, has said there will be no male actor in the film. "I don't need...man opposite Katrina in this film. She herself is...hero as well," he said. Ali added the film will be mounted on a huge scale and Katrina won't have a romantic track in it.

news_headline: Hope OTT platforms don’t think only stars bring in audiences: Rasika
news_article: Actress Rasika Dugal, who has starred in web-series like 'Delhi Crime', 'Out of Love' and 'Mirzapur', said, "I hope OTT platforms...don't start thinking that only stars bring in audiences." She stated that the digital platforms are prioritising good content over chasing numbers. "The competition is to generate more interesting content versus who can hit a certain number," she added.

news_headline: It's going to be scary: Kriti on resuming shoot amid COVID-19
news_article: Actress Kriti Kharbanda has said she will soon start shooting for the first time during the coronavirus pandemic, adding that it is going to be scary and difficult. "But, recently when I took...flight to Delhi, it made me realise we need to move. We need to...learn to protect oneself," she added. She'll begin shooting for a film titled '14 Phere'.

news_headline: Cinema-loving audience will always be there: Saqib on theatre vs OTT debate
news_article: Saqib Saleem, while commenting on the debate over OTT vs theatres, said that both the platforms can co-exist very happily. "There will be a lot of OTT work in the coming years but...cinema-loving audience will always be there," he added. "There will always be films like 'Sooryavanshi', 'Baahubali', the big-ticket films you really want to go to...theatres for," Saqib said.

news_headline: Deepa Mehta's 'Funny Boy' becomes Canada's official entry for Oscars
news_article: Indo-Canadian filmmaker Deepa Mehta's film 'Funny Boy' is Canada's official entry for the 93rd Academy Awards in the Best International Feature Film category. If selected by the Academy, this will be the second time that the director will be competing for the award in the category. In 2007, Deepa's film 'Water' was Oscar-nominated in the International Feature Film category.

news_headline: Kept myself busy to stay sane: Shireen on battling COVID-19
news_article: TV actress Shireen Mirza, while talking about dealing with coronavirus, said, "It was absolute learning for me, from how to enjoy my own company to taking online make-up courses." She added that she kept herself busy and occupied to stay sane. "It was tiring being quarantined alone for so many days but I read a lot which helped," Shireen said.

news_headline: I fear that there will soon be a khichdi on OTT medium: Saurabh
news_article: Noting that various web platforms are coming up with online content, actor Saurabh Sachdeva said he fears that the constant flow of content might end up confusing the audiences. "I'm just scared that it just doesn't become a khichdi...so much is happening online that it might create a situation of too much confusion," the 'Sacred Games 2' star said.

news_headline: Maharashtra invites Tesla, holds video call with its executives
news_article: Maharashtra has invited US electric-car maker Tesla, weeks after its Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk suggested entering India next year. In a tweet on Thursday, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said he and Industries Minister Subhash Desai held a video call with Tesla executives earlier in the day to invite them to the state.

news_headline: NASA announces discovery of water on sunlit surface of Moon
news_article: NASA on Monday announced that its Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) has confirmed there's water on the sunlit surface of the Moon. This discovery indicates that water may be distributed across the lunar surface, and not limited to cold, shadowed places. SOFIA has detected water molecules (H2O) in Clavius Crater, one of the largest craters visible from Earth.

news_headline: Giant manta ray weighing 750 kg caught by fisherman off Karnataka coast, pics surface
news_article: A fisherman who went for deep sea fishing in Mangaluru off Malpe port on Wednesday caught two giant manta rays weighing 750 kg and 250 kg. After Subhash Sailan returned to the shore, a crane was brought in to put the giant manta rays in a pick-up truck. Images and videos of the haul have gone viral on social media.

news_headline: Evidence of 'lost' river that ran through Thar Desert 1,72,000 years ago found
news_article: Researchers have found evidence of a 'lost' river that ran through the central Thar Desert, near Bikaner, as early as 1,72,000 years ago. The findings published in the journal Quaternary Science Reviews represent the oldest directly dated phase of river activity at Nal Quarry in the central Thar Desert. The river would've offered a lifeline to Paleolithic populations, researchers said.

news_headline: Scientists accidentally discover new organ in human throat
news_article: While studying prostate cancer and examining a new combination of CT and PET scans, researchers at the Netherlands Cancer Institute discovered a new set of salivary glands, about 3.81 cm in length, in human throat. The new glands, named tubarial salivary glands, are believed to lubricate and moisten the area of the throat behind the nose and mouth.

news_headline: 1st space station crew to launch during the pandemic return after 196 days
news_article: NASA astronaut Chris Cassidy and Russian cosmonauts Anatoly Ivanishin and Ivan Vagner returned to Earth on Thursday after spending 196 days at the International Space Station. The crew launched to the space station on April 9, just weeks after WHO declared COVID-19 a pandemic. They landed back on the steppe of Kazakhstan, NASA said.

news_headline: Rare white sea turtle with leucism condition found; pics surface
news_article: Volunteers who were checking sea turtle nests on a South Carolina beach found a rare white sea turtle hatchling crawling across the sand. The town of Kiawah Island shared pictures of the rare turtle on its Facebook Page and informed the turtle has a genetic condition called leucism where animals have reduced pigmentation. The condition is described as extremely rare.

news_headline: 50-year-old problem of biology solved by Artificial Intelligence
news_article: DeepMind's AI system 'AlphaFold' has been recognised as a solution to "protein folding", a grand challenge in biology for over 50 years. DeepMind showed it can predict how proteins fold into 3D shapes, a complex process that is fundamental to understanding the biological machinery of life. AlphaFold can predict the shape of proteins within the width of an atom.

news_headline: Microsoft Teams to stop working on Internet Explorer 11 from Nov 30
news_article: Microsoft Teams will stop working on Internet Explorer 11 from today, November 30. Users will now need to download the Teams app or browse it on Microsoft Edge. Besides this, Microsoft 365 apps and services will stop supporting Internet Explorer 11 by August 2021. Microsoft will also pull support for Microsoft Edge Legacy desktop app on March 9.

news_headline: Hope US won't erect barriers to cooperation: China on blacklist report
news_article: China, in response to reports of US adding Chinese chipmaker SMIC and national offshore oil producer CNOOC to a defence blacklist, said that it hoped US will not erect barriers and obstacles to cooperation. Reuters reported that President Donald Trump's administration is poised to add SMIC and CNOOC to a list of companies allegedly owned or controlled by Chinese military.

news_headline: Global smartphone sales in Q3 falls 5.7% to 36.6 cr units: Gartner
news_article: The global smartphone sales in the third quarter of 2020 fell by 5.7% year-on-year to 36.6 crore units, according to Gartner. Overall global mobile phone sales to end users totalled 40.1 crore units, a decline of 8.7% year-on-year. Samsung held the top position with a market share of 22%, followed by Huawei with 14.1%.

news_headline: EU hoping Biden will clarify US position on digital tax: Report
news_article: The European Union (EU) is hoping that US President-elect Joe Biden's incoming administration will clarify US position on digital taxation within two months of taking office, a French Finance Ministry source told Reuters. The bloc-wide tax would apply on digital services offered by companies such as Google and Amazon.

news_headline: Parliamentary panel divided over key issues in Data Protection Bill: Report
news_article: The members of the Joint Parliamentary Committee are divided over key issues in the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019, such as the provision allowing government access to sensitive data of citizens without their consent and data localisation, ET reported. The panel, chaired by BJP MP Meenakashi Lekhi, has held consultations with stakeholders like Facebook, Twitter, Google, Ola, Uber and Paytm.

news_headline: Google, Facebook sign French govt's 'Tech for Good' initiative
news_article: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Microsoft President Brad Smith are among the 75 executives of technology companies to sign the French government's 'Tech for Good' initiative. The initiative seeks to get global tech companies to publicly commit to principles including paying their fair share of taxes. Amazon and Apple were absent from the list.

news_headline: Facebook could soon face its 1st antitrust suit by US govt: Report
news_article: Facebook could soon face the first antitrust action against it by the US government as federal and state authorities are preparing to file new lawsuits against Facebook and Google, WSJ reported. The authorities are probing if the firms abused their power in the internet economy and are readying as many as four cases by January-end.

news_headline: Canada plans digital tax on tech majors like Facebook, Google
news_article: Canada's Finance Department on Monday said it plans to impose a tax on corporations such as Facebook and Google that provide digital services from January 2022. It added that it expects to raise $2.6 billion in revenues over five years through the tax and that it will stay till a common approach among nations is agreed upon.

news_headline: Twitter's 'Audio Spaces' to include transcriptions, speaker controls: Report
news_article: Twitter's "Audio Spaces", that will allow users to gather in dedicated spaces for live conversations, will reportedly include the option to view transcriptions of the chat and the ability to manage who can speak at any time. According to tech analyst Jane Manchun Wong, conversations on "Spaces" will not be recorded and the feature will use Periscope for its backend.

news_headline: US FCC Chairman Ajit Pai to step down on January 20
news_article: US Federal Communications Commission Chairman Ajit Pai has announced that he will step down from his position on January 20. He will be leaving office on the same day as President-elect Joe Biden's inauguration. Previously, former FCC Chairman Tom Wheeler had left office on 20th January 2017, the day President Donald Trump was sworn in.

news_headline: Tokyo Stock Exchange CEO to resign over outage that halted trading for a day
news_article: Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) President and CEO Koichiro Miyahara will step down to accept responsibility over a system failure last month that resulted in the first all-day stoppage of trading since the exchange switched to all-electronic trading in 1999. Akira Kiyota, the Group CEO of Japan Exchange Group that runs the TSE, will temporarily take over Miyahara's role.

news_headline: Bitcoin hits new high at over $19,860, surges over 150% in 2020
news_article: Cryptocurrency Bitcoin on Monday briefly surged to record a new all-time high at more than $19,860 after three years. Bitcoin's previous record of $19,665 was set in December 2017. The virtual currency fell as low as $3,136 within 12 months of hitting the previous record. The latest development pushes this year's Bitcoin surge to more than 150%.

news_headline: Ant Group's IPO may not be revived before 2022: Report
news_article: Jack Ma-owned Ant Group's initial public offering (IPO) may not be revived before 2022 as the company is still in the early stages of reviewing changes needed to appease the regulators, officials told Bloomberg. There's so much work needed and some rules are not yet spelled out, they added. Ant's $35-billion IPO was poised to become the largest IPO ever.

news_headline: Italy fines Apple $12M for 'misleading' water-resistant iPhone ads
news_article: Italy's antitrust body has fined Apple $12 million for "aggressive and misleading" commercial practices regarding iPhones. The regulator said Apple advertised that several iPhone models were water-resistant without clarifying they were only so under certain circumstances. It added that Apple's disclaimer of the models not being covered by warranty in case of damage from liquids tricked clients.

news_headline: Theme park with interactive Mario Kart rollercoaster to open in Japan in Feb
news_article: Universal Studios Japan announced its Nintendo theme park, Super Nintendo World, will be opening on February 4. The park will feature a Mario Kart rollercoaster set inside Bowser's castle. The ride will use AR and projection-mapping technology and let users compete against each other. Visitors will also be able to collect virtual coins while roaming around with a Switch console.

news_headline: General Motors to not acquire 11% stake in Nikola
news_article: General Motors (GM) and Nikola on Monday announced a reworked deal that replaced their previous agreement under which GM would acquire 11% equity stake in the startup and produce the proposed electric pickup Badger. The companies have instead signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding which is subject to negotiation. Nikola was previously accused of fraud by a short seller.

news_headline: Facebook buys customer service startup Kustomer for a reported $1 bn
news_article: Facebook on Monday confirmed it has acquired Kustomer, a startup specialising in customer-service platforms and chatbots, for a reported sum of $1 billion. Kustomer was last valued at $710 million in a funding round roughly a year ago. Facebook-owned WhatsApp's COO Matt Idema said their aim with Kustomer is to "give businesses access to best-in-class tools that deliver excellent service".

news_headline: Ex-Tesla factory worker to pay about ₹3 cr to settle case with Musk
news_article: A former Tesla factory worker has agreed to pay the company around ₹3 crore ($400,000) after admitting to illegally telling reporters that the company will not reach CEO Elon Musk’s publicly stated goal of producing 5,000 Model 3s a week. Musk and the former employee Martin Tripp had also traded insults publicly after Tripp was fired because of his misconduct.

news_headline: Global 5G subscriptions to rise to 22 crore by year end: Ericsson
news_article: Swedish telecom company Ericsson on Monday raised its global forecast for 5G mobile subscriptions from 19 crore to 22 crore by the end of 2020. Ericsson's Business Area Networks head Fredrik Jejdling said that nearly 100 crore people are expected to be in an area that would be covered by 5G by the end of the year.

news_headline: Bitcoin is gold 2.0, will soar to $500,000: Winklevoss twins
news_article: Cryptocurrency trade platform Gemini Co-founders Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss said they believe "bitcoin is gold 2.0" and that its price could soar to $500,000. Cameron added that bitcoin's 177% surge this year is due to an increasing number of investors realising that it is the best defence against inflation. The brothers remarked that bitcoin is an emergent store of value.

news_headline: Trump loses 133,000 Twitter followers in 2 weeks, Biden gains 1.1 mn
news_article: President Donald Trump has lost 133,902 followers since November 17 while president-elect Joe Biden has gained around 1.15 million, according to Factbase. The website, which tracks Donald Trump's social media activities closely, has measured small declines for Trump for 11 days in a row now. Trump currently has 88.8 million followers, while Joe Biden has 20.2 million.

news_headline: Biden urged by 33 advocacy groups to reject 'Big Tech' influence
news_article: US President-elect Joe Biden has been urged by 33 antitrust, consumer advocacy and labour groups to reject the influence of 'Big Tech' companies on his administration. They've asked the administration to exclude executives and consultants working for or with companies such as Facebook, Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Apple, arguing that their business practices hurt consumers and the US economy.

news_headline: Samsung may discontinue Galaxy Note smartphones next year: Reports
news_article: South Korean tech giant Samsung may discontinue its premium Galaxy Note smartphone next year, reported Reuters. The company reportedly won't develop a new version of Note in 2021 and instead will focus on Galaxy S and its foldable phone range. Launched in 2011, Note helped Samsung overtake Apple as the largest smartphone maker for the first time that year.

news_headline: Instagram 'Live Rooms' to let 4 users stream simultaneously in India
news_article: Instagram on Tuesday said it has rolled out its 'Live Rooms' feature in India, which enables users to go live with up to three additional people. Earlier, users could go live with only one additional person. India is one of the first countries to roll it out broadly and the feature will be available to everyone soon, Instagram said.

news_headline: Anushka does shirshasana during pregnancy with Kohli's support, shares throwback pic
news_article: Anushka Sharma took to social media to share a throwback picture of herself doing shirshasana during her pregnancy with the support of her husband Virat Kohli. "[I] used the wall for support and also my very able husband supporting my balance, to be extra safe," she wrote. She added, "I'm so glad I could continue my practice through my pregnancy."

news_headline: It annoys the hell out of me: Ian Chappell urges ICC to ban 'switch hit'
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Ian Chappell has urged ICC to ban 'switch hit' shot which Glenn Maxwell and David Warner recently played against India, saying, "It annoys the hell out of me." "I'd prefer to see a contest rather than batting exhibitions," Chappell said. "When...a batsman...completely become the opposite-handed batsman...[after the bowler has delivered]...then it's not fair," he added.

news_headline: My little boy has asked me to wake him up whenever Kohli comes to bat: Vaughan
news_article: Talking about Team India captain Virat Kohli's impact on children, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said, "My little boy...always asks me to wake him up when Kohli comes out to bat. As soon as Kohli gets out, he goes back inside to do something else." He further said, "Kohli is that powerful with the kids."

news_headline: It does feel nice: Babar Azam on comparison with Virat Kohli
news_article: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said it feels nice to be compared to a very good player like Virat Kohli. "Comparisons with big players also help you to set goals that match those of the big players," said Babar. Both Virat and Babar are the only two batsmen right now, who are in the ICC's top 10 rankings in all formats.

news_headline: Dwayne Smith smashes six sixes in an over against his brother in T10 match
news_article: Ex-West Indies batsman Dwayne Smith smashed six sixes in an over for Errol Holder Stars against his brother Kemar Smith in the final of the A&A Auto Parts Errol Holder Ten10 Classic tournament. CRB's Kemar was hit for six maximums in the first over of the match as their mother looked on. Later, Dwayne dismissed Kemar for a golden duck.

news_headline: It would be nicer if Warner gets injured for a long time, jokes KL Rahul
news_article: Reacting to Australia opener David Warner sustaining a groin injury in the second ODI, Team India wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul joked, "It would be nicer if he gets injured for a long time. He's one of their main batsmen." He added, "If his injury takes a long time, it would be good for our team."

news_headline: F1 driver who escaped burning car after 225-kmph crash shares video from hospital
news_article: Formula One driver Romain Grosjean, whose car burst into flames and split into two after a 225-kmph crash at the Bahrain Grand Prix, took to social media to share a video from hospital. "Hello everyone, I just wanted to say I am ok, well, sort of ok," Grosjean said in the video showing his bandaged hands.

news_headline: Maradona's daughter breaks down as football team gives her ovation, video surfaces
news_article: Dalma Maradona, daughter of late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona, broke down as Boca Juniors players gave her an ovation while paying tribute to her father during their game against Newell’s Old Boys. Dalma was sitting in her father's box at Bombonera Stadium, when Boca players went to the touchline and laid down a Maradona shirt after scoring a goal.

news_headline: If India win Test series vs Aus without Kohli, they can celebrate for a year: Clarke
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke has said India can celebrate for a year if they can beat Australia in the Test series without Virat Kohli. "That will be an unbelievable win. I think that’s the way Indian players have to look at it. They've to believe they're good enough to take on and beat this Australian team," the 39-year-old added.

news_headline: I would love to see India, Pakistan play bilateral cricket again: ICC Chairman
news_article: ICC Chairman Greg Barclay has said that he would love "nothing more" than for India and Pakistan to be able to continue cricketing relations as they were previously. "I’m also enough of a realist to understand that there are geo-political issues at play here," he further said. He added that ICC doesn't have the mandate to influence India-Pakistan ties.

news_headline: Warner's wife jokingly suggests sex reason behind his injury, says 'Sorry Australia'
news_article: During a radio show, Australia batsman David Warner's wife Candice jokingly suggested that sex was the reason behind David Warner's groin injury which he sustained in the second ODI against India. "We only sort of reunited after four months apart...and everyone's like, 'What have you done to him?''' she said. She further said, "Sorry, Australia!"

news_headline: Cricket Aus terrified of BCCI, breached contract for them: Channel 7
news_article: Amidst a contract battle, broadcaster Channel 7 has claimed that Cricket Australia (CA) is "terrified" of the BCCI. The channel has already taken the battle to court and has accused CA of not honouring their contract. The channel has problem with regards to change in the itinerary for the India tour, with the limited-overs matches being held before the Tests.

news_headline: What is 'halo' that saved F1 driver's life after 225-kmph crash that set his car on fire?
news_article: F1 driver Romain Grosjean credited 'halo' safety device with saving his life after his car burst into flames and split into two following a 225-kmph crash. The 'halo' is a ring of titanium that sits above the car's cockpit to protect driver's head from flying debris. Weighing around nine kg, it's connected with the car's top with a bar.

news_headline: F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton has tested positive for coronavirus. His team said that he reported "mild symptoms" on Monday morning less than 24 hours after he claimed his 11th win of the season at the Bahrain Grand Prix. He will miss this weekend's Sakhir Grand Prix as he will be in quarantine.

news_headline: Barcelona to be fined after Messi's tribute to Maradona: Reports
news_article: Barcelona will reportedly pay a fine of $3,600 after Lionel Messi paid tribute to Diego Maradona on Sunday by celebrating in a Newell's Old Boys jersey. Messi took off Barcelona's blue-and-burgundy strip to reveal the red-and-black of Newell's after scoring a goal against Osasuna. But the touching tribute was against the rules of the Royal Spanish Football Federation.

news_headline: Pak's Raza Hasan expelled from domestic cricket season for COVID-19 breach
news_article: Pakistan spinner Raza Hasan was sent home from the Quaid-e-Azam Trophy after he left the bio-bubble at a hotel without clearance. "It is sad and unfortunate that despite several reminders...Raza Hasan decided to take matters in his hand and overstepped the line," said PCB. "He has been expelled from the tournament and won't be allowed for remaining season," PCB added.

news_headline: Jasprit Bumrah is Team India's only X-factor: Gambhir
news_article: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir described Jasprit Bumrah as India's only X-factor in all three formats of the game. "Yes, there is Virat Kohli, KL Rahul and all those guys but Jasprit Bumrah is just pure class," Gambhir said. "I have always maintained that bowlers are the guys who win you games and Jasprit Bumrah is just world-class," he added.

news_headline: Finch names 3 players who can replace David Warner in 3rd ODI
news_article: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has named Alex Carey, Marnus Labuschagne and Matthew Wade as the possible players who can replace injured David Warner as opener in the third ODI against India. "Any team Warner is not a part of is going to be slightly weaker but we have got guys that can...really contribute heavily in that role," Finch added.

news_headline: I can't understand why India didn't attempt short balls against Smith: Hogg
news_article: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg has criticised Team India's bowlers for not trying to get Steve Smith out by short-pitched bowling in the first two ODIs. "India didn't attempt to bounce him out at any stage. They bowled on a good length or a little fuller. I can't understand that, because Smith's weakness is with the short ball," he stated.

news_headline: Difference between India, Australia has been Hazlewood, Zampa: Tom Moody
news_article: Former Australia cricketer Tom Moody has said that the biggest difference between India and Australia in the ongoing series has been pacer Josh Hazlewood and spinner Adam Zampa. In the two ODIs, which Australia have won, Hazlewood has taken five wickets, while Zampa has picked six wickets. "Zampa is the unsung hero of this whole thing," Moody further stated.

news_headline: Smith isn't that far away from Kohli: Gambhir on best ODI batsman ever
news_article: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said that Australia batsman Steve Smith is not far behind Virat Kohli in the "best ODI batsman in the world ever" discussion. "Getting...two back to back hundreds in 60 balls is no joke. Yes, Kohli will always have better numbers but look at the impact Smith has had in the last two games," he added.

news_headline: Smith likes pace on bat, spin might be key to get him out: Harbhajan
news_article: Veteran India spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that Virat Kohli should deploy a spin-heavy attack against Steve Smith. "Yuzvendra Chahal...[and] maybe Kuldeep Yadav coming in...they [can] bowl 7-8 overs...when Smith comes in...he's someone who likes pace on the bat if you take that away...that might be the key point to get him out," Harbhajan stated.

news_headline: Really happy that Aus are coming up with a plan against me: Iyer
news_article: India batsman Shreyas Iyer, who was dismissed for 2 runs in the first ODI and 38 runs in the second, has said that he's really happy that Australia are coming up with a plan against him. "I feel overwhelmed and take it as a challenge. But I thrive under pressure and it motivates me to go against them," he added.

news_headline: Had Rohit been in 2nd ODI, we'd have played in bolder fashion: Aakash
news_article: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that had opener Rohit Sharma played in the second ODI against Australia, which India lost, Virat Kohli-led side would have played in a "bolder fashion". "The batting line-up left a lot to be desired...there were too many runs on the board...If you need to score more than 350, then you need Rohit," he added.

news_headline: Completely opposed to racism: Cavani apologises for racist post
news_article: Manchester United footballer Edinson Cavani apologised and deleted a racist social media post, saying he is "completely opposed to racism". Cavani added, " The last thing I wanted to do was cause offence to anyone...[I] deleted the message as soon as it was explained that it can be interpreted differently." Cavani had used the term 'negrito' in his Instagram post.

news_headline: 101-yr-old woman who lived through Spanish flu & WWII, survives COVID-19 thrice
news_article: A 101-year-old Italian woman who lived through the Spanish Flu and World War II, has survived coronavirus three times. Maria Orsingher had first tested positive in February and for the second time in September, during which she underwent treatment for 18 days at a hospital. She was asymptomatic when she tested positive for the third time.

news_headline: China underreported COVID-19 cases: Leaked documents
news_article: China on February 10 officially reported 2,478 new confirmed COVID-19 cases, but according to leaked documents from Hubei province accessed by CNN, the cases were underreported. Leaked documents showed that local authorities in Hubei listed a total of 5,918 newly detected cases on February 10. The documents also showed that China didn't disclose a December flu spike in Hubei.

news_headline: Kim Jong-un vaccinated against COVID-19; China supplied vaccine: Analyst
news_article: A US analyst has said North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and multiple other high-ranking officials within his family and leadership network have been vaccinated against coronavirus. Harry Kazianis, citing two unidentified Japanese intelligence sources, further said the experimental coronavirus vaccine was supplied by China. Kazianis is a North Korea expert at the Center for the National Interest.

news_headline: The situation is concerning: Canada PM on farmers' protests in India
news_article: Commenting on farmers' protests in India during an online event to mark Gurpurab, Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said the "situation is concerning". "We are all very worried about family and friends...Let me remind you, Canada will always be there to defend the right of peaceful protest," he said. Canada reached out to Indian authorities to highlight their concerns,  Trudeau added.

news_headline: India had largest reductions in malaria cases in SE Asia in 20 yrs: WHO
news_article: According to WHO's latest World Malaria Report, India made "impressive gains" with reductions of 18% and 20% in malaria cases and deaths respectively, over the last 2 years. India recorded the largest reductions in the cases in Southeast Asia from approximately 20 million to 5.6 million in 20 years from 2000-2019. Malaria cases reduced by 73% in the region.

news_headline: Canadian leaders making ill-informed comments about farmers' protests: India
news_article: After Canadian PM Justin Trudeau called the farmers' protests "concerning", MEA spokesperson Anurag Srivastava said some Canadian leaders have made "ill-informed comments relating to farmers in India". These are "unwarranted especially when pertaining to internal affairs of a democratic country. It's also best that diplomatic conversations aren't misrepresented for political purposes", he added.

news_headline: 26/11 key accused Rana wanted 'top class' medal for the attacks: US
news_article: The US government told a federal court that 26/11 key accused Tahawwur Rana wanted a "top class" medal for his role in Mumbai terror attacks. Rana, who has been declared a fugitive by India, also demanded the nine LeT attackers who were killed be given Pakistan's highest military honour. US government said this in support of Rana's extradition to India.

news_headline: UK and Canada MPs support farmer protests in India, criticise govt
news_article: United Kingdom and Canada MPs have backed farmers' protest in India. UK MP Tanmanjeet Singh Dhesi tweeted, "It takes a special kind of people to feed those ordered to beat and suppress them." Canada's MP Jack Harris tweeted, "We're shocked to see the Indian government's suppression of farmers...Instead of using water cannons...government needs to engage in open dialogue with farmers."

news_headline: 26-year-old US Instagram influencer who went missing last week found dead
news_article: The naked body of a 26-year-old Instagram influencer who went missing last week was found by the side of a Texas road.
