news_article: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant, while addressing a virtual event organised by FICCI on Thursday, said that India can create $1 trillion of economic value using digital technology by 2025. "Digital infrastructure has become indispensable to the functioning of society," Kant said, adding that it has emerged as more significant infrastructure as compared to necessities such as power and road.

news_headline: Microsoft criticised for enabling 'workplace surveillance' with its tool
news_article: Microsoft has received criticism for enabling "workplace surveillance" through its "Productivity Score" tool that lets managers use Microsoft 365 to monitor and track employees' activities at an individual level, including the number of days an employee has been sending emails or using the chat. An Austrian researcher Wolfie Christl raised the alarm about the feature calling it "problematic".

news_headline: UK's Test and Trace system wrongly tells 1,300 people they have COVID-19
news_article: Over 1,300 people in Britain were wrongly informed that they were COVID-19-positive after a laboratory error at the government's NHS Test and Trace system. Authorities said the error was an "isolated incident" and was being investigated. They added that "swift action" was taken to notify those affected and that they have been asked to take another test.

news_headline: US startup develops remote-controlled electric carts to deliver goods
news_article: US-based startup Tortoise recently unveiled its remote-controlled electric delivery carts that can be used to deliver goods and groceries to consumers within a 4.8-km radius. The cart can carry a load of 68 kg and can travel at a maximum speed of about 11 kmph. Tortoise, in partnership with Self Point, is currently offering the product in Los Angeles, US.

news_headline: Bezos called upon to support 4L seafarers stranded on merchant vessels
news_article: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos has been called upon to support nearly four lakh seafarers who are stranded on board merchant vessels due to COVID-19 restrictions. In an open letter to Bezos, shipping industry associations urged him to exert pressure on incoming Biden administration to recognise seafarers as "key workers" because "governments will not...prioritise them for immigration and travel purposes".

news_headline: FC Kohli will be remembered for contributions to world of IT: PM Modi
news_article: Condoling the demise of the founding CEO of TCS FC Kohli, Prime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted, he'll be "remembered for his pioneering contributions to the world of IT." "He was at the forefront of institutionalising a culture of innovation and excellence in the tech industry," PM Modi added. The 'father of Indian software industry' passed away aged 96 on Thursday.

news_headline: New UK tech regulator to set new code to govern Google, Facebook
news_article: A new tech regulator will work to govern tech giants, like Google, Facebook, in the UK to ensure consumers and small businesses are not disadvantaged. UK's CMA will get a dedicated Digital Markets Unit, which will enforce a new code of practice for the firms. The unit could be given powers to suspend, block and reverse decisions of tech giants.

news_headline: Facebook AI error bans ads for struggling businesses amid COVID-19
news_article: Facebook AI incorrectly banned ad accounts of several struggling businesses that are using Facebook for ads to drive sales amid COVID-19. A US-based woman who sells honey suffered a loss of ₹3.7 lakh after Facebook suspended her ad account for policy violations. A Canadian woman also reported that her account was blocked over violations and later restored without explanation.

news_headline: Suspected N Korean hackers target drugmaker AstraZeneca: Report
news_article: Suspected North Korean hackers have tried to break into the systems of British drugmaker AstraZeneca in recent weeks, Reuters reported. The hackers posed as recruiters on networking site LinkedIn and WhatsApp to approach AstraZeneca staff with fake job offers. The victims were sent documents purporting to be job descriptions that were laced with malicious code.

news_headline: Instagram briefly blocks '#sikh' amid farmers' protests: Reports
news_article: Instagram blocked hashtag '#sikh' on its platform amid the ongoing farmers' protests, some users have complained on Twitter. Initially, on searching for the hashtag, Instagram reportedly showed an error that read, "To make sure only...most relevant posts are shown, we've hidden some posts that may be private or low quality." However, Instagram later started showing some posts with '#sikh'.

news_headline: Google Photos adds new collage designs under 'Recent Highlights'
news_article: Google Photos has introduced new collage designs that will show up in 'Recent Highlights'. Under 'Recent Highlights', multiple photos taken on the same day or from the same occasion are clubbed together in a collage. Currently, Google Photos has a standard and simple collage. A new collage on Google Photos shows a blackboard-style design with chalked borders.

news_headline: Data of 16 mn Brazil COVID-19 patients including Prez Bolsonaro leaked
news_article: Personal and health data of more than 16 million Brazilian COVID-19 patients was exposed online after a hospital worker uploaded a spreadsheet with access credentials to two government medical databases on GitHub this month. Data such as medical histories, passwords and other sensitive information belonging to Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro and several ministers was also reportedly included.

news_headline: Alibaba, Tencent put talks with Baidu to buy iQIYI stake on hold: Report
news_article: Alibaba and Tencent have put their individual discussions with Baidu for acquiring a controlling stake in video streaming service iQIYI on hold, Reuters reported. The discussions have been stalled over a $20-billion valuation demanded by Baidu, and have little chances of resuming. Tencent believes the company is worth about half of what Baidu wants, sources told Reuters.

news_headline: Xbox bug that could have let hackers link usernames with users' emails fixed
news_article: Microsoft has patched a bug in the Xbox website that could have allowed hackers to link Xbox gamer tags (usernames) with users' email addresses. A security researcher who reported the bug to Microsoft told ZDNet the bug was located on enforcement.xbox.com where users view strikes against their profile. The bug allowed the researcher to view emails of other users.

news_headline: Hyd airport introduces India's first IoT-enabled Smart Trolleys
news_article: GMR-led Hyderabad International Airport has introduced the Internet of Things (IoT)-enabled Smart Baggage Trolleys, becoming India's first airport to use this technology for tracking baggage trolleys for passengers in real-time across the airport. It will also help tackle the theft of trolleys. "[The system] is compatible on mobile, desktop and laptop making it user-friendly," a statement said.

news_headline: US govt opens probe into 1.15L Tesla vehicles over suspension issue
news_article: The US NHTSA opened an investigation into around 1.15 lakh Tesla vehicles over a front suspension safety issue. It said it was opening a preliminary evaluation into 2015-2017 Model S and 2016-2017 Model X vehicles after receiving 43 complaints alleging failure of the left or right front suspension fore links. "The complaints appear to indicate an increasing trend," NHTSA said.

news_headline: No Google-Fitbit merger unless human rights remedies ensured: Amnesty to EU
news_article: Amnesty International wrote to EU saying the Google and Fitbit merger must not proceed unless the firms show they have taken adequate account of human rights risks. It said they must show they have implemented strong safeguards that prevent and mitigate the risks in future. Amnesty added Google's business model "incentivises" it to "continuously seek more data on more people".

news_headline: Facebook's Libra could launch in Jan in limited format: Report
news_article: Facebook's Libra cryptocurrency could launch as early as January 2021 but in a more limited format than previously proposed, FT reported. The Libra Association plans to launch a single digital coin backed by the dollar. Earlier, after regulators had expressed their concerns, the association had decided to modify its original plans and create "stablecoins" backed by individual currencies.

news_headline: Battery-operated bikes to be included in Delhi's EV policy: Report
news_article: Delhi's EV policy is being revised to include a segment on battery-operated bicycles and tricycles, HT reported. The government has drafted a proposal to offer monetary incentives on their purchase. The proposed revision includes cycles both in the passenger and cargo categories. In case of individual buyers, purchase incentive will be 25% of the MRP with a cap of ₹5,000.

news_headline: Warner does 'Butta Bomma' dance on field during India ODI, video goes viral
news_article: A video of Australia opener David Warner doing the 'Butta Bomma' dance on the boundary line while fielding in the ODI against India in Sydney has gone viral. Reacting to the video, Armaan Malik, who has sung 'Butta Bomma', tweeted, "Hahahahah David Warner is epic!!" Earlier, David Warner's Instagram video dancing on 'Butta Bomma' with his wife had gone viral.

news_headline: I have been axed twice before as well by BCCI for my tweets: Manjrekar
news_article: On being asked how he handled being removed from the BCCI commentary panel earlier this year, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "Not many people know that I have been removed twice before as well. It was for something that I had tweeted." He added, "It is not easy, of course, but in many ways, I have become thick-skinned about such things."

news_headline: Waiting for when I will return, my son was 15-day-old when I left: Hardik Pandya
news_article: Following the first Australia-India ODI, all-rounder Hardik Pandya said, "I'm missing my family. I am waiting for when I will return." He added, "My son was just 15-day-old when I left [for IPL] and he will be four-month-old when I will go back." "A lot of things have changed but for better," he added talking about birth of his son.

news_headline: India take over 4 hours to bowl 50 overs vs Australia, fined 20% of match fee
news_article: Team India players have been fined 20% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against Australia in the first ODI in Sydney on Friday. India took more than four hours to complete their quota of 50 overs. Virat Kohli's side was ruled to be one over short of the target after time allowances were taken into consideration.

news_headline: Teenager claiming to be Maradona's lovechild demands his body be dug up for DNA test
news_article: Santiago Lara, a 19-year-old boy who claims to be late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona's love child, has demanded Maradona's body be dug up for DNA test to prove his case. Santiago instructed his lawyer to make the appeal less than 24 hours after Maradona was buried. A written request with a family court in La Plata has been lodged.

news_headline: World War II bombs found at training ground of football team in Italy, pic surfaces
news_article: Serie A side AS Roma has revealed that the Italian army's bomb squad was called to their training ground after World War II explosive devices were discovered at their facility. Around 20 bombs were found by a technician who was beginning the groundwork for a new pitch. The devices were safely and successfully removed by the Army, Roma said.

news_headline: Owner of Maradona's 'Hand of God' jersey looking to sell it for ₹15 crore
news_article: David Amerman of Goldin Auctions has said the owner of Diego Maradona's 'Hand of God' jersey is looking to sell it for $2 million (around ₹15 crore). The shirt is owned by ex-England player Steve Hodge, who got it from Maradona after the 1986 World Cup match in which his attempted back pass led to the 'Hand of God' goal.

news_headline: NZ record their 3rd highest T20I total as Phillips smashes fastest ton for team
news_article: New Zealand recorded their third highest T20I total after putting up 238/3 against West Indies in the second T20I in Mount Maunganui. Batting at number four, Glenn Phillips smashed a hundred off 46 balls, the fastest T20I hundred by a New Zealand player. The previous record for fastest hundred by a New Zealand was held by Colin Munro (47 balls).

news_headline: I have a problem with Jadeja kind of players in white-ball cricket: Manjrekar
news_article: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said that he doesn't have a problem with Ravindra Jadeja but he has a problem with his kind of cricketers in white-ball cricket. "Even Hardik Pandya will not be in my team. They add illusionary value to the team," he added. He further said, "I have always rated Jadeja highly in the Test format."

news_headline: He got me pregnant, beat me up: Ex-classmate accuses Babar of sexually abusing her
news_article: Pakistan captain Babar Azam's former classmate has accused him of sexually and financially abusing her for 10 years. "He promised to marry me, he got me pregnant. He beat me up and threatened me and used me," the woman said. The woman threatened to set herself on fire in front of Pakistan Cricket Board if she failed to get justice.

news_headline: All Blacks pay tribute to Maradona ahead of haka war dance, video viral
news_article: Ahead of their ritual pre-match haka war dance against Argentina, All Blacks (New Zealand rugby team) laid down a black jersey adorned with 'Maradona 10' in a tribute to the late football legend. "I never ever get tired of watching the All Blacks’ haka. The tribute to Maradona is icing," a fan tweeted. "Really emotional seeing that," wrote another.

news_headline: There is one sitting at home: Hardik Pandya on India looking for another all-rounder
news_article: Addressing India's want for another all-rounder following the first Australia-India ODI, Hardik Pandya said, "Maybe we should look in...Pandya family only. There's one sitting at home." He was referring to his brother Krunal, who wasn't selected in any of the Team India squads for Australia tour. Hardik added that he doesn't want to risk injury by rushing back to bowling.

news_headline: Harry Kane shares video playing cricket, jokingly asks Kohli for an IPL spot
news_article: England football team captain Harry Kane took to Twitter to share a video of himself playing cricket. "Got a match-winning T20 knock in me I reckon. Any places going for RCB in the IPL next season @imVkohli??" he jokingly asked. Responding to him, Kohli wrote, "Haha good skills mate. Maybe we can get you in as a counter attacking batsman."

news_headline: Hotel room where Maradona stayed during Kerala visit turned into museum, pics surface
news_article: The hotel suite where late Diego Maradona stayed during his visit to Kerala in 2012 has been converted into a museum in his memory. Maradona stayed in room number 309 at Kannur's Blue Nile Hotel during his visit eight years ago. "All objects used by the football legend back then are kept here in his memory," an official said.

news_headline: Wrestler Narsingh Yadav tests COVID-19 +ve at national camp after Diwali break
news_article: Wrestler Narsingh Yadav along with wrestler Gurpreet Singh and physiotherapist Vishal Rai has tested positive for coronavirus after rejoining the national camp at Sonepat after the Diwali break. All three are reported to be asymptomatic and have been moved to a hospital as a precautionary measure. Meanwhile, a month-long training camp has been sanctioned for Bajrang Punia in the US.

news_headline: India played good cricket, but in patches: Harbhajan on India's ODI loss vs Aus
news_article: On India's loss to Australia in the first ODI by 66 runs, veteran off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said that Virat Kohli-led Indian team "played some good cricket but in patches". "The fielding was a bit sloppy, lot of misfields, lot of missed catches," he added. "Apart from Mohammad Shami everyone had an off day," he further said.

news_headline: Kohli himself might have to bowl: Tom Moody on India's 6th bowling option
news_article: Talking about the India-Australia series, former Australia cricketer Tom Moody said that India captain Virat Kohli might himself have to bowl "a few of his little mediums" as the sixth bowler. "Australia have got all their bowling options sorted. They've got experience in those bowling options at [Aaron] Finch's disposal," he added. Currently, all-rounder Hardik Pandya isn't fit to bowl.

news_headline: Saha is your best wicketkeeper-batsman in Tests: Parthiv Patel
news_article: Indian wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel called Wriddhiman Saha India's best wicketkeeper-batsman in Tests. "There is no comparison with anyone...Saha is your guy as long as he is fit," Parthiv said. "As long as he is there, he should be keeping for India in Tests, whether you are playing abroad or India," he added. Parthiv last played for India in January 2018.

news_headline: Body language was disappointing, lack of all-round options affecting balance: Kohli
news_article: Talking about the defeat against Australia, India captain Virat Kohli said the body language of the team "wasn't great" after around 25 overs. "It was a disappointing part...If you don't take your chances...they'll hurt you," he added. On Hardik Pandya not being fit to bowl, Kohli added that the lack of all-round options is affecting the team's balance.

news_headline: If Hardik is unfit, where is 6th bowling option: Gambhir
news_article: After India suffered defeat to Australia in the first ODI, former India opener Gautam Gambhir asked, "If Hardik Pandya is not fit [to bowl], where is the sixth bowling option." "It's only Vijay Shankar that I can think of but does he have the same impact batting at number five or six...I have my doubts," he added.

news_headline: Sydney Thunder win Women's Big Bash League for the second time
news_article: Sydney Thunder beat Melbourne Stars by seven wickets on Saturday to lift the Women's Big Bash League (WBBL) title for the second time. Opting to bat, Melbourne Stars could only manage 86/9 in their 20 overs as Sydney Thunder reached their target with 38 balls to spare. Pacer Shabnim Ismail was named the Player of the Match in the final.

news_headline: Don't see them winning WC with this formation: Vaughan on Team India
news_article: Former England skipper Michael Vaughan has said that he doesn't see the current formation of Team India winning the World Cup. "Biggest concern for me, if I was a selector...would be lack of 6th bowling option...They need at least six or seven bowlers...and the lack of depth in current batting line-up," he added.

news_headline: Team India needs a player like Dhoni: Holding on ODI loss to Aus
news_article: Former West Indies pacer Michael Holding has said that Team India needs a player like former India captain MS Dhoni in the middle while chasing big totals. "Dhoni used to take control of the chase...India need a player like him...not just his skills but [the] strength of character," he stated. "India will struggle with the loss of Dhoni," he added.

news_headline: Dhoni used to play that kind of role: Manjrekar on Pandya's 90 off 76
news_article: Talking about Hardik Pandya's knock of 90 runs off 76 balls against Australia while batting at number six, cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said that the ex-captain MS Dhoni used to play that kind of role. "There was clarity and there was sense in the way he batted...He is actually an impressive product to look at," he added.

news_headline: If Rohit doesn't play in Tests, I'd go for Shaw as 2nd opener: Manjrekar
news_article: Talking about the upcoming India-Australia Test series, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said that if Rohit Sharma doesn't play then Prithvi Shaw should play as the second opener with Mayank Agarwal. "If Shaw shows the poor form as he did in the IPL, then Shubman Gill can be looked at," he added. The four-Test series will begin on December 17.

news_headline: Calling an election unfair does not make it so: Court tells Trump
news_article: A US court on Friday rejected an attempt by President Donald Trump's campaign to block President-elect Joe Biden from being declared the winner of Pennsylvania. "Calling an election unfair does not make it so," a three-judge panel told the Trump campaign. "Charges require specific allegations and then proof. We have neither here," the panel said.

news_headline: Recount demanded by Trump increases Biden's margin
news_article: A recount in Wisconsin demanded by US President Donald Trump's election campaign increased President-elect Joe Biden's margin. After the recount in Milwaukee County, Biden had a net gain of 132 votes. Biden gained 257 votes to Trump's 125. Trump's campaign demanded recounts in two of Wisconsin's most populous and Democratic-leaning counties, after losing Wisconsin to Biden by over 20,000 votes.

news_headline: More people died from suicide in Oct than from COVID-19 in all of 2020 in Japan
news_article: Japanese government statistics show that suicide claimed more lives in October in the country than COVID-19 has over the entire year to date. The number of Japanese suicides rose to over 2,100 in October, according to Japan's National Police Agency. Japan is one of the few major economies to disclose timely suicide data.

news_headline: American singer arrives in Pakistan to relocate world's loneliest elephant
news_article: American singer Cher arrived in Pakistan to send off Kaavan, dubbed the world's loneliest elephant, before he is moved to a sanctuary in Cambodia on Sunday from Islamabad Zoo. The singer, who for years lobbied for his relocation and is helping pay for his move, met PM Imran Khan on Friday. Kaavan has been at the zoo for 35 years.

news_headline: Ex-Pak PM Benazir Bhutto's daughter gets engaged; shares picture
news_article: Bakhtawar Bhutto-Zardari, the daughter of former Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari and late Pakistan Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto, on Friday got engaged to Mahmood Choudhry. "Very sentimental & emotional day. So grateful for everyone's love & prayers," she tweeted. Bakhtawar's brother Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari, who had tested positive for COVID-19 earlier this week, greeted the guests via video.

news_headline: Wife's ₹4,300cr Infosys stake not declared by Sunak in official register: Report
news_article: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak did not declare the ₹4,300-crore stake in Infosys held by his wife Akshata Murthy, the daughter of Narayana Murthy, in the official register of ministers' interests, The Guardian reported. Sunak is required to declare his family's financial interests which could conflict with his public duty. Infosys has held contracts with government ministries, The Guardian added.

news_headline: Remember that name: Israeli PM had warned about slain Iranian scientist
news_article: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu had warned the world about top Iranian nuclear scientist Mohsen Fakhrizadeh who was assassinated on Friday. "Remember that name," Netanyahu had said about Fakhrizadeh in 2018 accusing Iran of continuing to seek nuclear weapons. Iran's Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif said there are "serious indications" of an Israeli role in Fakhrizadeh's assassination.

news_headline: Visitors track down metal monolith found in middle of US desert
news_article: Several visitors tracked down the metal monolith planted deep in a US desert despite the government not sharing its coordinates. One of them was 33-year-old David Surber who found the structure after a Reddit user shared the coordinates by tracking the helicopter's flight path. The 12ft high object was discovered by a helicopter crew counting bighorn sheep in the region.

news_headline: Influencer tricks elderly men into eating soap covered in chocolate; apologises
news_article: A Colombian social media influencer has apologised after he tricked elderly and homeless men into eating soap bars covered in chocolate. "In reference to the joke we recently made that caused a negative reaction from the public, I sincerely apologise to the people involved and to the community," Milton Domínguez wrote on Instagram.

news_headline: Keep piles of cash at home as I have no account due to US sanctions: HK leader
news_article: Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam said that she keeps "piles of cash" at home because she has no bank account after the US imposed sanctions on her. "I'm using cash for all the things...the government is paying me cash for my salary," she added. The sanctions were put after China introduced a new national security law in Hong Kong.

news_headline: Woman gifts AK-47 to groom on wedding in Pak as people cheer; video viral
news_article: A video has gone viral on social media, showing a groom in Pakistan getting an AK-47 rifle as a wedding gift from a woman who's reported to be his mother-in-law. The video shows the woman giving the rifle to the groom amid cheers from the crowd. "That's the reason why Pakistan is the epicentre of terror," a Twitter user reacted.

news_headline: Canada PM's office releases statement on call with leader even before it happens
news_article: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's office mistakenly released a statement about a phone call between Trudeau and opposition leader Erin O'Toole even before the two had their conversation. Trudeau "raised concerns around COVID-19 misinformation being promoted by Conservative Members of Parliament", the statement read. A readout after the call didn't mention Trudeau criticising Erin over misinformation.

news_headline: Trump's fraud allegations 'farcical': Ex-head of election security
news_article: Calling US President Donald Trump's fraud allegations "farcical", former head of US election security Chris Krebs said that allegations of voting machines being manipulated by foreign countries were baseless. Americans should have 100% confidence in their vote, Krebs added. Krebs was fired by Trump for saying that the November 3 election was the most secure in American history.

news_headline: Joe Biden will be a president who represents the best in us: Harris
news_article: US Vice President-elect Kamala Harris on Saturday said that Joe Biden will be a president who "represents the best in us [America]" and will be a leader who's respected around the world. She added that Biden would be "a commander in chief who'll respect our troops and keep our country safe". Biden is set to take office on January 20.

news_headline: Highly speculative to say COVID-19 did not emerge in China: WHO
news_article: World Health Organisation's top emergency expert Mike Ryan has said, "It's highly speculative for us [WHO] to say that the disease did not emerge in China."  The first case of coronavirus was identified in a food market in Wuhan in December last year. Meanwhile, Chinese state media reported that the virus existed abroad before it was discovered in Wuhan.

news_headline: 10 COVID-19 vaccines likely by 2021 summer: Global pharma group head
news_article: Global pharmaceutical industry group head, Thomas Cueni, has said ten COVID-19 vaccines could be available by next summer if they get regulatory approval. The inventors will require patent protection as the vaccines need rigorous scientific scrutiny, he added. Almost all member companies have committed to "not-for-profit" or socially responsible pricing during the pandemic, Cueni further said.

news_headline: UK's Test and Trace system wrongly tells 1,300 people they have COVID-19
news_article: Over 1,300 people in Britain were wrongly informed that they were COVID-19-positive after a laboratory error at the government's NHS Test and Trace system. Authorities said the error was an "isolated incident" and was being investigated. They added that "swift action" was taken to notify those affected and that they have been asked to take another test.

news_headline: Data of 16 mn Brazil COVID-19 patients including Prez Bolsonaro leaked
news_article: Personal and health data of more than 16 million Brazilian COVID-19 patients was exposed online after a hospital worker uploaded a spreadsheet with access credentials to two government medical databases on GitHub this month. Data such as medical histories, passwords and other sensitive information belonging to Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro and several ministers was also reportedly included.

news_headline: PM Modi speaks to UK PM, discusses COVID-19 vaccine development
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that he had an "excellent discussion" with UK PM Boris Johnson on the ties between both the nations for the next decade. The leaders discussed COVID-19 challenges and reviewed "promising cooperation" between the countries in COVID-19 vaccine development, a press release said. Johnson reiterated that the year 2021 is important for UK-India ties.

news_headline: Thailand's pro-democracy protesters warn of possible military coup
news_article: Thailand's pro-democracy protesters on Friday warned of a possible military coup amid the ongoing anti-government protests in the country. "A coup cannot be achieved again as long as we come out and seize every intersection across the country," a protest leader said. The country's Army Chief Narongphan Jittkaewtae rejected the coup rumours saying that chances were "less than zero".

news_headline: US sanctions Chinese, Russian firms over Iran missile programme
news_article: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Friday announced sanctions on four Chinese and Russian firms for supporting Iran's missile programme that he said remains a "significant proliferation concern". "We'll use all sanctions tools to prevent Iran from advancing missile capabilities," he added. The companies would be subjected to restrictions on US government aid and their exports for two years.

news_headline: Iranian Prez accuses Israel of killing scientist, says 'will respond'
news_article: President Hassan Rouhani on Saturday accused Israel of killing Iran's most senior nuclear scientist Mohsen Fakhrizadeh near the country's capital Tehran. "Iran will surely respond to the martyrdom of our scientist at the proper time," Rouhani said. The assassination shows "our enemies' despair and the depth of their hatred...His martyrdom will not slow down our achievements," he added.

news_headline: At least 7 killed in suicide bombing at ice cream parlour in Somalia
news_article: At least seven people were killed and 10 others were injured after a suicide bomber blew himself up in an ice cream parlour in Somalia's capital Mogadishu on Friday, police said. Al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab extremist group claimed responsibility for the attack. This comes hours after US Acting Defense Secretary Christopher Miller visited Mogadishu to meet US military personnel and envoy.

news_headline: Video of police beating Black man shameful for France: Prez Macron
news_article: France President Emmanuel Macron has said the video showing three Paris police officers beating up black music producer Michel Zecler was "shameful" for the country. Calling it unacceptable, Macron said France should never "let hatred or racism prosper". He added that the government would come up with proposals to restore public confidence in police. The three officers have been suspended.

news_headline: China to charge 12 anti-govt protesters caught fleeing Hong Kong
news_article: China on Friday announced that they would formally charge 12 anti-government protesters who were caught fleeing Hong Kong in a speedboat three months ago. The 12 accused are being charged with illegally crossing and organising an illicit border crossing, China said. The individuals, who have been detained since August 23, could face up to seven years in prison if convicted.

news_headline: Will leave politics if there's any trouble on MSP: Haryana CM to Punjab CM
news_article: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar told Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh that he'll "leave politics if there'll be any trouble on the MSP" and urged him to "stop inciting innocent farmers". "You're only tweeting and running away from talks, Why?" asked Khattar. Earlier, Singh condemned Haryana government's "forcible attempts" to prevent farmers from marching to Delhi against the farm laws.

news_headline: Don't compel me to come after you: Maharashtra CM to Opposition
news_article: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has said he doesn't want to resort to vindictive politics. Asked how he felt when his family was targeted in Sushant Singh Rajput's death case, Thackeray said, "Those who have families, children should look in mirror once. Don't compel us to take that step. If I go after you...I don't want to stoop to that level."

news_headline: Depriving liberty even for one day is one too many: SC on Goswami's plea
news_article: Stating that the Bombay High Court had "abdicated" its responsibility while dealing with Republic TV's Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami's plea, the Supreme Court said, "Deprivation of liberty even for a single day is one day too many." It added, "Our courts must ensure that they continue to remain the first line of defence against the deprivation of the liberty of citizens."

news_headline: BJP shares 'propaganda vs reality' video after Rahul's tweet on farmers' protest
news_article: BJP's Amit Malviya took to Twitter to post a "propaganda vs reality" video after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi posted a picture from farmers' protest. "Rahul Gandhi must be the most discredited opposition leader India has seen in a long long time," Malviya wrote along with the video captioned 'Police didn't even touch the farmer'.

news_headline: Has Tejashwi forgotten who made him Deputy CM?: Bihar CM in Assembly
news_article: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday reportedly lost his temper in the Assembly after opposition leader Tejashwi Yadav made allegations against him during his hour-long speech. "I've been listening to his (Tejashwi's) diatribe simply because he is the son of a friend whom I treat like a brother," said Nitish, adding, "Has he forgotten who made him the deputy CM?"

news_headline: Stop threatening, show governance instead: Fadnavis to Maharashtra CM
news_article: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has asked current CM Uddhav Thackeray to stop 'threatening' opposition and "show governance instead". This comes after CM told opposition leaders to not force him to 'go after them' by playing vindictive politics. Criticising state government over COVID-19 situation, Fadnavis said, "It's by God's grace that second wave hasn't reached Maharashtra yet."

news_headline: PM should implement '1 country, 1 treatment': Priyanka on farmers' protest
news_article: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday criticised central government over efforts to stop protesters marching against farm laws from entering Delhi. Priyanka said that the government is 'suppressing the voice of farmers' by using water cannons on protesters and digging up roads. "PM who's concerned about one country, one election, should also apply one country, one treatment," she said.

news_headline: West Bengal Transport Minister Suvendu Adhikari resigns from post
news_article: Trinamool Congress leader Suvendu Adhikari on Friday resigned from the post of the state Transport Minister. Adhikari, who is an MLA from Nandigram in East Midnapore, had resigned from the post of chairman of the Hooghly River Bridge Commission on Thursday night. This comes ahead of the West Bengal Assembly elections, scheduled to be held next year.

news_headline: If Pakistanis live in Hyd, sack your Secunderabad MP: Owaisi to BJP
news_article: Hyderabad MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi asked BJP that if Pakistanis and Rohingyas live in Hyderabad then the Minister of State for Home Affairs and Secunderabad BJP MP G Kishan Reddy should be sacked. This comes after Telangana BJP Chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar said that surgical strikes will be carried out in Hyderabad to remove pro-Pakistan elements and Rohingyas.

news_headline: BJP releases manifesto for Hyderabad civic body elections
news_article: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday released the BJP manifesto for the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) polls. "Corporation will...ensure no one will have to run to any private hospital for the [COVID-19] vaccine," Fadnavis said. He added that planned development for the city and free travel for women are some of the important steps promised in the manifesto.

news_headline: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya booked for trespassing at Hyd's Osmania University
news_article: Hyderabad Police have registered a case against BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on charges of criminal trespass at Osmania University. Surya and Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) workers, who were scheduled to pay tribute to Telangana movement martyrs, allegedly broke through police barriers at the entrance. According to the university's complaint, there was no prior permission taken for the event.

news_headline: AAP spends more on advertisements than healthcare: Congress
news_article: Congress' National Spokesperson Pawan Khera has accused the AAP-led Delhi government of spending more on advertisements than the healthcare facilities amid the COVID-19 pandemic. "Very unfortunate that people of Delhi are suffering the consequences of mistakes committed by the Delhi government," Khera said. He added that it is appalling that AAP has only spent 25% of the health budget.

news_headline: BJP MLA files FIR against Lalu Yadav over call to allegedly poach him
news_article: BJP MLA Lalan Paswan has filed an FIR against RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav for an alleged attempt to offer him a ministerial berth in return for helping the opposition defeat the NDA candidate for Assembly Speaker's post. Former Deputy CM of Bihar Sushil Kumar Modi had alleged that Prasad made telephone calls from judicial custody in Jharkhand.

news_headline: BJP President holds roadshow in Hyd ahead of GHMC polls
news_article: BJP National President Jagat Prakash Nadda held a roadshow on November 27 in Hyderabad, ahead of the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) elections. "After winning the assembly by-elections, BJP now eyes to win the GHMC upcoming elections...After a two-kilometre-long roadshow, Nadda will address a meeting with a group of intellectuals," an official statement had earlier said.

news_headline: Congress ends up opposing country while opposing PM Modi: JP Nadda
news_article: Stating that the Congress stands with the "Gupkar Gang" in Jammu and Kashmir, BJP chief JP Nadda on Friday said, "The Congress ends up opposing the country while opposing (Prime Minister Narendra) Modi ji." Nadda added, "In Jammu and Kashmir, NC President Farooq Abdullah said that he would seek China's help to restore Article 370."

news_headline: Voting for TRS is same as voting for AIMIM: BJP spokesperson
news_article: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) spokesperson Sambit Patra said that voting for the TRS is same as voting for the AIMIM. Patra stated that both TRS and AIMIM are contesting to win the "family and friend municipal corporation private limited". "The BJP is contesting the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) polls with an aim to develop Hyderabad," he said.

news_headline: BJP should stop blame game and help curb pollution: Delhi minister
news_article: After BJP said the Delhi government was making a "false" claim of having distributed the Pusa bio-decomposer among farmers, Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai accused BJP of undermining efforts to curb pollution. He added, "They're just seen playing a blame game...The bio-decomposer solution was sprayed on 2,000 acres of land across Delhi." He asked BJP to contribute towards curbing pollution.

news_headline: Shiv Sena left Hindutva but ours hasn't changed: BJP's Fadnavis
news_article: Addressing reporters on Saturday, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said, "Our Hindutva has not changed. The Shiv Sena has left Hindutva. How can they forget what their allies said on (Hindutva ideologue Veer) Savarkar?" Fadnavis added, "They are with the Congress, which backs the Gupkar Declaration that talks of restoring Article 370 with China's aid."

news_headline: I stand by farmers, will march to Delhi if invited: West Bengal CM
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said, "I...will always stand by [the farmers]. If their rally marches to Delhi and if I am invited then I will most definitely join." She added, "The Central government wants to capture all the fundamental rights of every citizen...For BJP it's like one nation, one party and one leader, no one else exists."

news_headline: We welcome farmers to Delhi & stand with them in this battle: AAP
news_article: After the protesting farmers were allowed to enter Delhi through Tikri border, the Aam Aadmi Party said that they welcome farmers and stand with them "in this battle". "We will take full care of the farmers and make all necessary arrangements for them," AAP tweeted. The party added that CM Arvind Kejriwal is personally monitoring arrangements being made in Burari.

news_headline: Was forewarned by experts about possibility of a pandemic: Jude Law
news_article: Actor Jude Law has revealed he was forewarned by scientific experts about the possibility of a pandemic when he worked in the 2011 film 'Contagion', which focused on the spread of a contagious virus. "When...we heard about what was...happening in China, what fast became apparent around the world, it rang alarm bells. Unfortunately, I wasn't hugely surprised," he told GQ.

news_headline: Warner does 'Butta Bomma' dance on field during India ODI, video goes viral
news_article: A video of Australia opener David Warner doing the 'Butta Bomma' dance on the boundary line while fielding in the ODI against India in Sydney has gone viral. Reacting to the video, Armaan Malik, who has sung 'Butta Bomma', tweeted, "Hahahahah David Warner is epic!!" Earlier, David Warner's Instagram video dancing on 'Butta Bomma' with his wife had gone viral.

news_headline: TV actress Divya Bhatnagar put on ventilator, tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' actress Divya Bhatnagar is critical and has been put on ventilator, her mother revealed. "Divya had temperature since the last six days. She was feeling very uneasy. We checked her oxygen levels, they had dropped to 71. The reports have just come and she has tested positive for COVID-19," Divya's mother told ETimes TV.

news_headline: Kangana shares 'fake pic' of Shaheen Bagh Dadi at farmers' protest
news_article: Kangana Ranaut has deleted a tweet, wherein she quoted another Twitter user and claimed that 82-year-old Bilkis Bano, also known as 'Shaheen Bagh Dadi', was present at the farmers' protests and was available in ₹100. She was called out by users for sharing the "fake" news. "Kangana is using her position to pull down...those who aren't privileged," a user tweeted.

news_headline: Wajid Khan's wife reveals she was harassed by his family to convert to Islam
news_article: Late music composer Wajid Khan's wife Kamalrukh Khan has alleged she was harassed by Wajid's family to convert to Islam. "My dignity...didn't permit me to bend backwards for him and his family, by converting to Islam," she wrote. "The result-being outcast from my husband's family, scare tactics to make me convert included taking me to court seeking divorce," added Kamalrukh.

news_headline: Kriti to play Sita in Saif and Prabhas starrer 'Adipurush': Reports
news_article: Kriti Sanon has been roped in to play Sita in the upcoming film 'Adipurush', which will feature Prabhas as Ram and Saif Ali Khan as the antagonist Lankesh, Mumbai Mirror reported. The storyline of the film will reportedly revolve around the triumph of good over evil. Director Om Raut's upcoming film is scheduled to release on August 11, 2022.

news_headline: If I don’t work, my unit won't get paid: Mrunal on shooting amid COVID-19
news_article: Actress Mrunal Thakur commented on shooting amid the coronavirus pandemic and said, "I know that if I don't work, my unit will not get paid. It's a collective moral responsibility." The actress, who will start shooting for the final schedule of her upcoming Shahid Kapoor starrer film 'Jersey' in Chandigarh, admitted that she is scared of working during the pandemic.

news_headline: Shaheer, Ruchikaa share first pictures after court marriage
news_article: Shaheer Sheikh and Ruchikaa Kapoor have shared first pictures from their court wedding on social media. In the pictures, Shaheer can be seen in white kurta-pyjama and sunglasses, and Ruchikaa in light blue salwar kameez. "Off on an adventure called Forever...#HappilyEverAfter #ForeverPerson," Ruchikaa wrote with a heart emoji on Instagram.

news_headline: I want to try something in hardcore action: Ananya Panday
news_article: Ananya Panday, on being asked about her dream role, said that she wants to try something in hardcore action. Talking about her upcoming projects, she said, "I'm so excited about the variety I'm getting! [I] cannot wait to share everything with my fans!" Ananya will share screen space with Deepika Padukone and Siddhant Chaturvedi in Shakun Batra's untitled film.

news_headline: Ego has never been a problem for me: Abhishek Bachchan
news_article: Abhishek Bachchan has said ego has never been a problem for him. "I don't allow that to come into my work," said Abhishek, who has worked in multi-starrer films like 'Ludo' and 'Players'. "I've been around for 20 years, learnt a lot of things...Things like ego are only going to destroy your work...not going to get you anywhere," he said.

news_headline: CBI, NCB and ED have done a fair job in Sushant's case: Suman
news_article: Shekhar Suman, while talking about Sushant Singh Rajput's death case, tweeted, "I think...the three departments, CBI (Central Bureau Of Investigation), NCB (Narcotics Control Bureau) and ED (Enforcement Directorate) have done a fair job of interrogation, investigation and arrest." He added, "I guess because of...lack of any evidence they're helpless. So we've to...wait and see if they get lucky."

news_headline: Idea is to discuss terrorism with a human angle: Director on Torbaaz
news_article: Talking about his upcoming action-drama film 'Torbaaz', director Girish Malik said, "I really like bringing forth stories and characters that people have never imagined." "The idea is to show a story of hope and also to discuss terrorism with a human angle," he added. "'Torbaaz' will surely leave an impact on the viewers," Girish further said.

news_headline: 'Kal Ho...' made me laugh & cry in a heartbeat: Preity on film's 17 yrs
news_article: Actress Preity Zinta on Saturday took to Instagram to share a post on the 17th anniversary of her film 'Kal Ho Naa Ho', which also starred Shah Rukh Khan and Saif Ali Khan. "A movie that made me laugh and cry in a heartbeat," she wrote, adding, "An experience that went beyond words...This was probably one of my best-written films."

news_headline: To have babies in our family after so long is such a blessing: Hema
news_article: Hema Malini, whose daughter Ahana Deol gave birth to twin girls on Thursday, has said, "To have babies in our family after so long is such a blessing." "After my daughters...were born there was a...long gap when there were no babies around us," she added. "When [they]...got married...my husband Dharamji (Dharmendra) and I prayed to be grandparents," Hema said.

news_headline: Digital platforms give an actor a lot of space, opportunities: Namit
news_article: Speaking about his experience of working on digital platforms, actor Namit Das said, "It gives an actor a lot of space and actor like me has got many opportunities to be a part of different kinds of stories." Namit added that this would have been difficult when the options were limited to films or television.

news_headline: When I was getting married, people told me my career is over: Genelia
news_article: Speaking about taking a break from movies after marriage, Genelia Deshmukh said, "I had people telling me...your career is done...but I was clear that it isn't going to stop me from marrying." Genelia will next feature in the film 'It's My Life', which will release on television on November 29. The film, starring Harman Baweja, was shot back in 2007.

news_headline: Kangana reacts after Mumbai Mayor calls her 'do takke ke log'
news_article: Kangana Ranaut has reacted to a video wherein Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar called the actress "do takke ke log" after the Bombay High Court quashed BMC's demolition notice to Kangana. She tweeted, "The amount of...cases, abuses, insults...I faced from Maharashtra government in these few months make Bollywood mafia and people like Aditya Pancholi and Hrithik Roshan seem like kind souls."

news_headline: I know actors who buy followers to show off their popularity: Sharad Malhotra
news_article: Actor Sharad Malhotra has said buying followers on social media isn't just restricted to the music industry. He added that he knows some actors who do the same to show off their popularity. "They want to hit...million mark soonest possible. I'm no one to pass judgements here, but I personally don't believe this is the right approach," Sharad further said.

news_headline: Chef Vikas' directorial The Last Color to release in India on Dec 11
news_article: Chef Vikas Khanna's directorial debut 'The Last Color' will release in theatres in India on December 11. The film, which portrays the lives of widows in Varanasi, stars Neena Gupta. Talking about the release, Khanna said, "Having travelled the whole world and taken the film onto the global stage, it indeed feels overwhelming to bring the film to its roots."

news_headline: I'm against censorship on digital platforms: Sumeet
news_article: Speaking about the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting regulating streaming platforms, actor Sumeet Vyas stated that he stands against censorship. "This is a very undemocratic move...we do have a right to information and the freedom to speech," he said. While he opposed censorship, Sumeet added, "I...support...rating process. Series and films...on OTT should be rated according to age."

news_headline: I've done a lot of bad films, I'm grateful I still get work: Rahul
news_article: Speaking about his acting career, 'Aashiqui' star Rahul Roy said, "I have done a lot of bad films and I've accepted them...I am grateful that I still get work." The actor, who will next star in the film 'Sayonee', added, "A lot of people didn't want to take me...but they will...see that I have completely revolutionized my way of working."

news_headline: Don’t know if people will risk their lives to visit theatres: Vikram
news_article: Speaking about films releasing in theatres amid the coronavirus pandemic, filmmaker Vikram Bhatt said, "It's wonderful that theatres are opening...but...it's going to be a long wait to start audiences to come and watch films like they used to." He further said, "I don't know how many people will be willing to risk their lives to watch a movie."

news_headline: The new 'Coolie No 1' has its own journey: Varun Dhawan
news_article: On being asked what aspects of the original 'Coolie No 1' will the new film retain, Varun Dhawan said, "Screenplay of original...was outstanding, which was written by Rumi Jaffery, Kader Khan." He added, "We've tried to keep that intact but the new film continues its own journey as well." Directed by David Dhawan, the film also stars Sara Ali Khan.

news_headline: Sunny Singh approached to play Laxman in 'Adipurush': Reports
news_article: Actor Sunny Singh has reportedly been approached to play the role of Laxman in Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan-starrer 'Adipurush'. The 3D action-drama will see Prabhas essaying the role of Lord Ram and Saif playing the antagonist Lankesh. The film, which will be directed by Om Raut, is scheduled to hit the theatres on August 11, 2022.

news_headline: Arshad joins Akshay and Kriti starrer 'Bachchan Pandey': Reports
news_article: Actor Arshad Warsi has been roped in to play Akshay Kumar's friend in the upcoming film 'Bachchan Pandey', Mumbai Mirror reported. While Akshay and Arshad have never worked together in a film before, they have been part of the 'Jolly LLB' franchise. The production of the film, which will also star Kriti Sanon, will reportedly start in January 2021.

news_headline: Tesla opens its largest EV super-charging station in US
news_article: Tesla has opened its largest Supercharger station with 56 charging points. The charging network is located between the Bay Area and Los Angeles, two of Tesla's biggest markets in the world, as per Electrek. Tesla has also built solar canopies for providing shade to the charging electric vehicles while also helping power the Supercharger station.

news_headline: UK to ban sale of new diesel, petrol cars from 2030: Report
news_article: UK PM Boris Johnson is set to ban the sale of new petrol and diesel cars from 2030, reported Financial Times. The ban was first scheduled for 2040, which Johnson moved to 2035 in February and is now set to move the date five years ahead again. Petrol and diesel cars accounted for 73.6% of UK sales in 2020.

news_headline: India only G20 nation on track to meet Paris climate deal's 2°C goal: Report
news_article: India is the only G20 nation that’s on track to meet a goal of the Paris climate agreement of capping temperatures well below 2°C before the end of the century, a report by Climate Transparency said. India could be a global leader if it didn’t build new coal-fired power and phased out use of coal by 2040, it added.

news_headline: What makes new mushroom species discovered in Meghalaya forests glow bright green?
news_article: A bright green light-emitting variety of mushroom named Roridomyces phyllostachydis has been discovered in forests of Meghalaya. The luminescence comes from the enzyme, luciferase. "Light emits when luciferans is catalysed by luciferase in presence of oxygen...Several unstable intermediate products are released as excess energy that makes them visible as light," a researcher said.

news_headline: India plans to launch ₹4,000 cr deep ocean mission in 3-4 months
news_article: India plans to launch over ₹4,000 cr deep ocean mission to explore minerals, energy and marine diversity of the underwater world, in the next three to four months. A Ministry of Earth Sciences secretary said approvals are being obtained for the "futuristic and game-changing" mission. He added that the mission will include developing technologies for different deep ocean initiatives.

news_headline: US, Europe, SpaceX launch Sentinel-6 satellite to track rising sea levels
news_article: US' NASA and the European Space Agency have partnered with Elon Musk's SpaceX to launch Copernicus Sentinel-6 Michael Freilich satellite, designed to gauge rising levels for over 90% of Earth's oceans. The satellite will help improve weather forecasts and navigation courses for ships by tracking current changes. A twin satellite, Sentinel-6B will launch in 2025 to complete the network.

news_headline: SpaceX Dragon is best: Astronaut who's also flown on US, Russian spacecraft
news_article: Japanese astronaut Soichi Noguchi from NASA's 'Crew-1' mission with SpaceX, who has now been aboard three kinds of spacecraft, said SpaceX's Crew Dragon is the "best". Noguchi flew aboard US Space Shuttle in 2005 and Russian Soyuz spaceship in 2009. "It's really fun to ride, and two days in Dragon is really remarkable memories," Noguchi said after docking with ISS.

news_headline: Oldest known man-made nanostructures found in Tamil Nadu: Scientists
news_article: Scientists, including those from VIT, discovered the oldest known man-made nano-materials in the "unique black coatings" of ancient pottery shards in Tamil Nadu. The coatings are made of carbon nanotubes which allowed the layer to last over 2,600 years, researchers said. They added the oldest known nanostructures in human-made artefacts until now were from the eighth or ninth century AD.

news_headline: Netherlands kills 1.9L chickens over 'highly-contagious bird flu strain'
news_article: Dutch authorities have culled around 1.9 lakh chickens after a bird flu outbreak on at least two poultry farms. In both the cases "a highly-contagious strain of the H5 variant" was suspected, the agriculture ministry said. There were no other poultry farms within a one-kilometre radius of the outbreaks.

news_headline: Remains of 'man & his slave' who died 2,000 yrs ago found in Italy
news_article: Archaeologists have discovered well-preserved remains of a possibly rich man and his slave scalded to death by Mount Vesuvius' eruption nearly 2,000 years ago in Italy. The remains were found in a layer of grey ash at least 2 metres deep. Researchers said one of the men was estimated to be 18-25-years-old, while the other 30-40-years-old.

news_headline: People don't care whether this looks like an alien invasion: BioVYZR inventor
news_article: Yezin Al-Qaysi, the Canadian inventor of the roughly ₹28,000 ($379) COVID-19 helmet BioVYZR, said some thought his invention is "ridiculous" while some said they didn't care "whether this looks like an alien invasion". Al-Qaysi said he invented the air purifier-fit helmet because he believes masks have limitations. "It feels like you're standing under an umbrella," he said about the experience.

news_headline: Rohit needs to captain India if Virat is not there: Michael Clarke
news_article: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke said Rohit Sharma needs to lead the side in the Test series after Virat Kohli flies back. "If I was picking the Indian team before they came to Australia and knew that Virat was going to go home after the first Test, I would have picked Rohit Sharma...his [Rohit's] captaincy and leadership is outstanding," Clarke said.

news_headline: KL Rahul jokes around with Finch after he gets hit on stomach, video viral
news_article: Team India wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul joked around with Australia captain Aaron Finch after the latter was hit on the stomach by a full-toss delivery by fast bowler Navdeep Saini. In a video that has gone viral, Rahul can be seen checking on Finch by touching his stomach. "This series is too friendly," a commentator was heard saying.

news_headline: I've lost my sense of smell: Aakash trolls himself as India fail to take wicket
news_article: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra, who had predicted that India will take a wicket with the new ball against Australia in the second ODI, trolled himself after India failed to break through. "A wicket with the new ball....you can almost smell it in Mumbai," Chopra had earlier tweeted. Commenting on it, he wrote, "I think I’ve lost my sense of smell."

news_headline: Virat Kohli becomes 9th out of 231 Indian cricketers to play 250 ODIs
news_article: Team India captain Virat Kohli has become the ninth Indian cricketer to play 250 ODIs, achieving the feat in the second ODI against Australia in Sydney on Sunday. A total of 231 Indian cricketers have played ODI cricket. Sachin Tendulkar holds the record for playing most ODIs among Indians (463). Kohli had made his ODI debut in 2008.

news_headline: Tiger's sister replies to man asking if she underwent plastic surgery, shares chat
news_article: Actor Tiger Shroff's sister Krishna Shroff took to Instagram Story to share a screenshot of her reply to a man who sent her a message and asked her if she has undergone plastic surgery. "It's makeup. It's called overlining the lips. You guys have been with b***hes that look different the night before you wake up with them," she said.

news_headline: Vidya's team's car stopped from entering forest as she 'rejected' minister's invite
news_article: Vehicles of production team of Vidya Balan's upcoming film were allegedly stopped from entering a Madhya Pradesh forest for shooting. This was after she reportedly rejected Madhya Pradesh Forest Minister Vijay Shah's dinner invitation. Commenting on reports, Shah said, "I was there on request from those who took permission for shoot and requested me for dinner. I said not possible."

news_headline: Hacker selling access to email accounts of CEOs, CFOs for as less as ₹7,400
news_article: A hacker is selling passwords for email accounts of hundreds of C-level executives at companies across the world, according to a report on ZDNet. "The data is being sold on a closed-access underground forum for Russian-speaking hackers named Exploit.in," the report said. Access to the accounts is being sold for prices ranging from $100 to $1,500 (₹7,400 to ₹1.1 lakh).

news_headline: Who is Masetti, engineer praised by PM Modi for teaching Vedanta in Brazil?
news_article: PM Narendra Modi during 'Mann Ki Baat' address praised Jonas Masetti, a Brazilian who worked for his stock market company after completing mechanical engineering. Also known as 'Vishvanath', Masetti teaches Vedanta and Geeta to people in Brazil and runs an institution named Vishva Vidya. He studied Vedanta Philosophy in India, staying at Arsha Vidya Gurukulam in Coimbatore for four years.

news_headline: Man dressed as Amazon staff steals packages from people's porches in US
news_article: The Richmond Police in the US has released a picture of the man who has been stealing packages from people's front porches, dressed as an Amazon delivery driver. The man walks up to people's homes with a dummy box in hand and swaps them with parcels that are already present. After picking up packages, he leaves in a blue car.

news_headline: Case for immediate rollout of 5G in India compelling: Qualcomm
news_article: Qualcomm India and SAARC President Rajen Vagadia said the case for the immediate rollout of 5G in India is "compelling" and "it's no longer a choice, but a prerequisite for the country’s growth and development". He added that the government can trigger growth of the telecom space by releasing spectrum, including 5G, in adequate quantity and at affordable prices.

news_headline: US maintains ban on phone calls during flights
news_article: US' Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has killed a proposal to allow in-flight voice calls via mobile phones after the proposition drew "strong opposition". The proposal "fail[s] to address significant safety and national security concerns," according to US pilots and flight attendants. The FCC made the proposal in 2013 to allow mobile telephone conversations above 10,000 feet.

news_headline: US internet entrepreneur and ex-Zappos CEO Tony Hsieh dies at 46
news_article: Former CEO of online fashion retailer Zappos Tony Hsieh has died aged 46 after a house fire in Connecticut, US. Hsieh was reportedly visiting family, having recently retired after 20 years leading Zappos, which was acquired by Amazon for more than $1 billion in 2009. Hsieh sold his first company to Microsoft in 1998 for $265 million.

news_headline: Amazon Web Services outage was triggered by capacity upgrade
news_article: Amazon's cloud computing network, Amazon Web Services' (AWS) major outage on Wednesday was triggered by an effort to upgrade capacity, the company said. "The trigger, though not root cause, for the event was a relatively small addition of capacity," it said. The outage impacted Bezos-owned The Washington Post, video-streaming service Roku, Flickr and the New York subway, among others.

news_headline: Warner-Finch equals Sachin-Sehwag's ODI record of 12 first-wicket century stands
news_article: Australia's Aaron Finch and David Warner equalled Virender Sehwag and Sachin Tendulkar's record of 12 first-wicket century stands in ODIs. The duo reached the milestone against India in the 2nd ODI on Sunday and went on to put on an opening stand of 142 runs. Sourav Ganguly and Sachin Tendulkar lead the list with 21 first-wicket century stands in ODIs.

news_headline: Indian fan proposes to Australian girlfriend in stands as Maxwell claps from field
news_article: After the 20th over of India's innings in the second ODI against Australia, a Team India fan proposed to his Australian girlfriend in the stands. In a video that went viral, the fan can be seen going down on one knee and proposing to the girl, who nodded in affirmative. Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was seen clapping from the field.

news_headline: Russell's pic wearing KKR gloves in Lankan Premier League surfaces, league trolled
news_article: A picture of West Indian all-rounder Andre Russell wearing KKR gloves while batting for Colombo Kings against Galle Gladiators in Lankan Premier League has surfaced online. Several fans trolled the league, with one of them writing, "It seems gloves quality in IPL is very high." Meanwhile, another fan wrote, "LPL budget must be low; can’t provide gloves I guess."

news_headline: Australia record their highest ODI total vs India, break record set in last match
news_article: With their top five batsmen registering scores of 50-plus each, Australia put up a total of 389/4 against India in the second ODI today. With this, Australia recorded their highest ODI total against India, breaking the record they set in the first ODI on Friday after putting up a total of 374/6. On Friday, Australia had broken their 17-year-old record.

news_headline: Top 5 batsmen score 50+ runs for a team in an ODI for 2nd time in history
news_article: Australia's top five batsmen (David Warner, Aaron Finch, Steve Smith, Marnus Labuschagne and Glenn Maxwell) scored fifty-plus runs against India in the second ODI on Sunday. This is the second instance of each of the top five batsmen scoring fifty-plus runs in an ODI innings. Australia's top five batsmen had scored 50+ runs against India in Jaipur ODI in 2013.

news_headline: Steve Smith smashes hundred off 62 deliveries for 2 ODIs in a row
news_article: Australia batsman Steve Smith smashed a hundred off 62 deliveries against India in the second ODI after having scored a hundred in as many deliveries in the first ODI. With this, he became the first Australian since David Warner in 2016 to score back-to-back ODI hundreds. Smith also became the fourth cricketer to smash three consecutive ODI tons against India.

news_headline: Maradona had almost nothing left in his bank account, he died poor: Friend
news_article: Argentine football legend Diego Maradona had almost nothing left in his bank account and he died poor, friend Luis Ventura said. "Maradona's wealth was squandered because of his pierced hands and largely stolen in order to trick him...All they had to do was ask and he gave," he added. "He never had over €100 in his pocket," Maradona's lawyer said.

news_headline: Definitely in race for Tokyo Olympics: 2012 Olympics bronze medallist Nehwal
news_article: Shuttler Saina Nehwal, who currently ranks 22nd in BWF's Tokyo Olympics qualification rankings, has said that she's "definitely in the race" for Tokyo Olympics. "Before [Tokyo]...I've to get back to my rhythm and win against the players who're in top-20," she added. "What will I do sitting at home. This is my life, this is my job," she further said.

news_headline: Better than fighting for c'ships: Mike Tyson on his return for charity bout
news_article: On his return to the ring after 15 years, former American boxer Mike Tyson said fighting in matches to raise money for charities was "better than fighting for championships". On Saturday, 54-year-old Tyson fought eight two-minute rounds against 51-year-old Roy Jones Junior in an exhibition match in Los Angeles. "We're humanitarians now...We've got to do this again," Tyson said.

news_headline: Feel for Virat, selectors missed a trick: Kaif on absence of sixth bowler
news_article: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said he understood captain Virat Kohli's situation after BCCI selectors missed a trick while selecting the ODI squad against Australia. "No amount of chopping or changing will give Virat Kohli the sixth bowling option...A pace bowling all-rounder who doesn't bowl, a long tail, no part-time bowler in top order or on the bench," tweeted Kaif.

news_headline: Host New Zealand beat West Indies by 72 runs in 2nd T20I
news_article: New Zealand defeated West Indies by 72 runs in the second T20I on Sunday to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Put into bat, New Zealand scored 238/3, courtesy Glenn Phillips' maiden T20I century (51-ball 108). Phillips reached his ton in 46 balls, fastest by a Kiwi batsman. In reply, West Indies managed 166/9 in 20 overs.

news_headline: Kohli 3rd Indian batsman to score 2000 ODI runs against Australia
news_article: Scoring 89 off 87 balls in the second ODI against Australia on Sunday, India captain Virat Kohli became the third Indian and fifth overall batsman to complete 2000 ODI runs against Australia. Kohli achieved the feat in his 40th innings. Sachin Tendulkar and Rohit Sharma are the other two Indian batsmen who have amassed 2000 ODI runs against Australia.

news_headline: Olympic-bound Sable breaks national half marathon record, run it in less than 61 minutes
news_article: Tokyo Olympics-bound 26-year-old Avinash Sable has become the first Indian to run a half marathon (21.09 km) under sixty-one minutes. Sable, who finished 10th overall at the Airtel Delhi Half Marathon, clocked 1:00:30 seconds with the next Indian runner Srinu Bugatha clocking 1:04:16 seconds. The earlier national half marathon record was 1:03:46 seconds in the name of Kalidas Hirave.

news_headline: Which are world's most expensive cities to live in during COVID-19 pandemic?
news_article: According to The Economist Intelligence Unit, COVID-19 pandemic has changed the cost of living in about 130 cities around the world. In 2020, Hong Kong remained the most expensive city to live in, but was joined by Zurich and Paris on the top spot. Singapore dropped to the 4th spot, followed by Tel Aviv and Osaka sharing the 5th spot.

news_headline: Woman who had COVID-19 gives birth to baby with antibodies: Reports
news_article: A Singapore woman, who was infected with the novel coronavirus in March when she was pregnant, has given birth to a baby with antibodies against the virus, the Straits Times reported. "My doctor suspects I have transferred my COVID-19 antibodies to him during my pregnancy," Celine Ng-Chan told the paper. Ng-Chan had been mildly ill from the disease.

news_headline: Total fire ban issued after parts of Aus witness hottest Nov night on record
news_article: A total fire ban has been issued after parts of Australia witnessed the hottest November night on record with temperatures likely to stay high on Sunday. While Sydney CBD surpassed 40°C, parts of western New South Wales, South Australia and northern Victoria saw temperatures nearing 45°C. The Bureau of Meteorology has predicted a five or six-day heatwave for some regions.

news_headline: Coin removed from man's nose after being stuck for over 50 years
news_article: A coin has been removed from a Russian man's nose after being stuck for over 50 years. The man was six years old when he put the coin up his right nostril. Doctors said rhinoliths – stones in the nasal cavity – had formed around the coin, constricting the man's ability to breathe.

news_headline: US maintains ban on phone calls during flights
news_article: US' Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has killed a proposal to allow in-flight voice calls via mobile phones after the proposition drew "strong opposition". The proposal "fail[s] to address significant safety and national security concerns," according to US pilots and flight attendants. The FCC made the proposal in 2013 to allow mobile telephone conversations above 10,000 feet.

news_headline: Car bomb blast kills at least 30 Afghan security force personnel
news_article: A car bomb blast in Afghanistan's central province of Ghazni has killed at least 30 Afghan security force members and injured 24 others on Sunday, officials said. The blast targeted a compound of the public protection force, a wing of the Afghan security forces, local officials said. Civilian residences around the compound were also damaged in the blast, they added.

news_headline: 'Shameless' becomes India's entry for Oscar in short film category
news_article: Filmmaker Keith Gomes' short film 'Shameless' has been selected as India's official entry at the 93rd Oscars in the Live Action Short Film category. The film was released last year and it starred Sayani Gupta and Hussain Dalal. "I make films with little funding from family and friends, everyone comes together with loads of love and passion," Gomes said.

news_headline: If 10,000 people say boycott that, 20,000 people watch it: Rohit Saraf
news_article: Speaking about people demanding the boycott of various films and web-series on social media, actor Rohit Suresh Saraf said, "If there are 10,000 people saying boycott that, there are another 20,000 people watching it." Stating that there is an audience for everything, Rohit added, "There will be one person who wants to watch what you have made...I think that is...important."

news_headline: Life without you is so basic: Alia on sister Shaheen's birthday
news_article: Actress Alia Bhatt shared a poem on Instagram to mark her sister Shaheen Bhatt's 32nd birthday on Saturday. "Life without you is just so basic, also who would look after my arms and leggies? I know we're technically sisters, but I believe you're my soul mate too," she wrote alongside a series of pictures featuring the two sisters.

news_headline: I've learned a lot about love while dating Shawn: Camila Cabello
news_article: Singer Camila Cabello took to Instagram to talk about her relationship with Shawn Mendes and mentioned that she learned a lot about love while dating him. "It's not as simple as it looks in pictures...sometimes, it's messy and uncomfortable and ugly...but there's nothing like the...force that is love," she wrote alongside a photo of them kissing.

news_headline: Gwyneth Paltrow's 1999 Oscar win didn't make sense: Glenn Close
news_article: During a recent interview, Hollywood star Glenn Close said that actress Gwyneth Paltrow's 1999 Oscar win for 'Shakespeare in Love' didn't make sense. "I remember the year Gwyneth Paltrow won over that incredible actress [Fernanda Montenegro] who was in Central Station. I thought, 'What?' It doesn't make sense," she said on ABC News.

news_headline: Dior features Depp as face of cologne following 'wife beater' ruling
news_article: While Warner Bros fired Johnny Depp from the 'Fantastic Beasts' franchise following the recent 'wife beater' court ruling, luxury fashion label Dior is continuing to feature the Hollywood actor as the face of the brand's Sauvage cologne. Earlier this week, an advertisement for the cologne, featuring Depp playing guitar, appeared on British TV, Page Six reported.

news_headline: I crave for experiences I can grow with: Ishaan on choosing scripts
news_article: Talking about how he chooses movie scripts, Ishaan Khatter said that he is mostly driven by instinct and added, "I want to work with certain people and I crave for experiences I can grow with." The actor, who will next star in the horror-comedy film 'Phone Bhoot', told Times of India, "Comedy is one of the hardest things to crack."

news_headline: AutoX becomes first company in China to deploy fully driverless RoboTaxis
news_article: Alibaba-backed AutoX has received government approval to deploy a fleet of 25 fully driverless cars on the streets of Shenzhen, China. This will mark the first time that autonomous driving cars will be tested in China without any accompanying safety drivers or  remote operators. However, the "RoboTaxis" will not be open to the public yet, AutoX spokesperson told TechCrunch.

news_headline: Trump govt sues Facebook for favouring immigrants over US workers
news_article: Trump administration on Thursday sued Facebook for discriminating against the US workers by favouring immigrant applicants to fill over 2,600 high-paying jobs. Facebook "channelled" jobs to temporary visa holders by avoiding advertising on its careers website and reserving jobs, the lawsuit alleged. The lawsuit follows a two-year investigation by the Justice Department's Civil Rights Division.

news_headline: China did human testing to create biologically enhanced soldiers: US intel chief
news_article: China has conducted "human testing" on members of its army "in hopes of developing soldiers with biologically enhanced capabilities", the US Director of National Intelligence John Ratcliffe said. "There are no ethical boundaries to Beijing's pursuit of power," he added. US-based think tanks have reported that China is giving increasing importance to biotechnology in its military strategy.

news_headline: Dead man banned from his own funeral after body arrives on chair
news_article: A deceased man was banned from his own funeral after his body was brought to a church on a chair and not in a coffin. Che Lewis, 29, died after being shot at his home in the town of Diego Martin in Trinidad and Tobago. Videos show Che's body dressed in white trousers and a pink blazer and tie.

news_headline: Cobbler makes size-75 winter boots to keep people apart amid COVID-19
news_article: A Romanian cobbler has come up with long-nosed winter boots to keep people apart during COVID-19. Each pair of the size-75 boots costs €150. Romania, which has reported 4,92,211 coronavirus cases since late-February and 11,876 deaths, has made wearing a mask mandatory in all public spaces and imposed a curfew to cope with the second wave.

news_headline: Will ask all Americans to wear masks for 100 days: Joe Biden
news_article: US President-elect Joe Biden on Thursday said that he will ask Americans to wear masks for first 100 days of his presidency to curb the spread of coronavirus. He added that there would be a "significant reduction" in the COVID-19 cases if everyone wore masks. US is the worst coronavirus-hit country in the world with over 1.4 crore COVID-19 cases.

news_headline: Trump govt sues Facebook for favouring immigrants over US workers
news_article: Trump administration on Thursday sued Facebook for discriminating against the US workers by favouring immigrant applicants to fill over 2,600 high-paying jobs. Facebook "channelled" jobs to temporary visa holders by avoiding advertising on its careers website and reserving jobs, the lawsuit alleged. The lawsuit follows a two-year investigation by the Justice Department's Civil Rights Division.

news_headline: Alyssa Farah resigns as White House Communications Director
news_article: Alyssa Farah resigned as the White House Communications Director after serving over three years in the Donald Trump administration. "I am deeply proud of the incredible things we were able to accomplish to make our country stronger, safer and more secure," she tweeted announcing her resignation. Before this, Farah served as the Press Secretary to Vice President and Defence Secretary.

news_headline: Initial trends show BJP leading in 85 out of 150 seats in GHMC polls
news_article: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) took an early lead in the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation elections on Friday, leading in 85 of the 150 seats, as per initial trends, according to ETV. The ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) is leading in 29 seats, while Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM is ahead in 17, and the Congress in two.

news_headline: Refugees from Pakistan dance after casting votes in DDC polls in J&K
