news_headline: Tesla cancels its seven-day return policy: Report
news_article: Tesla has removed its 'no questions asked', seven-day return policy, Electrek reported. The support page for the policy now redirects users to Tesla's general support page without any replacement policy. Sources told Electrek that dissatisfied buyers will now be referred to Tesla's service department if they wish to return a vehicle for any reason.

news_headline: Tesla is a chain of over a dozen startups: Elon Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said his vehicle company should be thought of as a chain of "roughly a dozen technology startups, many of which have little to no correlation with traditional automotive companies". He said that he sees every "major product line" and "big new plant" as startups. He added that there are no plans to spin out any business.

news_headline: Tesla to recall 30,000 imported Model S & Model X vehicles in China
news_article: Tesla is recalling around 30,000 imported Model S and Model X vehicles in China due to suspension problems. The State Administration for Market Regulation (SAMR) in China said there are two different suspension defects, with some recalled vehicles potentially having both of them. The recall will not affect vehicles produced in the Shanghai facility which started operating earlier this year.

news_headline: Tesla sets revenue record in Q3 at $8.8 billion
news_article: Elon Musk's Tesla on Wednesday reported its fifth consecutive profit, at $331 million in the September quarter (Q3), on a record revenue of $8.8 billion. Apart from automobile sales, the company also generated $397 million from selling regulatory pollution credits. It reaffirmed its target of completing 5,00,000 deliveries this year, but Musk added that it has become difficult.

news_headline: COVID-19 has pushed back India's luxury car market by 5-7 yrs: Audi
news_article: Audi India Head Balbir Singh Dhillon said COVID-19 has hit hard India's luxury car market, taking it back by five to seven years. He added that it will take around three years to reach 2014-2015 levels. Dhillon added "even last year was a degrowth year", with the top five luxury carmakers selling 35,500 units, down from 40,340 in 2018.

news_headline: NASA announces discovery of water on sunlit surface of Moon
news_article: NASA on Monday announced that its Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) has confirmed there's water on the sunlit surface of the Moon. This discovery indicates that water may be distributed across the lunar surface, and not limited to cold, shadowed places. SOFIA has detected water molecules (H2O) in Clavius Crater, one of the largest craters visible from Earth.

news_headline: Russia pauses COVID-19 vaccine trial due to shortage of doses: Report
news_article: Russia has temporarily stopped vaccinating new volunteers in its COVID-19 vaccine trial due to high demand and a shortage of doses, Reuters reported quoting a representative at the firm running the study. The vaccination of new participants was on hold at eight of the 25 Moscow clinics hosting the trial, staff told Reuters.

news_headline: Researchers 3D print working boat a third of the thickness of a hair
news_article: Researchers at the Netherlands' Leiden University have 3D printed a little boat measuring 30 micrometres, about a third of the thickness of a hair. The researchers also printed spiral-shaped particles, which rotate along while they are propelled through the water. The 3D-printed boat is part of an exploration of microswimmers like bacteria and sperm.

news_headline: NASA spacecraft captures Jupiter's colourful electrical outbursts for 1st time
news_article: NASA's Juno mission spacecraft has, for the first time, captured bright and extremely brief flashes of light formally known as 'transient luminous events' (TLEs) on Jupiter. The lightning phenomenon is known as a 'sprite' and Jupiter's hydrogen-rich atmosphere would likely make them appear blue, NASA said. Sprites are TLEs triggered by lightning discharges from thunderstorms far below.

news_headline: Earliest direct evidence of dairy farming found in Indus Valley Civilisation
news_article: A team of Indian and Canadian researchers have found the earliest direct evidence of dairy product processing. They found that dairy production began way back in third millennium BCE with Indus Civilisation's emergence. The researchers analysed absorbed lipid residues from fifty-nine ceramic sherds recovered from an agro-pastoral settlement that was occupied during the peak of the Indus period.

news_headline: Coral reef taller than Eiffel Tower found in Australia: Scientists
news_article: Schmidt Ocean Institute has announced that scientists have discovered a detached coral reef, taller than the Eiffel Tower and the Empire State Building, in the Great Barrier Reef. The 500 metre-high reef is the first of its size to be discovered in over 120 years in the area. It adds to the seven other tall detached reefs in the area.

news_headline: 'Sleeping giant' Arctic methane deposits have started to release: Scientists
news_article: An international team of scientists on board Russian research ship R/V Akademik Keldysh has found evidence that frozen methane deposits in the Arctic Ocean have started to release. The deposits are known as the 'sleeping giants of the carbon cycle'. The deposits are being released over a large area of the continental slope off the East Siberian coast, scientists said.

news_headline: Samples collected from asteroid sealed in a capsule for return to Earth in 2023
news_article: Around 60 grams of material collected from the asteroid Bennu by NASA's OSIRIS-REx spacecraft has been sealed up in a protective re-entry capsule for return to Earth in 2023. The stowage process, originally scheduled to begin in early November, was expedited after images showed the spacecraft's collector head overflowing with the material.

news_headline: Asteroid estimated to be worth $10,000 quadrillion observed through Hubble Telescope
news_article: A metallic asteroid worth approximately $10,000 quadrillion is orbiting between Mars and Jupiter, as per a new report from Planetary Science Journal. According to the Hubble Telescope data, Asteroid 16 Psyche has a diameter of about 140 miles and it is believed to be mostly made of iron and nickel. In 2022, NASA will send an unmanned spacecraft to Psyche.

news_headline: NASA spots 'giant pumpkin' in space, shares pics to mark Halloween
news_article: NASA shared Hubble Space Telescope's snapshots showing the early stages of a collision between two galaxies that resemble a Halloween carved pumpkin jack-o'-lantern. Sharing a video, NASA wrote, "Hubble Spots Giant Space 'Pumpkin'. Two glowing eyes, and a crooked, carved smile." "The entire view is nearly 109,000 light-years across, approximately the diameter of our Milky Way," it added.

news_headline: 150 km-long iceberg on collision path with British territory
news_article: A 150 km-long and 48 km-wide Antarctic iceberg is heading for the British Overseas Territory of South Georgia with concerns that it could disrupt its economy and its wildlife. A-68A, which is of the same size as South Georgia, was one of the largest icebergs on record when it calved. It split from Antarctica's Larsen C ice shelf in 2017.

news_headline: Scientists discover life-threatening inflammatory disease in men
news_article: Scientists at the US' National Institutes of Health discovered a life-threatening inflammatory disease affecting men known as the VEXAS syndrome, which is caused by mutations in the UBA1 gene. They studied the genome sequences from more than 2,500 individuals with undiagnosed inflammatory diseases. VEXAS causes symptoms including blood clots in veins, recurrent fevers and pulmonary abnormalities.

news_headline: Remdesivir's use makes sense in some COVID-19 cases: Germany
news_article: Germany's Health Minister Jens Spahn, while discussing Germany's decision to purchase additional supplies of remdesivir for treating COVID-19, said its use "makes sense in some situations". He added that since its need had risen "enormously", Germany procured additional supplies of remdesivir. Germany has requested for around 5% of remdesivir's supply under a six-month EU supply deal with Gilead.

news_headline: IIT Roorkee makes biosensor to detect harmful detergent pollutant
news_article: IIT Roorkee claims to have developed world's first specific reliable bacterial biosensor that detects the presence of environmental pollutant, Sodium Dodecyl Sulphate. It's highly specific for SDS and has minimal interference from other detergents, metals and inorganic ions present in the environment. It showed a satisfactory and reproducible recovery rate for SDS detection in real water samples.

news_headline: IISc and Indian Oil sign MoU for hydrogen generation technology
news_article: Bengaluru's IISc and the Indian Oil Corporation signed an MoU to develop and demonstrate biomass gasification-based hydrogen generation technology. The developed technology will be scaled up and demonstrated at Indian Oil's R&D Centre at Faridabad. Hydrogen generated from this demonstration plant will be used to power fuel cell buses as part of a "bigger project" being conceived by Indian Oil.

news_headline: Researchers develop robot inspired by movements of cockroaches, lizards
news_article: Researchers at Israel's Ben-Gurion University of the Negev (BGU) have developed an amphibious robot, inspired by the movements of cockroaches and basilisk lizard, that can swim and run on water at high speeds. The AmphiSTAR robot can attain speeds of 3.6 metre per second over grass, gravel and concrete and 1.5 metre per second while swimming or running on water.

news_headline: NASA, SpaceX target Nov 14 for the first Crew Dragon launch
news_article: NASA and SpaceX have set November 14 as the latest launch date for the first operational flight of SpaceX's astronaut taxi Crew Dragon. As part of its Crew-1 mission, SpaceX will send four astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS) for NASA. The Crew-1 astronauts will join the ISS crew, adding to the amount of crew time available for research.

news_headline: Scientists rediscover chameleon species after 100 yrs in Madagascar
news_article: An expedition led by the Munich State Zoological Collection tracked the rare Voeltzkow's chameleon in northwest Madagascar, after it was lost for over 100 years. Genetic studies have shown that the species is most closely related to Labord's chameleon. The team also discovered previously unknown females of the species, who, especially during pregnancy, put on an "extremely magnificent colour".

news_headline: Great fox-spider assumed extinct in Britain discovered after 27 yrs
news_article: The great fox-spider, which was assumed to be extinct, was rediscovered at a Ministry of Defence training ground in Surrey, UK. It had only ever been found at three sites, in Dorset and Surrey, and had not been seen since 1993. Mike Waite from Surrey Wildlife Trust discovered the spider after two years of searching.

news_headline: US world's biggest generator of plastic waste: Study
news_article: A study in which the University of Georgia participated said the US produces more plastic waste than any other nation. Researchers studied data from 2016 and said the US had the largest annual per capita plastic waste generation of the top plastic waste-generating countries. They added that, in 2016, it shipped over half of all plastics collected for recycling abroad.

news_headline: Scientists develop faster way of detecting antibiotic resistance in bacteria
news_article: The University of Sheffield revealed scientists have developed a quicker way of detecting resistance in bacteria. The method uses nanotechnology to detect antibiotic resistance in approximately 45 minutes. This could improve people's ability to "prescribe antibiotics correctly" and "reduce the misuse of antibiotic treatments". The method doesn't require the bacteria to be immobilised.

news_headline: Warming of 2°C would release billions of tonnes of soil carbon: Study
news_article: A University of Exeter-led study said global warming of 2°C would lead to about 230 billion tonnes of carbon being released from the world's soil. The estimated 230 billion tonnes of carbon released at 2°C warming (above pre-industrial levels) is more than four times China's total emissions. Global soils contain two-three times more carbon than the atmosphere, the study said.

news_headline: New black coral species found on Pacific Ocean seabed
news_article: Three species of black coral have been discovered on the northern Pacific Ocean seabed. They were discovered on deep seamounts and ridges in the mineral-rich Prime Crust Zone, which stretches from the Mariana Trench to the Hawaiian islands. Daniel Wagner of Conservation International said the species are "slow-growing and long-lived" and "also provide important habitat for many other species".

news_headline: Release of Fukushima's water into sea can damage human DNA: Greenpeace
news_article: The release of Fukushima nuclear plant's contaminated water into the sea can damage human DNA, according to a Greenpeace report. The group said the 1.23 million tonnes of treated water contains "dangerous" levels of radioactive isotope carbon-14. While it was earlier reported that Japan had decided to release the water, reports later said the government has put off the move.

news_headline: How will WhatsApp's 'disappearing messages' feature work?
news_article: WhatsApp's soon-to-be-launched 'disappearing messages' feature will make new messages sent in individual or group chats disappear after seven days. Either user can turn disappearing messages on or off in individual chat, however, only admins can do so in groups. The option won't be enabled by default and users will have to opt for it by tapping on the contact's name.

news_headline: Future Group sets aside ₹1,000 cr for potential Amazon arbitration: Reports
news_article: Kishore Biyani's Future Group has reportedly set aside ₹1,000 crore as a safeguard measure to pay in damages if it loses against Amazon in a potential arbitration case, The Indian Express reported. This comes after Future Group's ₹24,713 crore-deal with Reliance ran into legal trouble after Amazon objected, claiming its "contractual rights" have been violated.

news_headline: Reliance's fibre-optic unit raises $1 bn from ADIA, PIF
news_article: Reliance Industries has announced that Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) and Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund (PIF) will each invest $507.2 million (₹37.8 billion) in the company's Digital Fibre Infrastructure Trust. The company had said in an exchange filing earlier this month that it was raising ₹397.1 billion through stake sales and borrowings for its fibre-optic business.

news_headline: Google, Apple, 44 others support challenge to block H-1B visa changes
news_article: Google, Apple and 44 other US firms and organisations filed an amicus brief supporting a lawsuit challenging upcoming rule changes to H-1B visa eligibility. The lawsuit was recently filed by the US Chamber of Commerce along with others, including 12 organisations and universities. The rules will "stifle the ability of American companies to hire and retain global talent", Twitter said.

news_headline: CRPF warns jawans of Facebook profile cloning for confidential info
news_article: The CRPF has written to its jawans discussing the cloning of their Facebook profiles. "Anti-social elements...are using Facebook profile cloning to target vulnerable users. This...is also being used to target security forces and extract confidential information," the CRPF wrote. In the last few months, some jawans have reportedly complained about people getting requests from their cloned profiles.

news_headline: IISc and Indian Oil sign MoU for hydrogen generation technology
news_article: Bengaluru's IISc and the Indian Oil Corporation signed an MoU to develop and demonstrate biomass gasification-based hydrogen generation technology. The developed technology will be scaled up and demonstrated at Indian Oil's R&D Centre at Faridabad. Hydrogen generated from this demonstration plant will be used to power fuel cell buses as part of a "bigger project" being conceived by Indian Oil.

news_headline: Will vigorously defend TikTok ban order: US
news_article: The US Commerce Department on Sunday said it will comply with a US judge's ruling to stay a ban on TikTok in the country but will also "vigorously defend" its executive order. The judge on Friday had ruled that the government's threats about TikTok "are phrased in the hypothetical". TikTok US' deal with Oracle and Walmart is still in negotiations.

news_headline: Apple asked to pay VirnetX $503 mn in security-patent trial in US
news_article: A US jury has asked Apple to pay VirnetX around $503 million in royalties for VPN on Demand, the iOS feature that allows users access to virtual private networks. VirnetX had argued that both VPN on Demand and Apple's FaceTime features were using its inventions. It had told the jury that it was entitled to more than $700 million.

news_headline: Twitter unfreezes New York Post account after banning for Biden story
news_article: Twitter said it has lifted a freeze it placed on New York Post's account after it published articles on Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden's son Hunter. Twitter had said the stories violated its hacked materials policy and that it has now changed its policies. News Corp, New York Post's parent, said the moment was important for freedom of press.

news_headline: Disney builds robot with life-like human gaze
news_article: Disney's engineers have developed an interactive humanoid robot that is capable of human-like gaze behaviours. The robot is equipped with a chest-mounted sensor that allows it to identify and face the person it's interacting with. The robot has the ability to react realistically to external stimuli as well as to mimic rapid eye movements like humans while studying someone's face.

news_headline: Breaking up firms like Google won't be necessary: EU antitrust head
news_article: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager in an interview said that splitting up large tech companies such as Google and Facebook will not be necessary. "Up until now we haven't had any cases that could lead to such a move," Vestager said. She is due to announce new draft rules for the digital sector on December 2.

news_headline: Will spare no effort in providing level-playing field in e-comm: Govt
news_article: Union Minister Som Parkash assured the government will not spare any efforts in maintaining a level-playing field in e-commerce. He also added that violation of government policies "will not be tolerated any more". He was speaking at the event to launch the logo of the upcoming e-commerce portal 'BharatEMarket' of the traders' body CAIT.

news_headline: Twitter's market value drops by $8.8 bn after posting quarterly report
news_article: Twitter shares plunged 21%, erasing $8.8 billion in market value, after the social media platform reported that it added only one million new daily users in its third-quarter. The company reported fewer new users despite the return of live sports as well as the US presidential election campaign that was expected to drive people to the platform.

news_headline: Reduced App Store commission could affect our financial condition: Apple
news_article: Apple has warned its investors in a regulatory filing that a reduction or elimination in the rate of commission charged by the company on App Store downloads could adversely affect its financial results. The company reported a record revenue of $14.5 billion in its fourth-quarter from the Services segment, which includes fees generated by App Store.

news_headline: Keep doing what you're doing: Google to staff amid antitrust case
news_article: Google CEO Sundar Pichai in an email to staff asked them to continue doing what they are doing amid DOJ's antitrust case. "Scrutiny is nothing new for Google, and we look forward to presenting our case," he added. Google's top lawyer Kent Walker wrote to the employees separately and said, "It's important not to get distracted by this process."

news_headline: Justdial's Q2 net profit falls 38.5% y-o-y to ₹47.3 crore
news_article: Justdial has reported a fall of 38.5% year-on-year in its net profit, which stood at ₹47.3 crore, in the September quarter. Its operating revenue witnessed a decline of 30.9% year-on-year and stood at ₹167.5 crore. Justdial also said that it completed the process of buying back equity shares worth ₹220 crore, which it had announced in July.

news_headline: IIT Roorkee makes biosensor to detect harmful detergent pollutant
news_article: IIT Roorkee claims to have developed world's first specific reliable bacterial biosensor that detects the presence of environmental pollutant, Sodium Dodecyl Sulphate. It's highly specific for SDS and has minimal interference from other detergents, metals and inorganic ions present in the environment. It showed a satisfactory and reproducible recovery rate for SDS detection in real water samples.

news_headline: New iPhone 12 Pro feature to help blind users detect people nearby
news_article: Apple's iPhone 12 Pro and iPhone 12 Pro Max will have a 'People Detection' feature that would help blind users locate others around them. The feature emerged from Apple’s ARKit, which combined with distance measurements provided by the iPhone's Lidar units, will help the visually impaired detect people around. The feature will be available in iOS 14.2 soon.

news_headline: UPI records over 2 bn transactions worth ₹3.86 lakh cr in Oct
news_article: UPI registered 2.07 billion transactions worth ₹3.86 lakh crore in October, NPCI data showed. In September, the number of UPI transactions stood at 1.80 billion with the value of the transactions at ₹3.29 lakh crore. The number of transactions via UPI had crossed the one billion mark in October 2019 for the first time since its launch.

news_headline: Google's initial response to antitrust lawsuit set for Nov 13
news_article: After a status hearing on Friday, US Judge Amit Mehta has asked Google to tell the US Court by November 13 how it will respond to the federal antitrust lawsuit filed against it. The two sides should then make initial disclosures about potential witnesses and evidence that may be used at trial by November 20, Judge Mehta added.

news_headline: Tesla Full Self-Driving beta update to cut interventions by a third: Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk wrote Tesla's new software update under its Full Self-Driving Beta programme could cut driver interventions by a third. Earlier, Tesla had started pushing the software update to owners with the early FSD beta access. Musk said the update addressed several issues and that many of the improvements consist of fixing "silly bugs vs grand eureka moments".

news_headline: 49 countries join US plan to keep Chinese telcos out of 5G sector
news_article: Nearly 49 countries have joined US' "Clean Network" initiative that aims to limit Chinese companies' access to sectors like cloud computing and 5G mobile networks, Undersecretary for Economic Growth, Energy and the Environment, Keith Krach said. The US has imposed restrictions on companies like Huawei, alleging that they're linked to the Chinese Communist Party and pose national-security risk.

news_headline: Facebook starts testing Dark Mode on iOS, Android apps: Report
news_article: Facebook has started testing the Dark Mode on iOS and Android apps, tech blogger Jane Manchun Wong tweeted. Wong also shared a video on Twitter, made in collaboration with Facebook, that shows how the Dark Mode looks like in the Facebook app. The feature can be enabled from the Settings & Privacy option for users who receive the update.

news_headline: US says Iranian hackers successfully accessed voter information
news_article: The US has said Iranian hackers behind threatening emails sent to many Americans earlier had successfully accessed voter data. The FBI and CISA partially confirmed the authenticity of a video sent to people as part of a disinformation campaign. The video, which was sent in a pro-Trump far-right group's name, purported to show hackers breaking into a voter registration system.

news_headline: Apple admits AirPods Pro issues, to replace faulty ones
news_article: Apple has acknowledged that "a small percentage of AirPods Pro may experience sound issues" such as "crackling or static sounds" and faulty Active Noise Cancellation. Apple said it will replace devices with confirmed issues for free and that affected units have been manufactured before October 2020. The company published an "AirPods Pro Service Program" support page for the issue.

news_headline: Imagine this tweet 8-9 years ago: Pietersen criticises ECB over tweet on IPL 2020
news_article: Reacting to ECB's tweet wishing luck to Ben Stokes and Jofra Archer for an IPL 2020 match, Kevin Pietersen took a dig at the board, tweeting, "Just imagine...this tweet 8-9 years ago!" He added, "I'm so happy these guys are benefitting positively from IPL." Notably, Pietersen had a spat with ECB over their reluctance in allowing him to play IPL.

news_headline: It's time to hand this team over to the next generation: CSK captain MS Dhoni
news_article: Following their last match of IPL 2020, CSK captain MS Dhoni said, "It's time to hand the team over to the next generation." He added, "We need to slightly change our core group and look for next 10 years." Dhoni further said, "We will come back strong. That's what we are known for." CSK won six matches in IPL 2020.

news_headline: CSK end their IPL 2020 campaign with 3rd win in a row, KXIP out of playoff race
news_article: CSK defeated KXIP by nine wickets in Abu Dhabi on Sunday to end their IPL 2020 campaign with three wins in a row. With the defeat, KXIP became the second team after CSK to be eliminated from the tournament. CSK moved to seventh position on the points table, while KKR, who have one game in hand, slipped to the bottom.

news_headline: #DefinitelyNot trends on Twitter after Dhoni's response, users turn it into memes
news_article: Minutes after MS Dhoni said that today's match will "definitely not" be his last IPL match, #DefinitelyNot started trending on Twitter. Sharing a picture of Sanju Samson, Rajasthan Royals tweeted, "Will we give up without a fight? #DefinitelyNot." Meanwhile, a fan tweeted, "From 'Consider me as retired' to '#DefinitelyNot'...2020 has been full of surprises."

news_headline: Maybe they thought I am retiring: Dhoni on players taking jerseys from him
news_article: Reacting to players taking jerseys from him throughout the IPL 2020, CSK captain MS Dhoni said, "I had retired from international cricket. Maybe they thought I am retiring from the shortest format." Dhoni had gifted his jersey to several players including Jos Buttler, Hardik Pandya, Krunal Pandya, Kuldeep Yadav and Nitish Rana among others.

news_headline: Couldn't have been more plumb: Megan Schutt mocks Gayle for taking DRS
news_article: Australia Women cricketer Megan Schutt trolled KXIP batsman Chris Gayle for taking DRS after he was given LBW out on the bowling of CSK's Imran Tahir today. "Couldn’t have been more plumb...What a review," she wrote. Gayle got out for 12 runs off 19 deliveries in KXIP's defeat against CSK.

news_headline: KKR knock RR out of IPL 2020, jump to 4th position from 8th on points table
news_article: KKR defeated RR by 60 runs in Dubai on Sunday to jump from eighth position to fourth position on the IPL 2020 points table. With the defeat, RR crashed out of the IPL 2020 by finishing last on the points table. The remaining three playoff spots will be decided between KKR, RCB, DC and SRH.

news_headline: The short run has come back to bite us very hard: Rahul on KXIP's elimination
news_article: After KXIP failed to make it to IPL 2020 playoffs, captain KL Rahul said, "A lot could've been different." He added, "The short run [decision in the first match], looking back at it, it has come back to bite us very hard." During KXIP's match against DC, the umpire declared short run despite the batsman making it to the crease.

news_headline: IPL shares pic of Rohit and Pant, Yuvraj trolls them over their fitness
news_article: The IPL tweeted a picture of MI captain Rohit Sharma and DC wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant with the caption, "Still waiting for that six-hitting competition between Pant and Ro!" Trolling the duo over fitness, Yuvraj commented, "Or competition of fat percentage on their cheeks." Yuvraj further wrote, "It's like Ro is saying to Pant tere gaal jyada motey hain ya mere?"

news_headline: Dhoni ends IPL 2020 as his statistically worst IPL season ever
news_article: CSK captain MS Dhoni ended his IPL 2020 campaign as statistically his worst IPL season ever, scoring 200 runs. He slammed seven sixes in the tournament, his fewest in an IPL season. Further, this is the first time he failed to hit a fifty in an IPL season. His batting average of 25 is his lowest in an IPL season.

news_headline: Aleem Dar breaks record for standing in most number of ODIs as on-field umpire
news_article: Pakistan's 52-year-old umpire Aleem Dar has broken the record for standing in the most number of ODIs as on-field umpire, achieving the feat by standing in his 210th match between Pakistan and Zimbabwe today. Dar surpassed South African Rudi Koertzen's record of officiating in most ODIs. Dar also holds the record of umpiring in most Test matches.

news_headline: Cyclist shares pic of his legs after 4-hour race in Spain, says 'They seem to hurt'
news_article: Cyclist Jose Joaquin Rojas took to Instagram to share picture of his legs after a race in Spain. Rojas said he is "ready for stage 8 of the tour" and added that after 4 hours of pedalling non-stop at high speed "it seems like the legs are hurting". "Be careful with this exploding man," YouTuber David Cánovas Martínez commented.

news_headline: Cristiano Ronaldo scores twice on return from coronavirus in Juventus win
news_article: Cristiano Ronaldo scored three minutes after coming on as a substitute before converting a penalty to lead Juventus to a 4-1 Serie A victory against Spezia. The match was Ronaldo's first since recovering from coronavirus. Ronaldo shared pictures from the match on Instagram, writing, "Happy to be back and help the team with two goals! Well done team."

news_headline: Not thinking about opposition, want to keep momentum: Rohit on MI vs SRH
news_article: MI skipper Rohit Sharma has said that all the hard work paid off as his side qualified for the playoffs of the ongoing IPL season. "Now, one hurdle has been crossed, another small little tournament to play for us...we have one more game...we don't want to think about the opposition, we just want to...keep the momentum going," he added.

news_headline: Dear Shaw, try & not attempt impossible shots, keep Sehwag as your role model: Manjrekar
news_article: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has advised 20-year-old DC batsman Prithvi Shaw to not attempt "impossible shots simply because they are impossible to pull off". "Keep Sehwag as your role model, see how he only stuck to shots he had the ability/confidence to pull off," Manjrekar added. Shaw scored 219 runs in 11 matches this IPL season at an average of 19.90.

news_headline: Always been a Bangalore boy in the IPL: Virat ahead of match vs DC
news_article: Ahead of RCB's match against DC on Monday to seal a spot in the playoffs, their Delhi-born captain Virat Kohli clarified that he will always be a 'Bangalore boy' in the IPL. "(I have) never sort of drifted towards Delhi," Virat said. RCB have lost their last three matches and are now locked at 14 points with DC.

news_headline: Disappointed, we couldn't soak in the pressure: Rahul as KXIP knocked out of IPL
news_article: After KXIP were knocked out of the IPL following their defeat against CSK, skipper KL Rahul said his side couldn't "soak in the pressure" of the must-win match. "Disappointed...we didn't have results going our way in the first-half...[but] really proud that we gave ourselves an opportunity to come into the top four...hopefully [we'll] come back stronger next year," he added.

news_headline: Our batsmen didn't take responsibility: Smith after loss to KKR
news_article: RR captain Steve Smith blamed his batsmen for irresponsible batting after his side lost to KKR on Sunday, leading to their elimination from IPL 2020. "Losing four in the Powerplay, it was always going to be tough from there... Our batters, the top four or five didn't take responsibility perhaps," Smith said. Chasing 192, RR were restricted to 131/9.

news_headline: I’m getting out as soon as my blood is getting hot: Andre Russell
news_article: KKR all-rounder Andre Russell, who returned from an injury against RR on Sunday, attributed his poor run with the bat this season to his inability to convert starts. "As soon as I start to sweat and my blood's getting hot, I'm ready to go, you know, I get out," Russell said. Against RR, Russell smashed three sixes for 11-ball 25.

news_headline: Was aware of the net run rate but needed to win first: KKR's Morgan
news_article: After the 60-run win against RR on Sunday, KKR captain Eoin Morgan said his side was more focussed on winning rather than the net run rate since a loss would have ended their campaign this season. "Yes, I was aware of the numbers (about net run rate) but you need to first get yourself into a winning position," said Morgan.

news_headline: He told me to work on my off-side shots, it's showing now: Ishan on Dravid's advice
news_article: Talking about his performance in the IPL, MI batsman Ishan Kishan, who has scored 395 runs in 11 matches, said that he has been working on his off-side shots and it's showing in the tournament. "[Playing on off-side] wasn't my strength initially, and I knew, even Rahul Dravid sir told me that I need to work on [it]," he added.

news_headline: Kohli, De Villiers not delivering to standards they've set for themselves: Aakash
news_article: Talking about RCB's five-wicket defeat against SRH on Saturday, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said that the "game was all about Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers". "Kohli and AB are going to pay a huge price for their own success because they have set the yardstick very high and the two of them are not delivering to the standards," he stated.

news_headline: Harris, Pucovski break Waugh brothers' Sheffield Shield record with 486-run stand
news_article: Victoria batsmen Marcus Harris and Will Pucovski have broken Mark Waugh and Steve Waugh's 30-year-old record for the highest partnership in Sheffield Shield history with their 486-run stand against South Australia. The Waugh brothers had stitched a 464-run partnership for New South Wales against Western Australia in 1990. Pucovski finished the innings with his career-best 255*(386).

news_headline: Mercedes bag record 7th F1 constructors’ title as Hamilton wins at Imola
news_article: Mercedes secured their record-breaking seventh consecutive constructors' title on Sunday as Lewis Hamilton won the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix at Imola in Italy. Hamilton beat his Mercedes teammate Valtteri Bottas by 5.7 seconds. "What an incredible achievement for all of you. I am so proud of everybody and I am so grateful to be a part of it," Hamilton said.

news_headline: 1966 World Cup winner and Man Utd legend Bobby Charlton diagnosed with dementia
news_article: Ex-Manchester United midfielder Bobby Charlton, who lifted the 1966 World Cup with England, has been diagnosed with dementia. This comes days after the death of his former teammate Nobby Stiles. Charlton scored 249 goals for United and 49 goals for England. The 83-year-old has become the fifth player from the 1966 World Cup-winning team to have been diagnosed with dementia.

news_headline: 18 Trump rallies led to over 30k COVID-19 cases, likely over 700 deaths: Study
news_article: About 18 election rallies by US President Donald Trump between June 20 and September 22 are estimated to have led to over 30,000 coronavirus cases and likely led to around 700 deaths, a study by Stanford University researchers stated. The communities in which Trump rallies took place paid a high price in terms of disease and death, the researchers said.

news_headline: WHO chief in quarantine, says 'identified as contact of COVID-19 +ve person'
news_article: World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has tweeted, "I have been identified as a contact of someone who has tested positive for COVID-19." "I am well and without symptoms but will self-quarantine over the coming days...and work from home," he added. "This is how we will break chains of COVID-19 transmission," he further said.

news_headline: Obama shoots three pointer while on campaign trail for Biden; LeBron comments
news_article: Former US President Barack Obama shared a video showing him shooting a three-pointer while on the campaign trail for Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden. Obama made the shot just before leaving a gymnasium and said, "That's what I do!" Commenting on the video, basketball player LeBron James wrote, "That's what you do huh?? Ok ok I see. All cash!"

news_headline: Pak's move on Gilgit-Baltistan intends to camouflage its illegal occupation: India
news_article: India has rejected Pakistan's move of granting provisional-provincial status to Gilgit-Baltistan, adding that the attempt is "intended to camouflage its (Pakistan's) illegal occupation". Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Anurag Srivastava said "the area of so-called Gilgit-Baltistan" is an integral part of India and Pakistan has no locus standi on territories illegally occupied by it.

news_headline: Story of 'Forest Man of India' included in curriculum of US schools
news_article: The story of 'Forest Man of India', Jadav Payeng, has been included in curriculum of schools in Bristol in US' Connecticut. "The students are studying about...Payeng as a part of their ecology lesson," Navamee Sharma, a teacher at a school in Bristol, said. Payeng from Assam began planting trees in his village in 1979 and single-handedly raised a 550-hectare forest.

news_headline: At least 10 dead as 2020's strongest typhoon hits Philippines
news_article: At least 10 people died and three others were missing after Typhoon Goni, the world's strongest typhoon this year, hit the Philippines, a government report said. A lawmaker said that over 300 houses were buried under volcanic rocks and mudflows from Mayon Volcano in the Albay province in Bicol region. The dead and missing were all in Bicol, authorities said.

news_headline: Journo tweets about being racially targeted 3 times in an hour at US airport
news_article: A woman journalist tweeted about being racially targeted three times in an hour at a US airport, saying, "An older man...said to me 'Ni Hao. Ching Chong'. 'Ching Chong' is a racial slur." "Minutes later...a young man...asked me if I spoke English," Amara Walker wrote. "I'm still shaken and utterly confused as to the sequence of events today," she added.

news_headline: 6-year-old's 'ABC rap' about careers goes viral; Michelle Obama comments
news_article: A 6-year-old boy's 'ABC rap' about careers has gone viral on social media, with former US First Lady Michelle Obama sharing the kid's video. "This video put a smile on my face. I hope this gives us a moment to pause and think about our kids right now," she wrote. The 2.30-minute clip also features the child's father.

news_headline: China begins world's biggest census drive to count its population
news_article: China on Sunday began the world's biggest exercise of counting population, which it does once in 10 years. About 70 lakh census takers began door-to-door survey for the seventh census in the country to account for China's population. The census collects data including name, ID number, gender, marital status, education, and profession of Chinese citizens, state-run Xinhua news agency reported.

news_headline: 70-yr-old pulled out alive from debris of collapsed Turkey building after 33hrs
news_article: A 70-year-old man was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Turkey after being buried for 33 hours following an earthquake which struck Turkey's Aegean coast and Greek islands. The man was rescued from one of 20 residential buildings destroyed in Izmir's Bayrakli district. Over 60 people have lost their lives in the country because of the earthquake.

news_headline: Man held after dumping human head in recycle bin in Spain; video surfaces
news_article: A man was spotted dumping a human head in a recycling bin in Spain's Huelva and was arrested from a nearby flat, where the officers also discovered the body of the dead man. Police were alerted when the accused was seen carrying the head that was poking out of a bag, with some witnesses mistaking it as a Halloween joke.

news_headline: Biden's son spent ₹15L on 'live cam' porn site, ₹8L in strip club: Reports
news_article: US Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden reportedly spent $11,400 (over ₹8 lakh) in a single night at a strip club and $21,000 (over ₹15 lakh) on an adult 'live cam' porn website. "Hunter's spending on porn sites is staggering. At one point his credit card was rejected...because it was maxed out," a report quoted a source.

news_headline: Aus marks 1st day of no domestic COVID-19 transmission since June 9
news_article: Australia on Sunday marked the first day without a domestic transmission of coronavirus since June 9, Health Minister Greg Hunt said. "Thank you to all of our amazing health and public health workers and above all else the Australian people," he tweeted. Victoria state, Australia's coronavirus hotspot, saw zero new daily infections and no deaths for the second straight day.

news_headline: Trump didn't take pandemic seriously, focused on feeding his ego: Obama
news_article: Former US President Barack Obama said that President Donald Trump didn't take the pandemic seriously and accused Trump of focusing on "feeding his ego". Trump has treated "the presidency as anything more than a reality show to give him the attention that he craves", he added. "Unfortunately, the rest of us have to live with the consequences," he further said.

news_headline: Google, Apple, 44 others support challenge to block H-1B visa changes
news_article: Google, Apple and 44 other US firms and organisations filed an amicus brief supporting a lawsuit challenging upcoming rule changes to H-1B visa eligibility. The lawsuit was recently filed by the US Chamber of Commerce along with others, including 12 organisations and universities. The rules will "stifle the ability of American companies to hire and retain global talent", Twitter said.

news_headline: Canada sword attacker not associated with any terror group: Police
news_article: The man who carried out a sword attack in Canada's Quebec city that left two people dead and five others injured isn't associated with any terrorist group, Quebec Police Chief Robert Pigeon said. "Everything leads us to believe he chose his victims at random," he added. The incident began on Saturday night, on Halloween, and ended after a three-hour manhunt.

news_headline: China can't rely on old model for economic development: Xi Jinping
news_article: China's President Xi Jinping has said the country can no longer rely on its past economic development model of depending on global exports. He further said to ensure China's industrial and national security, they must build self-controlled and reliable domestic production. No disruption of industrial and supply chain at crucial moment is a key feature for economic power, Jinping added.

news_headline: Primary suspect in Charlie Hebdo attack trial tests COVID-19 +ve
news_article: The primary suspect in a trial over the attack on French satirical magazine Charlie Hebdo's office in 2015 has tested positive for coronavirus, his lawyers said. The trial of alleged accomplices to the attackers has been suspended until Wednesday. The resumption of the trial will depend on COVID-19 test results of other suspects, the presiding judge said.

news_headline: Will fight till Armenian forces leave disputed region: Azerbaijan
news_article: Azerbaijan President Ilham Aliyev said that he wanted to end the conflict in the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh and seven surrounding regions through negotiations as long as it ends with ethnic Armenian forces withdrawing from there. Otherwise, our troops will "go to the end", he added. "We will continue by any means to restore our territorial integrity," he added.

news_headline: US special forces rescue American kidnapped by armed men in Nigeria
news_article: US special forces have rescued an American citizen who had been kidnapped by armed men in an operation in Nigeria, US President Donald Trump tweeted. "Our Nation salutes the courageous soldiers...and celebrates the safe return of yet another American," he added. The US forces have suffered zero casualties during the operation but the kidnappers have "suffered gravely", Trump further said.

news_headline: Macau's gambling revenues fall 72.5% y-o-y in October
news_article: Gambling revenue in Macau plunged 72.5% in October year-on-year due to the impact of COVID-19-induced travel restrictions. The figure, released by Macau’s government on Sunday for October stood at around $914 million, was in line with analyst expectations of a 72%-74% drop. Gambling revenues have dropped since February, with the last six months posting an over 90% drop.

news_headline: French Police make new arrests over Nice church attack
news_article: French Police have arrested two more people in connection with a knife attack that left three people dead at a church in France's Nice. The police have arrested a total of six people in the case so far. The suspected attacker, a 21-year-old from Tunisia, is in a hospital in critical condition after being shot by police.

news_headline: China to begin work of Sichuan-Tibet Railway close to Arunachal
news_article: China is set to start construction of the Sichuan-Tibet Railway between Ya'an in Sichuan province and Linzhi in Tibet, close to the Indian border in Arunachal Pradesh, the state-run China News reported. This comes after China Railway announced on Saturday the bidding results for the power supply project, and construction of two tunnels and a bridge of the Ya'an-Linzhi section.

news_headline: Deaths from earthquake in Turkey, Greece rise to 60, over 900 injured
news_article: The death toll from Friday's earthquake in Turkey and Greece rose to 60, authorities said. Of these, 58 deaths were reported in Turkey, while the Turkish disaster management agency said that over 900 people were left injured in the country. A 70-year-old man was rescued from the rubble after midnight on Sunday around 34 hours after the earthquake struck.

news_headline: Protesters in Mexico burn Trump's effigy over US migration policies
news_article: Protesters in Mexico burned effigies of President Donald Trump and an American border guard on the US border in protest of Trump's migration policies. The protesters also urged Americans to vote against Trump in the upcoming US Presidential election. "[Democratic Nominee Joe] Biden has promised us a humanitarian migration reform, we'll be watching to ensure...promises are kept," an activist said.

news_headline: TN Agriculture Minister R Doraikkannu, who tested COVID-19 +ve, dies at 72
news_article: Tamil Nadu Agriculture Minister R Doraikkannu, who had tested positive for coronavirus, has passed away at the age of 72. Tamil Nadu Governor Banwarilal Purohit condoled the death of Doraikkannu. "He handled Ministry of Agriculture with full dedication and engraved his strong mark. His untimely demise is an irreparable loss to the people of Tamil Nadu," Purohit said.

news_headline: MP BJP candidate Imarti Devi barred from campaigning for one day
news_article: The Election Commission has barred Madhya Pradesh BJP candidate Imarti Devi from campaigning in the state for one day on November 1 for violating the Model Code of Conduct. The EC had on Tuesday issued a notice to Imarti Devi for allegedly describing a political rival as "insane" and making remarks against women members of his family.

news_headline: BJP worker found hanging from tree in WB; party alleges murder
news_article: The body of 34-year-old BJP worker, Bijoy Shil, was found hanging from a tree in Nadia district of West Bengal on Sunday. The party's West Bengal unit alleged that it was a murder, adding, "Same pattern in every murder by the goons...These political 'Murders' must stop." This is said to be third such incident within a month.

news_headline: Hate speeches by leaders not good for healthy democracy: Rajnath Singh
news_article: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said elections shouldn't be fought and won by spreading hatred among people. Singh added that there should be no place for "bitterness and acidic remarks" in a healthy democracy. He also expressed confidence that NDA will win the Bihar elections and asserted that the exit of LJP won't impact the poll prospects of the ruling alliance.

news_headline: Sedition case filed against Jharkhand BJP chief ahead of by-poll
news_article: A sedition case was registered against Jharkhand BJP chief Deepak Prakash on Saturday for allegedly trying to destabilise the state government, police said. Prakash had said in a press conference that BJP will form the government in the state in the next two-three months. "If the Hemant Soren government has guts, it must arrest me within 24 hours," Prakash said.

news_headline: Vote for the hand, vote for Cong: BJP's Scindia mistakenly appeals
news_article: In a slip of tongue, BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on Saturday asked the people at a rally in Madhya Pradesh to "press the button with the symbol of the hand and vote for Congress" before correcting himself. Scindia was campaigning for BJP's Imarti Devi in Dabra ahead of the by-polls to 28 Assembly seats in Madhya Pradesh on November 3.

news_headline: JD(U), Congress workers clash in Bihar, 6 people injured
news_article: Janata Dal (United) and Congress workers clashed at Narayanpur village amid the ongoing Assembly elections in Bihar's Gopalganj district late at night on Saturday. Six people sustained injuries, including one person whose condition is stated to be critical following the clashes. The district administration deployed additional security forces in the area to maintain law and order situation.

news_headline: Congress district president beaten up by 2 sisters over sexual harassment
news_article: Congress' Jalaun district president Anuj Mishra was beaten up by two sisters on Sunday for allegedly sexually harassing them. A video of the incident went viral on social media. "He was sexually harassing us for many days. We complained about him to UP Congress leader Ajay Kumar Lallu but no action was taken," the women said.

news_headline: Nitish may quit NDA, try to challenge PM Modi in 2024: Chirag Paswan
news_article: LJP chief Chirag Paswan on Sunday said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar was called "palturam" or turncoat due to his "frequent acts of paltimaar". Saying that Nitish had snapped ties with BJP and joined RJD earlier, Paswan added, "He may once again try to form next government with (RJD-led) Grand Alliance...try to project himself as alternative to PM Modi in 2024."

news_headline: Scindia offered me ₹50 cr, minister post for joining BJP: MP Cong leader
news_article: Former MP minister and Congress leader Umang Singhar on Saturday alleged he was offered ₹50 crore and a ministerial post by BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia to switch over to the saffron party. Scindia told him that he has "no future" in Congress party, Singhar claimed. "I told Scindia ji I don't believe in politics of opportunism," said Singhar.

news_headline: NDA ensured free grains for poor till Chhath Puja: PM at Bihar rally
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday while addressing a poll rally in Bihar said the NDA government has ensured free grains for the poor till Chhath Puja and the women shouldn't worry about celebrations. Whether the government of NDA is at Centre or in Bihar, the efforts have been as big as challenges faced by the government, PM Modi stated.

news_headline: Yes, I'm dog: Scindia claims Kamal Nath called him 'Kutta', Cong denies
news_article: BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on Saturday claimed that Congress leader Kamal Nath called him a "dog", which the Congress party has denied. Scindia said, "Yes, Kamal Nath, I am a dog because I am a servant of the people...because a dog protects its owner." He added, "If someone brings corrupt and ill-intended policies then this dog will bite that person."

news_headline: No dengue deaths reported in Delhi this year: Kejriwal
news_article: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has said there were no deaths due to dengue in the national capital this year. Under Delhi government's '10 Hafte, 10 Baje, 10 Minute' campaign, the Chief Minister and government officials engaged with the citizens through social media, asking them to check for conditions in their houses which would encourage mosquito breeding, and eliminate them.

news_headline: RJD wants 'jungle raj' to return: PM Modi at poll rally in Bihar
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday criticised RJD while addressing election rally in Bihar's Motihari and said, "If they come back, jungle raj will be back in the state." PM Modi said, "They think how can the lantern rule return, we think how can we light up your homes with LED bulbs. They only want the return of jungle raj."

news_headline: Gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's hotel demolished in UP
news_article: A hotel owned by gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's wife and sons in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur district was demolished on Sunday. Ghazipur Sub-Divisional Magistrate said the map of Hotel Ghazal, which was constructed on the first floor, was not approved. "Uttar Pradesh government is conspiring against my family members, including my brother Mukhtar Ansari," said Ghazipur MP Afzal Ansari.

news_headline: ₹1 crore cash seized from relative of BJP Dubbak by-poll candidate
news_article: An illegal money transfer racket was busted in Telangana on Sunday and ₹1 crore 'unaccounted' cash was seized from a relative of M Raghunandan Rao, BJP candidate for Dubbak by-poll. Acting on a tip, two people, including Rao's brother-in-law, were nabbed in Begumpet while they were transporting money, meant to be distributed to voters, Hyderabad Police Commissioner Anjani Kumar said.

news_headline: Sushant issue has not faded, CBI is investigating: Bihar CM Nitish
news_article: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has said that the death case of Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput has not faded away due to the state Assembly elections. He said, "The CBI is investigating the case. It is the CBI's duty, and everything is being done." He added, "CBI will probe the case, we are now busy in the elections."

news_headline: Delhi BJP asks Arvind Kejriwal to reduce COVID-19 testing price
news_article: The BJP's Delhi unit on Friday requested CM Arvind Kejriwal to reduce the prices of the RT-PCR test being charged by private hospitals and laboratories. "People of Delhi...are forced to pay almost four times more than the patients in NCR cities for COVID-19 testing," the party's spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor said. Presently, the charges are capped at ₹2,400.

news_headline: AAP rejects Punjab CM's appeal to meet President over farm laws
news_article: Aam Aadmi Party has rejected Punjab CM Amarinder Singh's appeal to all MLAs to accompany him to meet President Ram Nath Kovind to request him to give his assent to the state's amended farm laws, calling it "political drama". AAP's Harpal Singh Cheema said there was no point in meeting the President as the Governor had not signed the bills.

news_headline: Akhilesh asks EC to deploy forces, says BJP misusing power for votes
news_article: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has urged Election Commission to deploy security forces in sensitive places where by-polls will be held in Uttar Pradesh. He said, "BJP ministers are camping in these areas. Basic Education Minister is asking teachers to get votes polled for BJP. They have threatened village heads and police." He added, "BJP doesn't shy from any malpractice."

news_headline: Won't be surprised if Tejashwi becomes Bihar CM: Shiv Sena MP Raut
news_article: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday said that he won't be surprised if Tejashwi Yadav goes on to become the Chief Minister of Bihar after the assembly elections. Raut said, "A young man without any support, whose family members are in jail and CBI and IT Department is behind him, is challenging everyone in a state like Bihar."

news_headline: MCDs have looted Delhi, hand them over to AAP: Saurabh Bharadwaj
news_article: Citing alleged financial crisis in the BJP-run Municipal Corporation departments in Delhi, AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj said that the civic bodies have looted the Delhi people and they should be handed over to AAP. "The AAP will put MCDs in the surplus budget," Bharadwaj added. He also said that inhuman behaviour of BJP has maligned the image of the city.

news_headline: New farms laws will weaken nation's foundation: Rahul Gandhi
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has said the three new farm laws enacted by the Centre will "weaken" the foundation of the nation, and asked PM Narendra Modi to reconsider the laws. He added, "If there are less number of mandis, then increase it, and if there are flaws in the MSP, then rectify it, but don't destroy the entire system."

news_headline: Will continue fight against power bills, pollution: Delhi BJP chief
news_article: Delhi BJP president Adesh Gupta on Saturday said that the party will continue its struggle against problems faced by citizens of Delhi, like 'huge' power bills and pollution. "[BJP] workers served every poor and needy person of Delhi at the call of Prime Minister Narendra Modi without any discrimination and politics during the lockdown," he said.

news_headline: BJP to conduct registration drive for graduate voters in Pune
news_article: The BJP will conduct a registration drive for graduate voters in Pune on Sunday. "Our target is to register 25,000 voters...The BJP is going to put up registration centres near housing societies for voters' comfort," BJP secretary Rajesh Pande said. BJP reportedly claimed to have registered over 40,000 voters by using various virtual platforms amidst the COVID-19 pandemic in Pune.

news_headline: Big B recalls fighting real tiger, says 'You've no idea how strong a tiger is'
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan shared a picture from the shoot of his 1977 film 'Khoon Pasina' and wrote, "Never realised when Costume Department gave me this jacket...I'd have to fight a real tiger!!"  "You've no idea how strong a tiger is...An ordeal I shall never forget," he added. A scene in the film showed Bachchan fighting a tiger with his bare hands.

news_headline: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam tests positive for coronavirus
news_article: YouTuber Bhuvan Bam, who runs the popular YouTube channel 'BB Ki Vines', took to Instagram on Sunday to share the news that he has tested positive for coronavirus. "Beetey kuch dino se tabiyat kharab chal rahi hai (I have been feeling unwell for a while). Test results have come and I am COVID-19 positive," the 26-year-old YouTuber wrote on Instagram.

news_headline: KBC hijacked by communists: Agnihotri on question on burning 'Manusmriti'
news_article: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri shared a clip from Kaun Banega Crorepati season 12 wherein host Amitabh Bachchan asked a question related to BR Ambedkar burning Manusmriti. "KBC has been hijacked by [communists]. Innocent kids, learn this is how cultural wars are [won]. It's called coding," Agnihotri tweeted. Meanwhile, a journalist wrote that KBC and Bachchan are the new target for trolls.

news_headline: Kajal performs 'Jeelakarra Bellam' ritual at her wedding ceremony
news_article: Actress Kajal Aggarwal and businessman Gautam Kitchlu performed 'Jeelakarra Bellam' ritual at their wedding as tribute to their connections with South India. "It signifies the union of bride and groom," Kajal wrote on Instagram. "Jeelakarra (cumin) and bellam (jaggery) are made into thick paste and put on betel leaf. Bride and groom put it on each other's head," she added.

news_headline: McConaughey reveals where his 'Alright, Alright, Alright' dialogue came from
news_article: Matthew McConaughey has explained how he ad-libbed his famous 'Alright, alright, alright' line from 'Dazed and Confused' based on his character's motivations. "There wasn't a word written for that...scene...I said, 'I'm in my 1970 Chevelle...Wooderson's about getting high...He's about rock and roll'," McConaughey said. "I heard 'Action' and I looked up, 'Aright, alright, alright!'," he added.

news_headline: Not against women working: Mukesh on 'MeToo began as women started working' remark
news_article: Actor Mukesh Khanna, who was criticised for saying "MeToo problem began after women stepped out to work", has issued a clarification. "I'm not against women working...Let me show you my full interview...from which this 'controversial statement' has been taken to malign me," he wrote while sharing a video. "You can see...in this interview how I respect women," Mukesh added.

news_headline: 1st pic from Kajal Aggarwal & Gautam Kitchlu's reception surfaces
news_article: The first picture from actress Kajal Aggarwal and her husband, entrepreneur Gautam Kitchlu's wedding reception has surfaced online. While Kajal can be seen dressed in a golden outfit, Gautam is dressed in a black suit. The couple got married in a private ceremony in Mumbai on Friday. Earlier, Kajal took to Instagram to share pictures from their wedding ceremony.

news_headline: Shahid & I were not even friends who hung out: Amrita on link-up rumours
news_article: Amrita Rao, in an interview with Times of India, spoke about dealing with link-up rumours while working with Shahid Kapoor. "Shahid was always in a relationship when I was his co-star...[We] have only been very good colleagues, we were not even friends who hung out with each other," she said. "We've tremendous respect for each other as artists," added Amrita.

news_headline: Men never molested women at home according to him: Sona on Mukesh's remark
news_article: Singer Sona Mohapatra has criticised actor Mukesh Khanna's remark wherein he said that the "MeToo problem began when women stepped out to work". "Men never ever molested or assaulted women and children inside homes according to this fellow who is best ignored. Tacky [mandbuddhi]," she tweeted. "The sad truth is there are...more such regressive mindsets around us everywhere," Sona added.

news_headline: Actress Amrita Rao, RJ Anmol blessed with a baby boy
news_article: Actress Amrita Rao and her husband RJ Anmol have been blessed with a baby boy. The couple welcomed their first child on Sunday morning. "Both the mother and baby are healthy and doing well. The family is ecstatic and both Amrita and RJ Anmol thank everyone for their wishes and blessings," their spokesperson said in a statement.

news_headline: Can put Dhruv Rathee in jail for lying in video for which he got ₹60L: Kangana
news_article: After YouTuber Dhruv Rathee responded to a Twitter user's claim that a "major YouTuber" was paid money to make a video on Kangana Ranaut, the actress tweeted, "Of course this dimwit gets money...[for]...fake videos." "I can get him behind bars for lying about BMC notice for my house in his video for which he got paid ₹60 lakh," she added.

news_headline: I want my films to reach as many people as possible: Kiara Advani
news_article: Commenting on her film 'Laxmii' releasing on a digital platform instead of movie theatres due to the coronavirus pandemic, Kiara Advani said, "As an actor, I just want my films to reach as many people as possible." Stating that the film was made for a theatrical release, the actress said, "We'll miss the community watching aspect."

news_headline: A bliss to see him shining: Sonu on travelling to Dubai with Sanjay
news_article: Singer Sonu Nigam posted a picture on Instagram, in which he can be seen posing with Sanjay Dutt in a private jet, and wrote, "Off to Dubai once again.... a bliss to see him (Sanjay) shining." The actor, who recently announced his recovery from lung cancer, reportedly flew to Dubai to visit his wife and children.

news_headline: My primary job is to act and I love doing that: Saqib Saleem
news_article: Saqib Saleem, who has worked in films as well as digital platforms, said he does not differentiate between the mediums and added, "My primary job is to act...I love doing that...films and web aren't different for me." Saqib has starred in web series 'Crackdown' and 'Rangbaaz' and will be next seen in Ranveer Singh starrer '83'.

news_headline: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda invests in EV startup Watts and Volts
news_article: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda said he has invested in Watts and Volts, a Hyderabad-based electric vehicle (EV) startup. Deverakonda made the announcement at the launch of the Telangana government's new Electric Vehicle Policy on Friday. "We are working on electric cycles, bikes and scooties that will eliminate pollution," said Deverakonda, adding that the startup will begin operations in 2021.

news_headline: Shehnaaz Gill to return to Bigg Boss house for guest appearance
news_article: Bigg Boss season 14's latest promo has revealed that the reality show's former contestant Shehnaaz Gill will enter the Bigg Boss house in the upcoming episode as a guest. The promo video showed Shehnaaz interacting with host Salman Khan from inside the house. Posting the clip on Instagram, Shehnaaz wrote, "Did you guys miss me yet?"

news_headline: Soumitra Chatterjee's haemoglobin count drops, given blood transfusion
news_article: Actor Soumitra Chatterjee was given a blood transfusion on Sunday after his haemoglobin count dropped. "His bleeding... is not... controlled fully. His haemoglobin is fluctuating. We had to transfuse four units of blood... every passing day we may be losing ground," one of the attending doctors said. "His organ functions are holding on... oxygen part is satisfactory," the doctor added.

news_headline: Joey King to star in upcoming 'The Princess' movie
news_article: Hollywood actress Joey King, who featured in the 2018 film 'The Kissing Booth' and its sequel, will star in the upcoming film 'The Princess', Deadline reported. Reportedly, the film will be a combination of 'Rapunzel' and 'The Raid', and will release on a digital platform. According to reports, Joey is also in talks to join Brad Pitt in 'Bullet Train'.

news_headline: Suhana recreates Ariana's look from new album for Halloween, shares pic
news_article: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan recreated Ariana Grande's look from her new album 'Positions' for Halloween and posted the picture on Instagram stories. She paired a crop top with a skirt and also wore a black hairband to copy the Grammy-winner's hairstyle. "Being Ariana every Halloween. Manifestation," she wrote in the caption.

news_headline: Celebrating 125 years of togetherness: Ayushmann on wedding anniversary
news_article: On their 12th wedding anniversary, Ayushmann Khurrana shared a post for his wife Tahira Kashyap on Instagram and wrote, "Celebrating 125 years of togetherness...because I know that I know you from centuries and time immemorial." Alongside a picture of him and Tahira, he added, "You're my companion, lover, personal stand-up comedian, life coach and above all my best friend."

news_headline: Gigi shares 1st family pic with Zayn and their daughter
news_article: Gigi Hadid took to Instagram to share the first family photo with Zayn Malik and their daughter as the couple dressed up to celebrate Halloween 2020. The model covered her daughter's face with a Hulk GIF and captioned the picture, "My first Halloween". While Gigi dressed as a character from 'Metroid' video game, Zayn wore a Harry Potter inspired outfit.

news_headline: See you up there, Sean: De Niro on Sean Connery's death
news_article: Actors Robert De Niro and Kevin Costner, who shared screen space with Sean Connery in 'The Untouchables', mourned the Hollywood star's death. "He seemed much younger than 90; I expected and hoped he'd be with us much longer. See you up there, Sean," De Niro told Deadline. "He was the biggest star that I ever worked with," Costner tweeted.

news_headline: I am nervous about the idea of motherhood: Amrita Rao
news_article: Actress Amrita Rao, who entered the ninth month of her pregnancy in October, said the idea of motherhood makes her nervous. "I am nervous about the idea of motherhood, but...when you see your baby's face the mother in you effortlessly awakens," she told Times of India. "I'm looking forward to being a friend to this little wonder," she added.

news_headline: Sushant issue has not faded, CBI is investigating: Bihar CM Nitish
news_article: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has said that the death case of Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput has not faded away due to the state Assembly elections. He said, "The CBI is investigating the case. It is the CBI's duty, and everything is being done." He added, "CBI will probe the case, we are now busy in the elections."

news_headline: We want to see our fans in India and perform in person: BTS
news_article: In a recent interview, the members of K-pop boy band BTS thanked their fans in India and said that they wish to perform in the country. "Thank you for the love and support... we want to be there and see all the armies in India... we want to... say Namaste... and just give our voices in person," they told NDTV.

news_headline: BMW 2 Series Gran Coupé launched in India starting at ₹39.3 lakh
news_article: The first-ever BMW 2 Series Gran Coupé was launched in India with progressive design and exhilarating driving dynamics, the company said. The 2 Series GC has a coupé roofline and frameless doors alongside BMW TwinPower Turbo 4-cylinder engine exuding powerful 190 HP. BMW said the 2 Series GC is a combination of extroverted aesthetics and extravagant performance.

news_headline: Maharashtra invites Tesla, holds video call with its executives
news_article: Maharashtra has invited US electric-car maker Tesla, weeks after its Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk suggested entering India next year. In a tweet on Thursday, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said he and Industries Minister Subhash Desai held a video call with Tesla executives earlier in the day to invite them to the state.

news_headline: Musk cuts Tesla Model S price to $69,420 after rival prices its car cheaper
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk cut Tesla Model S price to $69,420 after rival Lucid Motors announced Lucid Air sedan will cost $77,400 minus $7,500 US tax credit (effective price to $69,900). Musk has cut Tesla Model S price twice in one week. The figures '69' and '420' in the $69,420 price tag are reportedly intentional by Musk as a joke.

news_headline: Foxconn aims to supply components for 10% of global EVs by 2027
news_article: Apple supplier Foxconn aims to provide components or services for 10% of the world's electric vehicles (EVs) by between 2025 and 2027. Foxconn Chairman Liu Young-way said the firm has been in talks with multiple car manufacturers for future cooperation. Foxconn is planning to launch its first solid-state battery for EVs in 2024, Liu said.

news_headline: NASA announces discovery of water on sunlit surface of Moon
news_article: NASA on Monday announced that its Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) has confirmed there's water on the sunlit surface of the Moon. This discovery indicates that water may be distributed across the lunar surface, and not limited to cold, shadowed places. SOFIA has detected water molecules (H2O) in Clavius Crater, one of the largest craters visible from Earth.

news_headline: Remdesivir becomes first drug to be fully approved for COVID-19 by US
news_article: The US Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved Gilead's antiviral drug remdesivir for treating patients hospitalised with COVID-19, making it the first and only drug approved for the disease in the US. Remdesivir was given to President Donald Trump this month when he was diagnosed with COVID-19. It was originally developed as a treatment for Ebola and Hepatitis C.

news_headline: Bharat Biotech's 'COVAXIN' gets approval for phase 3 trials in India
news_article: Covaxin, the coronavirus vaccine being developed by Bharat Biotech and ICMR, has received the approval by the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) to conduct the third phase of clinical trials. The study would cover 28,500 participants aged 18 years and above across 10 states. The Serum Institute of India began phase 3 clinical trial of Oxford vaccine last month.

news_headline: Engineers create white paint that reflects 95.5% of sunlight
news_article: Engineers from Purdue University developed a new white paint using calcium carbonate fillers which absorb almost no ultraviolet rays. It'd replace the need for air conditioning by absorbing nearly no solar energy and sending heat away from the building, researchers said. During testing, the acrylic remained 10°C below surrounding temperature at night and at least 1.7°C lower under direct sun.

news_headline: 5,000 insects released in Amsterdam to stop spread of Japanese knotweed
news_article: The Dutch government has released 5,000 Japanese leaf fleas in Amsterdam in an attempt to stop the spread of the invasive Japanese knotweed. Knotweed spreads rapidly and can cause damage to buildings, pipes and roads. Laboratory tests suggest the leaf fleas, known as Aphalara itadori, can kill young shoots and potentially stop the plant growing by sucking up its sap.

news_headline: Astronaut votes from ISS, NASA shares pic of voting booth
news_article: NASA astronaut Kate Rubins cast her vote in the US Presidential election from the International Space Station (ISS). A photo shared by NASA Astronauts on Twitter showed Rubins in front of a handwritten sign that read "ISS voting booth". Rubins, the first person to sequence DNA in space, had earlier said that "it's critical to participate in our democracy".

news_headline: OnePlus launches video titled 'Stop at Nothing' featuring Kalki Koechlin
news_article: OnePlus has released a new video titled 'Stop at Nothing' featuring actress Kalki Koechlin. The video, shot on the newly-launched OnePlus 8T 5G, aims to bring focus on the mental aspect of smartphone usage with digital consciousness and overall digital well-being. The OnePlus 8T enables users to use their device with no limitations– to create, connect, and collaborate, OnePlus said.

news_headline: Lawnmower robot in Germany messages owner as thief tries to steal it
news_article: A lawnmower robot in Germany sent a message to its owner that it had flipped upside down while a thief tried to steal it. The owner spotted a thief with the robot tucked under his arm when he went outside to the lawn to check on the device. Caught in the act, the thief dropped the lawnmower robot and escaped.

news_headline: Instagram temporarily removes 'Recent' tab from hashtag pages in US
news_article: Instagram has temporarily removed the 'Recent' tab from hashtag pages in the US ahead of the upcoming elections. "We are doing this to reduce the real-time spread of potentially harmful content that could pop up around the election," Instagram wrote. The 'Recent' tab is shown to users along with the 'Top' tab when they search by tags.

news_headline: Parliamentary panel questions Google, Paytm on China links: Reports
news_article: The joint parliamentary panel on the Personal Data Protection Bill asked Google and Paytm to explain their relationship with China, media reports said. The panel also provided the firms time to submit written responses on several issues including structure, data processing and protection, privacy and tax regimes. Google officials were also asked about the need for regulating the company.

news_headline: Google Meet starts rolling out custom backgrounds to web users
news_article: Google Meet has started rolling out the custom backgrounds feature to web users. The feature will allow users to use Google's "hand-picked images", which include abstract backgrounds, or upload their own image as backgrounds during meetings. As of now, the feature will work on ChromeOS and on the Chrome browser on Windows and Mac desktop devices.

news_headline: Nokia shares fall 18% after CEO's 'will invest whatever it takes on 5G' remark
news_article: Finnish telecom equipment maker Nokia's shares fell almost 18% after CEO Pekka Lundmark said Nokia will "invest whatever it takes to win in 5G". The company on Thursday cut its full-year profit and margin forecasts. "We expect to stabilise our financial performance in 2021 and deliver progressive improvement towards our long-term goal after that," Lundmark said.

news_headline: Indian Army develops messaging application 'SAI'
news_article: Indian Army has developed a messaging application, the 'Secure Application for Internet' (SAI), that supports end-to-end secure voice, text and video calling services for Android platform over the internet. SAI will be utilised pan Army to facilitate secure messaging within the service. The application has been vetted by CERT-In empanelled auditor and the Army Cyber Group.

news_headline: Policies used in India helped stop abuse before US polls: Zuckerberg
news_article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the policies that Facebook used during elections in countries like India and Indonesia have helped in stopping abuse ahead of US elections. Zuckerberg noted that the next week will be a test for Facebook in the US. He added Facebook is focused on issues like voter suppression and has worked with experts in the space.

news_headline: Amazon expects to incur $4 billion in COVID-19-related costs in Q4
news_article: Amazon is expecting to incur $4 billion in COVID-related costs in the fourth quarter. In its third-quarter earnings call, Amazon said it has recorded $7.5 billion in COVID-19-related costs this year. It also added that its operating income for the last three months of the year will be between $1 billion and $4.5 billion.

news_headline: Alibaba-owned Lazada suffers data hack of 1.1 million accounts
news_article: Personal information from 1.1 million RedMart user accounts was stolen from and sold online in a data breach. Alibaba-owned Singapore firm Lazada, which owns RedMart, said that personal information stolen included encrypted passwords and partial credit card numbers. "This RedMart-only information is more than 18 months out of date and not linked to any Lazada database," a Lazada spokesperson said.

news_headline: Telegram launches multiple pinned texts, live location 2.0 feature
news_article: Telegram has launched multiple features which include multiple pinned messages and an updated live location feature. The multiple pinned messages feature will let users pin multiple messages in any chat and even view them together on a separate page.
