The live location 2.0 feature will alert friends who share their locations when they are close to each other.

news_headline: US govt's order set to ban TikTok from November 12 gets blocked
news_article: A US judge has blocked the US government's order that would have banned TikTok from operating from November 12. Three TikTok users had earlier filed a lawsuit saying the ban would hurt their businesses. In her ruling, the judge said the creators would "lose the ability to engage with their millions of followers on TikTok, and the related brand sponsorships".

news_headline: Technical glitches improperly blocked Trump campaign ads: Facebook
news_article: Facebook said technical glitches had disrupted the delivery of some ads from US President Donald Trump and Presidential candidate Joe Biden's campaigns. Facebook spotted "unanticipated issues" affecting the campaigns, including technical flaws that caused a number of ads to be "paused improperly". "No ad was paused or rejected by a person, or because of any partisan consideration," Facebook said.

news_headline: Alphabet's Q3 revenue up by 14% y-o-y to $46.2 billion
news_article: Google-parent Alphabet has recorded a growth of 14% year-on-year in its third-quarter revenue from $40.5 billion recorded last year to $46.2 billion. The company's total advertising revenue stood at $37.1 billion, compared to $33.8 billion in 2019. Alphabet's both operating income and net income for the quarter stood at $11.2 billion.

news_headline: Amazon writes to SEBI, says Future Retail misleading public: Report
news_article: Amazon has complained to the SEBI that its local partner Future Retail misled public shareholders by saying it was complying with its contractual obligations to the e-commerce firm, a report said. Amazon had alleged that Future Group's $3.4-billion asset sale to Reliance Industries violated a 2019 contract. In a letter, Amazon urged the SEBI not to approve the deal.

news_headline: Facebook suspends political, new groups recommendations in US
news_article: Facebook has temporarily stopped recommendations for all political, social issue groups and any new groups to users ahead of the upcoming US presidential election. A Facebook spokesperson declined to say when the changes had been made or how long they would last. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg had revealed the change during his Senate hearing on Wednesday.

news_headline: Telangana launches Electric Vehicle and Energy Storage Policy
news_article: Telangana has launched its 'Electric Vehicle and Energy Storage Policy' which will be effective from 2020 to 2030. Under the policy, the government will offer a 100% exemption of road tax and registration fee for the first two lakh electric two-wheelers purchased and registered within Telangana. The exemption will be given to first 5,000 electric 4-wheeler private vehicles as well.

news_headline: France asks Twitter to suspend Ex-Malaysian PM Mahathir's account
news_article:
France's Secretary for Digital Sector Cédric O has asked Twitter to suspend former Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad's account following his tweets justifying a knife attack in Nice. "If not, Twitter would be an accomplice to a formal call for murder," he added. 
Mahathir on Thursday had tweeted that "Muslims have right to be angry & kill millions of French people".

news_headline: AB de Villiers releases his latest music video; features Kohli, Chahal
news_article: South African cricketer AB de Villiers has released his new song 'The Flame'. He came up with the music video in collaboration with singer-songwriter Karen Zoid and Ndlovu Youth Choir. The video features cricketers including De Villiers' RCB teammates Virat Kohli, Yuzvendra Chahal and Dale Steyn. De Villiers thanked cricketers who feature in the video for "leaving their comfort zones".

news_headline: I wouldn't have gone down that route: Shastri on Gavaskar's remark on Virat-Anushka
news_article: Reacting to Sunil Gavaskar's remark that Virat Kohli just practised on Anushka Sharma's bowling in lockdown, Ravi Shastri said he wouldn't have made such a comment. "I wouldn't have gone down that route," he added. Further, talking about Anushka saying she was being targeted, Shastri said, "If she felt hurt, she has every right to say what she wants to."

news_headline: My name has been turned into a Hindi word: Ben Stokes to Jofra Archer
news_article: During an interaction with his Rajasthan Royals teammate Jofra Archer, all-rounder Ben Stokes asked the fast bowler, "What is your favourite Hindi word? Not sure you can say that." In response, Archer said, "No. I can't. I can't...Jaldi. You can say Ben Stokes as well." Stokes replied, "My name has been turned into a Hindi word as well."

news_headline: What is the breakdown of Chris Gayle's 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket?
news_article: KXIP's Chris Gayle on Friday became the first-ever cricketer to smash 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket history. The 41-year-old has represented 26 teams in T20 cricket, playing a total of 410 matches. He has hit more than 100 sixes for three teams, RCB (263), Jamaica Tallawahs (124) and West Indies (105). Further, he has hit 84 sixes for KXIP.

news_headline: MI win an IPL match in Dubai for the first time, hand DC their 4th straight loss
news_article: Mumbai Indians defeated Delhi Capitals by nine wickets on Saturday to register their first win in IPL in Dubai in six matches. The defeat is Delhi Capitals' fourth straight loss in IPL 2020. With the victory, Mumbai Indians are also assured of a top-two finish on the IPL 2020 points table. Ishan Kishan top-scored for Mumbai Indians with 72*(47).

news_headline: Which bowler has dismissed Kohli the most number of times in IPL?
news_article: SRH pacer Sandeep Sharma dismissed RCB captain Virat Kohli for 7(7) today. This was the seventh time Sandeep dismissed Kohli in IPL, the most number of times a bowler has dismissed Kohli in the tournament. Sandeep overtook Ashish Nehra, who had dismissed Kohli six times. Dhawal Kulkarni, Mitchell McClenaghan and Mohammad Shami have dismissed Kohli four times each.

news_headline: Umpire doesn't declare head-high delivery as no-ball in RCB-SRH match, criticised
news_article: RCB fast bowler Isuru Udana bowled a head-high delivery against SRH's Kane Williamson, which umpire failed to declare as no-ball. Several cricketers criticised the decision with Jimmy Neesham tweeting, "No balls are head high now???" Meanwhile, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "I honestly can’t believe that was not given a no ball ! Like seriously!!!" "Wakey wakey," wrote Mitchell McClenaghan.

news_headline: Gayle fined 10% of his match fee for throwing away his bat after getting out on 99
news_article: KXIP batsman Chris Gayle has been fined 10% of his match fee for breaching IPL's Code of Conduct during his team's match against RR in Abu Dhabi. Gayle breached the code by throwing away his bat in frustration after getting out on 99. Gayle has admitted to the offence and has accepted the sanction, the IPL said in a statement.

news_headline: Archer's old tweets go viral after he dismisses Gayle for 99 runs
news_article: RR fast bowler Jofra Archer's old tweets have gone viral after he dismissed KXIP's Chris Gayle for 99 runs on Friday. "I know if I was bowling I know he wasn't getting da 100," Archer's seven-year-old tweet read. Another viral tweet read, "Cg don't hurt yourself boy." The second tweet referred to Gayle throwing away his bat in frustration.

news_headline: Gayle is T20 cricket's Bradman, the greatest there has ever been: Sehwag
news_article: After KXIP batsman Chris Gayle became the first-ever cricketer to hit 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket, former India opener Virender Sehwag tweeted, "He is T20 cricket's Bradman." Sehwag added, "Without a doubt, the greatest that there has ever been...Entertainment ka baap." Gayle smashed eight sixes against RR on Friday, scoring 99 runs off 63 deliveries.

news_headline: MI break record for playing the most number of T20 matches
news_article: Mumbai Indians have broken the record for playing the most number of T20 matches, with the IPL 2020 match against Delhi Capitals being their 222nd T20 match. They overtook English county side Somerset, who have played 221 matches. English county side Hampshire are third on the list, having played 217 T20 matches.

news_headline: SRH chase down 121-run target in 14.1 overs vs RCB, stay alive in IPL 2020
news_article: SRH chased down the target of 121 in 14.1 overs against RCB to stay in contention for a playoff spot in IPL 2020. The victory was SRH's second in a row, while RCB lost their third straight match. Only MI have booked a playoff spot so far, while CSK are the only team who are out of the playoff race.

news_headline: AI camera mistakes linesman's bald head for ball and follows it through match
news_article: During a football match in Scotland, an artificial intelligence (AI) camera continuously tracked a linesman's bald head mistaking it for the ball. A video of the gaffe has gone viral on social media. The commentator had to repeatedly apologise as the camera kept on mistaking the linesman’s head for the ball.

news_headline: Players feeling pressure, we thought we might qualify easily: DC's Kaif
news_article: After they suffered their fourth straight defeat in IPL, DC's Assistant Coach Mohammad Kaif has said that the players are feeling "a bit of pressure". "We didn't expect that it might come down to net run-rate, we thought we might qualify easily, now we've to fight it out," he added. DC had won seven of their nine initial matches.

news_headline: Lots of flaws to be pointed, but we got to believe in ourselves: Iyer
news_article: After DC lost to MI and suffered their fourth straight defeat in IPL 2020 on Saturday, skipper Shreyas Iyer said that there are "lots of flaws" to be pointed out but they have got to believe in themselves and stay positive. "We fell short of reading the wicket. We weren't upto the mark right from the start," Iyer added.

news_headline: We still need to do a bit: Smith as RR move to 5th in points table
news_article: RR on Friday chased down KXIP's 186-run target and moved to the fifth spot in the IPL 2020 points table. "Would have been nice to have a couple of wins in the middle. We still need to do a bit to make the playoffs...we need things to go our way," said RR skipper Steve Smith at the post-match conference.

news_headline: It was a horrible toss to lose: Rahul after defeat vs RR
news_article: After RR chased down KXIP's 186-run target, skipper KL Rahul said that it was "a horrible toss to lose". "It...[got]...very easy to bat later on. There was a lot of dew in the second half and that made it a bit tough for the bowlers to grip the ball," he stated. RR had won the toss and opted to field.

news_headline: All credit to the bowlers: David Warner after win against RCB
news_article: SRH captain David Warner praised his bowlers and gave them the credit for their five-wicket win against RCB on Saturday. "We are finding the right balance... To go for less than 20 in four overs, it's ridiculous," said Warner. This was the third successive occasion that SRH has restricted a team to a total below 135 runs in IPL 2020.

news_headline: I won't be too sure: Sangakkara on DC qualifying for playoffs
news_article: With DC at third position in the IPL points table ahead of their match against table-toppers MI on Saturday, ex-Sri Lanka skipper Kumar Sangakkara said that he's "worried" about the team's chances to qualify for playoffs. "In the last few games, their batting hasn't really looked as strong as it should've," he added. DC have lost their last three matches.

news_headline: Our batsmen weren't brave enough: Virat Kohli after losing to SRH
news_article: After the five-wicket loss against SRH, captain Virat Kohli said RCB weren't brave with the bat to put up enough runs to defend. "It (a target of 121) was never enough... I thought we weren't brave enough with the bat throughout the innings," Kohli said. "The situation is straightforward: win the last game and finish in top two," Kohli added.

news_headline: World no. 2 Simona Halep tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: World number two women's singles player Simona Halep on Saturday announced that she has tested positive for coronavirus. "I wanted to let you know that I tested positive for COVID-19. I am self-isolating at home and am recovering well from mild symptoms," she tweeted. The 29-year-old won the Wimbledon in 2019 and the French Open in 2018.

news_headline: Cristiano Ronaldo recovers from coronavirus after 19 days
news_article: Juventus forward Cristiano Ronaldo has tested negative for coronavirus after nearly three weeks, the club has announced. Ronaldo first tested positive on October 13 and had since been in quarantine at his home in Turin. He missed Juventus' draws with Crotone and Hellas Verona in Serie A and a loss to Barcelona in the Champions League group stage.

news_headline: This isn't supposed to be our year, but it's working for us so far: Pollard
news_article: After MI defeated DC and registered their ninth win in IPL 2020 on Saturday, MI stand-in skipper Kieron Pollard said, "This [2020] isn't supposed to be our year, but it's been working for us so far." MI are the only team who have qualified for the playoffs so far and are currently at the top of the IPL points table.

news_headline: BCCI's medical team to assess Rohit Sharma's fitness on Sunday
news_article: BCCI's medical team will reportedly assess India opener Rohit Sharma's fitness on Sunday and take a call whether he's fit enough to be part of the Australia series. This has come after reports claimed that Rohit has been training regularly with MI while nursing a hamstring injury, which he sustained against KXIP on October 18.

news_headline: May Allah disfigure Macron's face: Ex-UFC lightweight champ Khabib
news_article: Ex-UFC lightweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov, a practising Muslim, criticised French President Emmanuel Macron for his remarks on Islam. "May the Almighty disfigure the face of this creature," wrote Khabib, posting an image of a boot print over Macron's face. Reacting to the beheading of a French teacher for showing cartoons of Prophet Muhammad, Macron had said, "Islam is in crisis."

news_headline: 1,500 nurses die due to COVID-19, same as nurse death toll during WWI: ICN
news_article: At least 1,500 nurses have died from coronavirus, the same as the number of nurses who died during World War I, the International Council of Nurses said. The figure includes nurses from 44 countries and is known to be an underestimate of true death toll, ICN said. Its own analysis suggests about 10% of cases globally are among healthcare workers.

news_headline: US records world's biggest single-day COVID-19 spike as 1L test +ve
news_article: United States on Friday recorded 1,00,233 coronavirus cases, marking the biggest one-day jump recorded by any country since the beginning of the pandemic, according to a Reuters tally. US' daily rise exceeded the 97,894 cases reported by India on a single day in September. The US is the worst-hit country in the world with over 90 lakh COVID-19 cases.

news_headline: Indians account for one-fourth of total PR granted by Canada in 2019, set record
news_article: Indian immigrants accounted for one-fourth of the total permanent residencies (PR) granted by Canada in 2019, setting a new record, according to Canada's annual report submitted in their parliament. Of the 3,41,180 permanent residents admitted last year, 85,593 were Indians. India was followed by China at 30,246, the Philippines at 27,818, Nigeria at 12,602 and Pakistan at 10,793.

news_headline: Orthodox priest shot at church in France, gunman on the run: Reports
news_article: A Greek Orthodox priest is seriously injured after he was shot at a church in the French city of Lyon by an attacker who then escaped, reports said. The priest was fired on twice as he was closing the church, reports added. This comes days after a man beheaded a woman and killed two others in a church in Nice.

news_headline: Madame Tussauds in Berlin puts Trump's wax statue in dustbin
news_article: Berlin's Madame Tussauds put its wax statue of US President Donald Trump into a dustbin, with the words "Dump Trump Make America Great Again" written on the front of it. It was surrounded by garbage bags and images of Trump's tweets, including "I love Berlin". The move is rather of a symbolic character ahead of US elections, the museum said.

news_headline: Man escapes death twice as he avoids colliding cars & falling street lamp
news_article: A pedestrian in Russia narrowly escaped death twice in an accident that involved two cars and a falling street lamp. The incident took place in the Russian city of Biysk. In a video of the incident that surfaced on social media, the man could be seen attempting to run as the two cars collided at an intersection.

news_headline: Tennis ball-sized hailstones hit Australia; residents share pics
news_article: Australia's Queensland was hit by tennis ball-sized hailstones as storms lashed parts of Australia's east coast. Northern New South Wales has been warned to expect large hail, flash flooding and severe winds. "Some of these storms are fast-moving...so people should consider whether they need to be outside or on the road at the moment," the Bureau of Meteorology warned.

news_headline: My remarks on France attacks taken out of context: Malaysia's ex-PM Mahathir
news_article: Former Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad said his comments on attacks in France had been taken out of context. "I'm indeed disgusted with attempts to misrepresent and take out of context what I wrote on my blog," Mahathir said. "Muslims have a right to be angry and kill millions of French people for the massacres of the past," Mahathir had tweeted.

news_headline: Woman beggar who owns 5 buildings, has ₹1.4 cr in bank arrested in Egypt
news_article: A 57-year-old woman beggar, who owns five residential buildings and has 3 million Egyptian pounds (over ₹1.4 crore) in her bank account, has been arrested by Egyptian police. The woman has been identified as Nafisa. The woman claimed she couldn't walk due to paralysis, and begged for money in a wheelchair, however, she was found walking on foot by eyewitnesses.

news_headline: Husband of Africa's richest woman Isabel dos Santos dies in diving accident
news_article: Sindika Dokolo, the husband of Africa's richest woman Isabel dos Santos, has died in a diving accident off the coast of Dubai. Sindika Dokolo, 48, married Isabel dos Santos in 2002 after they met as students at King's College in London. Cedric Mala, a friend, told The Times, "The last outing was fatal. Doctors tried to resuscitate him without success."

news_headline: Turkish woman buried alive under rubble after earthquake rescued after 17 hrs
news_article: Turkey's disaster and emergency management agency shared a video of a woman who was rescued after being buried alive under rubble for 17 hours following the earthquake in Turkey on Friday. Rescue workers have pulled out at least 100 people so far. The earthquake has killed 26 people in Turkey and two on the Greek island of Samos, officials said.

news_headline: Slovakia begins testing all residents aged 10 & above for COVID-19
news_article: Slovakia on Saturday began testing all its residents aged 10 and above, approximately 40 lakh people, for coronavirus. Those who test positive will have to undergo a 10-day quarantine. Around 20,000 medical staff plus soldiers have been deployed at 5,000 sites to administer the antigen swab tests. Prime Minister Igor Matovic said he hopes it will avert a strict lockdown.

news_headline: Int'l experts hold 1st meeting with China on COVID-19 origin: WHO
news_article: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that international experts held their first virtual meeting with Chinese counterparts on Friday to probe the animal origins of novel coronavirus. The UN will continue to establish origins of the virus "to prevent future outbreaks", he added. In July, the WHO had sent a team to China to lay the groundwork for the probe.

news_headline: May Allah disfigure Macron's face: Ex-UFC lightweight champ Khabib
news_article: Ex-UFC lightweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov, a practising Muslim, criticised French President Emmanuel Macron for his remarks on Islam. "May the Almighty disfigure the face of this creature," wrote Khabib, posting an image of a boot print over Macron's face. Reacting to the beheading of a French teacher for showing cartoons of Prophet Muhammad, Macron had said, "Islam is in crisis."

news_headline: Technical glitches improperly blocked Trump campaign ads: Facebook
news_article: Facebook said technical glitches had disrupted the delivery of some ads from US President Donald Trump and Presidential candidate Joe Biden's campaigns. Facebook spotted "unanticipated issues" affecting the campaigns, including technical flaws that caused a number of ads to be "paused improperly". "No ad was paused or rejected by a person, or because of any partisan consideration," Facebook said.

news_headline: US says Iranian hackers successfully accessed voter information
news_article: The US has said Iranian hackers behind threatening emails sent to many Americans earlier had successfully accessed voter data. The FBI and CISA partially confirmed the authenticity of a video sent to people as part of a disinformation campaign. The video, which was sent in a pro-Trump far-right group's name, purported to show hackers breaking into a voter registration system.

news_headline: Stand by my statement: Pak MP on IAF pilot Abhinandan's release
news_article: Pakistan MP Ayaz Sadiq on Saturday said that he stands by his statement in which he recounted why Pakistan released IAF pilot Abhinandan Varthaman. Sadiq had claimed, "Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi said for God's sake let Abhinandan go, India's about to attack Pakistan at 9 pm." Earlier, Information Minister Shibli Faraz said, "Remarks by Ayaz Sadiq are beyond apology."

news_headline: Understand shock but violence not justified: Macron on Prophet Mohammed cartoons
news_article: French President Emmanuel Macron has said he can understand people could be shocked by Prophet Mohammed's caricatures, but he'll "never accept that violence can be justified". This comes after three people were killed at a church in Nice in an attack that Macron termed as "Islamist terror". Earlier, a teacher was beheaded after showing Prophet Mohammed's cartoons in a class.

news_headline: Russia to help Armenia if clashes with Azerbaijan reach its territory
news_article: Russia has said that it will provide necessary assistance to Armenia in its conflict with Azerbaijan over Nagorno-Karabakh "if clashes take place directly on the territory of Armenia". This comes after Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan formally asked Russian President Vladimir Putin to begin "urgent" consultations to provide security. On Friday, Armenia and Azerbaijan agreed not to target civilians.

news_headline: Will announce new government on Nov 2: New Zealand PM
news_article: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern will be announcing her new government on Monday after signing a "cooperation agreement" with the Green party, one of Ardern government's coalition partners. Under the agreement, two ministers from the Green party will hold ministerial portfolios. Notably, Ardern doesn't need a coalition as she won the general election in October with a majority.

news_headline: Be vigilant: France to its citizens around the world after attacks
news_article: French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian on Friday asked French citizens around the world to be vigilant as "there are threats everywhere". He added that the government has instructed its embassies around the world to tighten security in the wake of recent attacks in Nice and Paris. Meanwhile, French President Emmanuel Macron held a crisis meeting with top ministers.

news_headline: Linking religion to terrorism a mistake: Widodo on Macron's remarks
news_article: Indonesian President Joko Widodo on Saturday condemned the knife attack in France's Nice, however, he said that remarks by President Emmanuel Macron had "insulted Islam" and "hurt the unity of Muslims everywhere". "Linking religion to acts of terrorism is a massive mistake," he added. Macron had termed the knife attack in which a woman was beheaded as "Islamist terrorist attack".

news_headline: Mexico picks first woman to coordinate fight against drug cartels
news_article: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador has chosen a woman to lead the security ministry for the first time, making her in charge of coordinating the fight against drug cartels and other criminals. Rosa Icela Rodriguez currently oversees Mexico's ports. Her nomination comes days after former Mexican Defence Minister General Salvador Cienfuegos' arrest in the US on drug trafficking charges.

news_headline: UNSC defeats Russian resolution promoting women at peace tables
news_article: The UN Security Council has defeated a Russian resolution to commemorate the 20th anniversary of a UN measure demanding equal participation for women in activities promoting global peace. What is needed is "action" and "not more words", Germany's UN Ambassador Christoph Heusgen said. Earlier, the head of UN Women said women still remain "systematically excluded" from talks to end conflicts.

news_headline: EC revokes Kamal Nath's star campaigner status over multiple violations
news_article: The Election Commission on Friday revoked Congress leader Kamal Nath's star campaigner status over multiple Model Code of Conduct violations ahead of bypolls in the Madhya Pradesh. He had referred to CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan as "mafia" and "milawat khor". Earlier, the leader was issued a notice by EC for referring to BJP leader Imarti Devi as 'item'.

news_headline: BJP's free COVID-19 vaccine promise in Bihar not a poll code violation: EC
news_article: The Election Commission of India has said that the free COVID-19 vaccine promise made by BJP in the run-up to the Bihar Assembly elections is not a violation of the Model Code of Conduct. The EC was responding to activist Saket Gokhale, who alleged that the promise was discriminatory and misleading as India's vaccine policy hasn't been announced yet.

news_headline: Pappu Yadav falls after stage collapses during rally in Bihar; video surfaces
news_article: Jan Adhikar Party leader Pappu Yadav fell down after the stage collapsed during his rally in Bihar's Muzaffarpur ahead of the voting in Phase 2 of the state Assembly elections. A video of the incident has also surfaced on social media, wherein his supporters could be seen helping him get up. Some people could be seen recording the incident.

news_headline: He gave his wife CM post: Bihar CM mocks Lalu over women's welfare
news_article: In a veiled jibe at RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday said, "When he was sent to jail, he installed his wife (Rabri Devi) on the chair, but did nothing for the welfare of women otherwise." Kumar added that the people of Bihar should not be "misled" by those who "ignored" women during their rule.

news_headline: Star campaigner is not a post: Kamal Nath after EC removes status
news_article: After the Election Commission revoked his star campaigner status over multiple Model Code of Conduct violations, Congress leader Kamal Nath responded, "Star campaigner is neither a post nor a status. I do not want to comment on the EC's decision, will comment only after November 10." Nath added, "In the end, public matters the most and they know everything."

news_headline: Those who talk about taking China’s help should be arrested: Raut
news_article: Addressing the media on Saturday, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut stated, "Be it Farooq Abdullah or Mehbooba Mufti, if someone talks about taking China's help to challenge India's constitution, then they should be arrested and sent to Andaman for 10 years." Raut further asked, "How are they roaming free?"

news_headline: Surprised at Nath's behaviour, he refuses to apologise: Scindia
news_article: After the Election Commission revoked Congress leader Kamal Nath's star campaigner status over multiple Model Code of Conduct violations, BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "I'm surprised at Kamal Nath's behaviour." Scindia added, "Despite EC's action and the former Congress President asking him to apologise for his comments, he refuses to apologise."

news_headline: Shiv Sena nominates Urmila for Maharashtra Legislative Council seat
news_article: Shiv Sena has picked Bollywood actor Urmila Matondkar for nomination to Maharashtra Legislative Council through Governor's quota. Sena spokesperson Sanjay Raut has confirmed the same, saying that Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has spoken to Matondkar and she agreed to be nominated by the party. The MVA government is to send 12 names for nomination to state legislature's Upper House.

news_headline: Is Cong to apologise for expecting soldiers' safety?: Tharoor on Pulwama
news_article: Referring to Prakash Javadekar's demand for apology from Congress after a Pakistani minister said Pulwama terror attack was an achievement under PM Imran Khan, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said, "I'm trying to figure out what [Congress] is supposed to apologise for. For expecting government to keep our soldiers safe? For rallying around the flag rather than politicising a national tragedy?"

news_headline: Cong must apologise: Javadekar after Pak Minister's Pulwama remark
news_article: After Pakistan's Federal Minister said that Pulwama terror attack was an achievement under PM Imran Khan, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said, "Congress and others who talked of conspiracy theories must apologise to the country." Earlier, on the anniversary of the Pulwama attack in February, Rahul Gandhi had asked, "Who benefitted the most from the attack?"

news_headline: Election Commission is a branch of BJP: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut
news_article: After the Election Commission stated that BJP's promise of free coronavirus vaccination in its Bihar poll manifesto does not violate the model code of conduct, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said, "Election Commission of India is a branch of BJP." Raut added, "So you cannot expect anything else from them."

news_headline: Bengal teen beaten to death by police as parents support us, claims BJP
news_article: After a 15-year-old boy died while in police custody in Bengal's Birbhum, BJP alleged that he was beaten to death as his parents were supporters of the saffron party. SP Shyam Singh said that the teenager "went to the toilet and killed himself" on Thursday night. BJP called for a 12-hour bandh on Saturday in Mallarpur over the death.

news_headline: Mohan Bhagwat, Bhaiyyaji Joshi to attend RSS meet in Hyderabad
news_article: RSS Sarsanghchalak Mohan Bhagwat and Sarkaryavah Bhaiyyaji Joshi are attending the RSS Dakshina Madhya Kshetra meeting being held in Hyderabad on October 30 and 31. Some of the Akhil Bharatiya office bearers, residing in the area, and executive council members from Karnataka, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh will also be present in the meeting.

news_headline: Cong will return to power in MP after Assembly by-polls: Kamal Nath
news_article: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath said that Congress will return to power in the state after the upcoming Assembly by-polls. "People are aware that BJP, which came to power by trading people's mandate, has not been able to change anything in the last seven months," Nath said. MP will go to by-polls on November 3 in 28 Assembly constituencies.

news_headline: BJP's plan of expanding in eastern India will end in Bihar: Pilot
news_article: Senior Congress leader Sachin Pilot has said that BJP's plan of forming governments in Eastern Indian states will be ended with the Assembly election in Bihar. "We (Grand Alliance) will post a historic victory in Bihar Assembly elections and it is going to have its impact on the country's polity," Pilot said.

news_headline: Youth should not shy away from joining politics: Manish Sisodia
news_article: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, while addressing students of Ashoka University in Haryana, said, "If you want to be a part of the change, we should not shy away from joining politics. The youth...can impact policies and get involved in governance." He added that students should understand that for a successful policy, the 'public bind' is essential.

news_headline: I was really, really suicidal; the pain was so consistent: Justin Bieber
news_article: Singer Justin Bieber has revealed that he had suicidal thoughts in the past in the new documentary 'Justin Bieber: Next Chapter'. "[I was] like...is this pain ever going to go away? It was so consistent, the pain was so consistent," he stated. Bieber further said his faith in God gave him the "overwhelming confidence" to recover from the situation.

news_headline: I wouldn't have gone down that route: Shastri on Gavaskar's remark on Virat-Anushka
news_article: Reacting to Sunil Gavaskar's remark that Virat Kohli just practised on Anushka Sharma's bowling in lockdown, Ravi Shastri said he wouldn't have made such a comment. "I wouldn't have gone down that route," he added. Further, talking about Anushka saying she was being targeted, Shastri said, "If she felt hurt, she has every right to say what she wants to."

news_headline: Big B explains connection between Sean Connery's date of death & '007'
news_article: Amitabh Bachchan, mourning the demise of Sean Connery, the first actor to play 'James Bond', gave an explanation behind the connection between Connery's date of death and '007', the fictional spy's code number. "What's the date today...31.10.20...Add up.. 3 +1 is 4, then [add] 1...then 0...then 2, so 4+1+2 =7...then 0...So 3+1+1+2 = 7 and two zeros...So 007!!" Bachchan wrote.

news_headline: Twitter user claims YouTuber given ₹65L for Sushant video, Dhruv Rathee replies
news_article: YouTuber Dhruv Rathee responded to a claim that a "major YouTuber" has "been paid ₹65 lakh" to make a video "exposing role of Sushant Singh Rajput's family in his death". "Is this...fake news referring to me?...I'm not planning to make...[such] video," he tweeted. "I...wish my sponsoring fees was ₹30 lakh per video, how rich would I be," Dhruv added.

news_headline: Shweta has taken my son Reyansh to an undisclosed location: Estranged husband
news_article: TV actress Shweta Tiwari's estranged husband Abhinav Kohli has claimed his son Reyansh has been missing since Sunday. "I don't know where he is. He was with me for 40 days. Shweta has taken him to an undisclosed location," he added. He further said, "I personally went to her house also, but she is not meeting or taking my calls."

news_headline: I get messages asking me to sleep with or marry someone: Aditi Sanwal on casting couch
news_article: Talking about casting couch, 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay 2' actress Aditi Sanwal said that she often receives vulgar messages from people claiming to be casting agents. "Sometimes I receive messages asking me to sleep with or marry someone," she added. Aditi further said, "I don’t even think such people are genuine, so I just block them."

news_headline: Sir Sean Connery, Oscar winner and 1st actor to play James Bond, dies at 90
news_article: Sir Sean Connery, the first actor to portray James Bond, has passed away aged 90. He had also won the Oscar in the Best Supporting Actor category for his role in 1987 film 'The Untouchables'. Some of his popular films include 'Marnie', 'Murder on the Orient Express', 'The Man Who Would Be King' and 'Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade'.

news_headline: The failure of 'Mohenjo Daro' was heartbreaking: Pooja Hegde
news_article: Pooja Hegde, who made her Bollywood debut with Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Mohenjo Daro', said in an interview that its failure was heartbreaking. "I held off signing Hindi films because I needed a sturdy second movie," she added. "I built on...success of 'Housefull 4'...and here I am," said Pooja who'll be next seen in films like 'Cirkus' and 'Radhe Shyam'.

news_headline: I took wrong decisions in my career: ‘Jab We Met’ actor Tarun Arora
news_article: Actor Tarun Raj Arora, who took a break from Hindi films after featuring in 'Jab We Met', has said that he made some wrong decisions in his acting career. "I had taken some wrong decisions...like Ghutan for Ramsay Brothers, and Hawas (2004). Those films didn't get a proper release...after Jab We Met, everything got...underground," he said.

news_headline: There will never be a better Bond than you: Abhishek after Sean's death
news_article: Following the demise of Sir Sean Connery, who was the first actor to portray James Bond on screen, Abhishek Bachchan tweeted, "We've lost another legend today." "After watching 'Highlander', I hoped he'd remain immortal. He'll live on through his immense work. #RIP Sean Connery. There will never be a better Bond than you," he wrote with a folded hands emoji.

news_headline: He defined an era and a style: Craig on Connery's death
news_article: Following the demise of Sir Sean Connery, Daniel Craig, who will play James Bond in his upcoming film 'No Time To Die', said, "He (Connery) defined an era and a style." Remembering Connery, who was the first actor to play Bond on screen, Craig added, "He will continue to influence actors and filmmakers alike for years to come."

news_headline: I married my confidante, companion, best friend, soulmate: Kajal
news_article: Actor Kajal Aggarwal, who got married to entrepreneur Gautam Kitchlu on October 30, took to Instagram to share photos from her wedding and wrote, "I married my confidante, companion, best friend and soulmate." Commenting on getting married during the COVID-19 pandemic she wrote, "We... followed covid protocols... we had to have a very small wedding, got all our guests tested."

news_headline: It's not an easy thing to deal with: Kumar Sanu on battling COVID-19
news_article: Kumar Sanu, who has recovered from coronavirus, has said it's not an easy thing to deal with. "I was anxious and scared...initially," he said, adding that the first few days were difficult because he was staying away from his family. "I was worried given how [it] has taken...lives and the kind of damage it has done to others," Sanu said.

news_headline: I may not have been number 1 actor in B'wood but I've no regrets: Parmeet
news_article: Parmeet Sethi, who has starred in films like 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' and 'Dil Dhadakne Do', has said, "I may not have been the number one actor, but I definitely have had the privilege of...doing different things on camera." "That's something which is hallmark of my career and I've no regrets," added Parmeet, who also directed 2010 film 'Badmaash Company'.

news_headline: You will always remain my baby brother: Abhishek on Sikandar's b'day
news_article: Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram on Saturday to wish Sikandar Kher on his 40th birthday. Sharing a throwback picture, Abhishek wrote, "I can't believe you've turned 40!!" He added, "You will always remain my baby brother. The bond we share is a gift that I cherish immensely. You're mad, crazy, irritating, disgusting, messy and I love you for all that."

news_headline: After pandemic I have lost a bit of my swag: Sudhir Mishra
news_article: Commenting on the coronavirus lockdown, filmmaker Sudhir Mishra said, "I see myself as much more frail after the pandemic...I've lost a bit of my swag." Speaking about his father, who passed away in April, Sudhir said, "When I saw myself terrified, holding my father in my arms... running towards an ICU, and...watching him die, that has done something."

news_headline: I feel I've been welcomed with open arms in the industry: Pulkit
news_article: On being asked if he had to struggle to find a place in Bollywood, Pulkit Samrat said, "I got my first break on television from Ekta Kapoor. Then it was Kumar Mangat...who gave me...break in Bittoo Boss and then Fukrey happened." He added, "I feel I've been welcomed with open arms in the industry and [I'm] grateful for the same."

news_headline: Saif, Arjun, Jacqueline, Yami head to Dalhousie to shoot 'Bhoot Police'
news_article: Actors Saif Ali Khan, Arjun Kapoor, Jacqueline Fernandez and Yami Gautam have left for Himachal Pradesh's Dalhousie to shoot the first schedule of their upcoming horror comedy film 'Bhoot Police'. They were spotted at Mumbai airport and took a private charter to head to the location. According to reports, the shooting will begin in November.

news_headline: Tiger, Tara's Heropanti 2 to be shot across 10 countries: Reports
news_article: Tiger Shroff and Tara Sutaria-starrer 'Heropanti 2' will be shot across the globe in over 10 countries, as per reports. The makers have zeroed in on London, New York, Moscow, Tokyo and Manila, and more cities will be added after the shooting begins, reports stated. The film will be directed by Ahmed Khan and produced by Sajid Nadiadwala.

news_headline: I was dropped out of films after 'Thugs...' flopped: Fatima
news_article: Fatima Sana Shaikh has said she was dropped out of films after her film, 'Thugs of Hindostan', flopped. "Thought my career was over," Fatima said, adding, "I was getting offers but...not the kind...I wanted to do...so I held back. I decided that because it's been tough to be part of this industry and I wanted to be in...position to choose."

news_headline: Anupam, Paresh, and Amitabh play varied roles, I get jealous: Farida
news_article: Veteran actress Farida Jalal has said that she feels jealous when other actors get to play varied characters on screen while she gets typecast. "Anupam Kher, Paresh Rawal, and Amitabh Bachchan...are playing villains, comedians, lawyers, doctors...I do get jealous at times," she said. "It's...painful that they [filmmakers] can't think beyond certain roles for me," she added.

news_headline: It always disturbs me when people call me legend: Samuel L Jackson
news_article: Samuel L Jackson, who was recently honoured with Legend of Cinema Award at SCAD Savannah Film Festival, has said being called a legend "disturbs" him. "Legends are people who accomplish things that can't be accomplished by other people, or did something that's super extraordinary," he said, adding, "I just persevered through hard work and doggedness to get where I am."

news_headline: Those making money here won't be called haram****: Kangana on 'max film units' in HP
news_article: Kangana Ranaut on Saturday shared an article about Saif Ali Khan, Arjun Kapoor, Jacqueline Fernandez and Yami Gautam leaving for Himachal Pradesh to begin the shooting of 'Bhoot Police'. She tweeted, "Himachal is hosting maximum film units from Mumbai at this point, Dev Bhumi belongs to every Indian and anyone making money from this state won't be called haram****."

news_headline: A film very close to my heart: Madhuri on 23 yrs of Dil To Pagal Hai
news_article: Taking to Instagram on Saturday, Madhuri Dixit shared a post on the 23rd anniversary of her film, 'Dil to Pagal Hai', which also starred Shah Rukh Khan, Karisma Kapoor and Akshay Kumar. She wrote, "#DilTohPagalHai is a film very close to my heart." Madhuri added, "It was a wonderful learning experience and working alongside @iamsrk @therealkarismakapoor, @akshaykumar is always memorable."

news_headline: OTT platforms filled the void that movie theatres left: Vijay Varma
news_article: Speaking about the boom in viewership witnessed by digital platforms during the coronavirus pandemic, actor Vijay Varma noted that OTT platforms filled the void that movie theatres left. "We knew the significance was always there but it was only restricted to certain kinds of audiences. With no access to movie theatres...OTTs filled that void," the 'Mirzapur' actor explained.

news_headline: Maharashtra invites Tesla, holds video call with its executives
news_article: Maharashtra has invited US electric-car maker Tesla, weeks after its Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk suggested entering India next year. In a tweet on Thursday, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said he and Industries Minister Subhash Desai held a video call with Tesla executives earlier in the day to invite them to the state.

news_headline: Hyundai mulls global recall of Kona EV over battery fire risk
news_article: Hyundai is reviewing whether to expand a recall of its Kona EV globally following multiple reports of battery fires. It said it is investigating if Kona Electric with overseas specifications requires a safety recall, and that it will announce recalls regionally or by a country. However, Yonhap News Agency earlier reported Hyundai will recall 77,000 Kona EVs worldwide.

news_headline: Tesla to release 'Full Self-Driving' beta to careful drivers: Musk
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has revealed that Tesla will be rolling out its 'Full Self-Driving' beta to a few customers on October 20. "This will, at first, be limited to a small number of people who are expert and careful drivers," Musk said. However, he didn't elaborate on how Tesla would decide who to invite to the beta.

news_headline: Maruti Suzuki advises vendors to sell non-core businesses: Report
news_article: Maruti Suzuki has reportedly advised its highly-leveraged component vendors and suppliers to sell some of its non-core businesses and increase promoter stakes to improve cash flow and ramp up production. Maruti has also asked suppliers to build sizeable inventories to prevent shortages, as per reports. In June, Suzuki Chairman Osamu Suzuki had written to Indian parts suppliers on the same.

news_headline: NASA announces discovery of water on sunlit surface of Moon
news_article: NASA on Monday announced that its Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) has confirmed there's water on the sunlit surface of the Moon. This discovery indicates that water may be distributed across the lunar surface, and not limited to cold, shadowed places. SOFIA has detected water molecules (H2O) in Clavius Crater, one of the largest craters visible from Earth.

news_headline: US' health protection agency updates definition of COVID-19 'close contact'
news_article: US' health protection agency CDC has updated its definition of 'close contact' of someone with coronavirus. According to the previous definition, close contact meant spending 15 minutes within 6 feet of an infected person. It's been changed to a total of 15 minutes or more, meaning multiple encounters that add up to 15 minutes over a 24-hour period also count.

news_headline: Scientists measure the shortest interval of time ever recorded
news_article: Atomic physicists at Goethe University Frankfurt, the Fritz Haber Institute of the Max Planck Society in Berlin and DESY have measured that it takes 247 'zeptoseconds' for a photon to travel across a hydrogen molecule. It's the shortest time span that has been successfully measured to date. A zeptosecond is a trillionth of a billionth of a second.

news_headline: PUBG Mobile to stop working for users in India from today
news_article: PUBG Mobile announced that it is terminating service and access for users in India from today, two months after the government banned the game. PUBG Mobile had remained accessible for Indian users who already had it installed. Earlier, South Korea's PUBG Corp said it will no longer give China's Tencent Games the rights to publish the mobile game in India.

news_headline: Selena, Aniston ask Google CEO Pichai to stop disinformation on US elections
news_article: Singer Selena Gomez and actress Jennifer Aniston have accused Google of spreading disinformation on US elections and urged Google CEO Sundar Pichai to stop the same. Selena shared a message she wrote to Pichai on Instagram and the same was shared by Aniston. It said, "Google is making millions of dollars putting ads on websites that spread disinformation about elections."

news_headline: Risk of civil unrest in days leading up to US election result: Zuckerberg
news_article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg warned about the risk of civil unrest in the US as votes are tallied for presidential election. "I'm worried that with our nation so divided, and results potentially taking days or weeks to be finalised, there's a risk of civil unrest...Given this, companies like ours need to go well beyond what we've done before," he said.

news_headline: Car that can transform into a plane within 3 minutes completes test flight
news_article: A car that can transform itself into a plane within three minutes flew 1,500 feet in the air over Slovakia as part of a test flight. The vehicle, AirCar, has been developed by Slovakian firm KleinVision which released the video of the test flight. The two-seat model weighs 1,100 kg and can carry an additional load of 200 kg/flight.

news_headline: ISRO must pay $1.2 billion to Bengaluru startup, rules US court
news_article: A US court has ordered ISRO's commercial arm Antrix Corporation to pay $1.2 billion compensation to Bengaluru-based startup Devas Multimedia for cancelling a 2005 satellite deal. As per the agreement, Antrix agreed to build and operate two satellites and make available the space band spectrum, using which Devas would provide communication services in India. The deal was cancelled in 2011.

news_headline: Apple loses $100 bn in value as iPhone sales fall due to late launch
news_article: Apple shares fell over 5% in after-hours trade on Thursday, wiping $100 billion from its market value after it reported that iPhone sales dropped 21% in September quarter. iPhone sales fell on anticipation of the new models, which arrived a month later than usual this year. The delayed launch meant no opening-weekend iPhone sales are included in September quarter results.

news_headline: Twitter tenders verbal apology for showing Leh and J&K as part of China
news_article: Twitter representatives tendered a verbal apology before a joint parliamentary committee on personal data protection over the location tag in a live broadcast showing Leh and J&K as part of China. The panel showed strong displeasure over it and asked Twitter to tender a written apology. Earlier, the panel had said Twitter's explanation for the blunder was "inadequate".

news_headline: Malaysia's ex-PM's tweet justifying beheadings in France deleted by Twitter
news_article: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad's tweet justifying the recent beheading attacks in France has been deleted by Twitter. "Muslims have a right to be angry and to kill millions of French people for the massacres of the past," he had tweeted. Twitter removed the tweet by Mohamad for glorifying violence.

news_headline: TikTok, ByteDance file lawsuit against video sharing app Triller
news_article: TikTok and its parent company ByteDance have filed a lawsuit against Triller in a US federal court in response to a patent infringement lawsuit filed by Triller in July. ByteDance is requesting a court order that it, its products, and its users don't infringe the patent and that none of them are liable for damages or injunctive relief.

news_headline: London gallery allows guests to view art show through robots
news_article: The Saatchi Gallery in London is holding a private viewing of Philip Colbert's "Lobsteropolis" for people via remote-controlled telepresence robots on wheels. The robots navigate through the gallery, allowing guests to view Colbert's works on the cartoon lobster through cameras and a tablet. Colbert said that he wanted to stage the exhibition like "a sci-fi vision of a possible future".

news_headline: How can Google be a neutral platform if it has control button: Lekhi
news_article: BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi questioned Google's neutrality as a platform, after deposing the company's executives on the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019. "Google itself has the control button to which...news will flash and which will be suppressed," Lekhi added. The Parliamentary panel reportedly also questioned Google if it was violating fundamental rights by controlling its users' choices.

news_headline: Facebook employees get 3 days off to 'take a break': Report
news_article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has given three days off to his employees worldwide as a reward for working through "unprecedented challenges" this year, CNBC reported. "The idea here is to give as many people as possible a break," Zuckerberg wrote in an email. Facebook employees in the US have received the entire week of Thanksgiving off.

news_headline: UPI developer NPCI plans to take digital payments to Myanmar: Report
news_article: UPI developer NPCI's subsidiary NPCI International Payments Limited (NIPL) has submitted a bid to the Central Bank of Myanmar to build Myanmar's proposed Real-Time Retail Payments System and a QR-code Generation and Repository System, the Economic Times reported. The bid, jointly submitted by NIPL and US-based fintech Euronet, could reportedly face competition from Visa and Mastercard.

news_headline: Parliamentary panel deposes Amazon, questions its revenue and taxes
news_article: Amazon's top executives were deposed before the Parliamentary panel on the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019. The committee, chaired by BJP MP Meenakshi Lekhi, questioned Amazon on the amount of revenue it generated, the share of revenue it reinvested in India and the amount of tax it paid. The committee has also issued summons to Jio, Airtel, Ola and Uber.

news_headline: Ant Group's Shanghai listing oversubscribed 872 times
news_article: Ant Group's $17.2 billion Shanghai listing was oversubscribed 872 times, drawing $2.83 trillion in bids from investors. Alibaba-backed Ant Group has decided to exercise 15% overallotment option, increasing number of shares on offer to 1.92 billion from the initial 1.67 billion. The institutional order books for the Hong Kong listing were closed one day ahead of schedule due to oversubscription.

news_headline: France asks Twitter to suspend Ex-Malaysian PM Mahathir's account
news_article:
France's Secretary for Digital Sector Cédric O has asked Twitter to suspend former Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad's account following his tweets justifying a knife attack in Nice. "If not, Twitter would be an accomplice to a formal call for murder," he added. 
Mahathir on Thursday had tweeted that "Muslims have right to be angry & kill millions of French people".

news_headline: Muralitharan biopic director claims threat to life, asks Tamil Nadu CM for help
news_article: Tamil director Seenu Ramasamy has claimed he has been getting death threats after actor Vijay Sethupathi was asked to withdraw from Muttiah Muralitharan's biopic. He took to Twitter to request Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami for help, calling the matter "urgent". Vijay had opted out of film after Muralitharan said the film could cause harm to his career.

news_headline: Juhi Chawla prays for KKR during CSK's run chase, picture goes viral
news_article: Bollywood actress and Kolkata Knight Riders' (KKR) co-owner Juhi Chawla was spotted praying at the Dubai stadium on Thursday night during the final over of Chennai Super Kings' run chase. Pictures of her praying have gone viral on social media. However, CSK beat KKR by six wickets after successfully chasing down the target of 173 runs.

news_headline: Gayle throws his bat in frustration after getting out on 99, video surfaces
news_article: KXIP batsman Chris Gayle threw away his bat in frustration after getting out on 99 against RR on Friday. This is the first time in his T20 career that he got out on 99. "To the guys who I promised a century today, I missed out but in my mind it's a century. I scored a hundred," he later said.

news_headline: RR chase down 186-run target in 17.3 overs, end KXIP's 5-match winning streak
news_article: Rajasthan Royals chased down the 186-run target against Kings XI Punjab to register their second consecutive win. With the victory, RR ended KXIP's five-match winning streak and jumped to the fifth position on the IPL 2020 points table. The match witnessed KXIP's Chris Gayle become the first batsman in T20 cricket to reach 1,000 sixes.

news_headline: Which 5 Indian batsmen have hit six off the last ball to win a match in IPL history?
news_article: CSK's Ravindra Jadeja on Thursday became the fifth Indian to slam a six off the last ball to win a match in IPL history. Jadeja slammed two sixes off the last two balls to help CSK chase down the 173-run target against KKR. Rohit Sharma, Ambati Rayudu, Saurabh Tiwary and MS Dhoni are the other Indians to have done so.

news_headline: Jadeja slams 2 sixes off last 2 balls to help CSK beat KKR, MI qualify for playoffs
news_article: CSK all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed two sixes off the last two balls to help CSK chase down the target of 173 against KKR. The defeat is KKR's second in a row, while CSK, who are out of the playoffs race, registered their fifth victory. With KKR's defeat, MI became the first team to qualify for IPL 2020 playoffs.

news_headline: Dhoni gives tips to Varun after being dismissed twice by him in IPL, KKR shares video
news_article: CSK captain MS Dhoni was seen giving tips to KKR spinner Varun Chakravarthy after their IPL 2020 match on Thursday. KKR shared a video of the duo with the caption, "From admiring him from the stands at Chepauk, to now...Varun's fairytale continues!" Varun dismissed Dhoni in both of their matches this season.

news_headline: Gayle becomes first cricketer in history to smash 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket
news_article: KXIP batsman Chris Gayle has become the first-ever batsman to smash 1,000 sixes in the history of T20 cricket, achieving the feat in his 402nd T20 innings today. Gayle reached 1,000 sixes in T20 cricket after smashing his seventh six in the match against RR. Gayle is followed by Kieron Pollard, who has hit 690 sixes in T20 cricket.

news_headline: He tried to strangle me with pillow in hotel, twisted my arms: Ex-girlfriend on Zverev
news_article: World number seven men's tennis player Alexander Zverev's ex-girlfriend Olga Sharypova has accused the German tennis player of domestic violence. She said that Zverev strangled her with a pillow in a hotel room in New York last year and hit her head against the wall. "He twisted my arms and...I was really afraid for my life," she further claimed.

news_headline: 2 Pak batsmen run towards same end & 1 dives to reach first; video goes viral
news_article: During the 26th over of their innings in the first ODI against Zimbabwe, Pakistan batsmen Imam ul Haq and Haris Sohail ran towards the same end with Imam diving to reach first to avoid getting run-out. However, the wicketkeeper missed the throw. The square-leg fielder gathered the ball and threw it towards the bowler, who dislodged stumps at non-striker's end.

news_headline: Gambhir criticises Karthik for leaving KKR captaincy mid-IPL 2020, gives his example
news_article: Ex-KKR captain Gautam Gambhir has criticised Dinesh Karthik for leaving KKR captaincy mid-IPL 2020. "It just shows the mindset. You left captaincy because you wanted to concentrate on batting...but then it hasn’t worked," he said. He added, "When I was through a [bad] phase in 2014...I got three straight ducks...It was captaincy that helped me...get back into form."

news_headline: Ruturaj Gaikwad is a young superstar in the making: Watson
news_article: Praising teammate Ruturaj Gaikwad, CSK's Shane Watson said that the 23-year-old is a "young superstar in the making". "He's so calm and composed at the crease. And the shots that he plays, not premeditating anything, wherever the ball is bowled, he takes the game on. It has been an absolute pleasure to be able to bat [with him]," Watson stated.

news_headline: I'd rather be in bio-bubble playing cricket than sit at home: Stokes
news_article: Talking about life in bio-bubble, RR all-rounder Ben Stokes said that it's "challenging" but he'd rather be in bio-bubble playing cricket than sit at home. "Being away from the family, being in the same place for a long time, it can get a bit monotonous...[but]...it's a responsibility...as professional cricketers...to keep the game going on the TV screens," he added.

news_headline: 3 defeats don't make us a bad team: DC's Ajinkya Rahane
news_article: Talking about their three consecutive defeats, DC opener Ajinkya Rahane said that results were not as per what they wanted but "this...happens in a tournament like IPL". "Losses don't make us a bad team. It's all about playing to our strength and backing each and every individual...We're really looking forward to playing against MI now and then RCB," he added.

news_headline: KXIP look different since Chris Gayle's inclusion: Graeme Swann
news_article: Former England cricketer Graeme Swann has said that since the inclusion of Chris Gayle in the playing XI of the KXIP, the franchise has looked like a "completely different" team. KXIP have won five matches in a row after Gayle's inclusion after having lost six of their seven matches. Currently, KXIP are fourth in IPL points table with 12 points.

news_headline: KXIP on rise but it's not easy to win 6 matches in a row: Aakash
news_article: Ahead of KXIP's match against RR on Friday, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said that the KL Rahul-led side, who have won five matches in a row, are on "the rise" and another win will bring them close to qualification. "[It's] a fairytale story that we are seeing...[however] it's not easy to win six...consecutive matches as this is the IPL," he added.

news_headline: Doesn't feel like we're out of the tournament: CSK's Gaikwad
news_article: After CSK defeated KKR on Thursday, batsman Ruturaj Gaikwad said that the atmosphere in their dressing room is "pretty relaxed" and it doesn't feel that they are out of the tournament. "Hopefully, we finish the tournament with a win and continue the momentum next year," he added. With 10 points from 13 matches, CSK are out of the playoffs race.

news_headline: Nobby Stiles, World Cup winner with England in 1966, dies aged 78
news_article: Former Manchester United midfielder Nobby Stiles, who lifted the 1966 World Cup with England, died aged 78 after a long illness, his family has announced. Stiles had prostate cancer and advanced dementia. He earned 28 caps for England and made 395 appearances for Manchester United between 1960-71, scoring 19 times. Stiles also served as United's youth coach for four years.

news_headline: Wasn't expecting it: Rahul on being named India vice-captain for Aus tour
news_article: On being named India limited-overs vice-captain against Australia, KL Rahul said that though he wasn't "expecting it", it's a "happy and proud moment". "I am ready for responsibility and challenge and I'll try to do my best for my team," he added. Rohit Sharma has not been included in any of Team India's squads for Australia tour over injury concerns.

news_headline: Dhoni should play some super-competitive cricket before IPL 2021: Sangakkara
news_article: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Kumar Sangakkara said that CSK captain MS Dhoni, who has scored 200 runs in 13 matches, would be "disappointed with his personal form" this IPL season and should play "some super-competitive cricket" before IPL 2021. "You can't have long gaps between your IPL seasons, not playing international cricket or not playing regional or first-class cricket," Sangakkara stated.

news_headline: Absolutely no chance: Steve Smith on playing in BBL 10
news_article: Australia batsman Steve Smith has ruled out playing in the BBL 10, citing concerns over prolonged stay in bio-secure bubbles in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. "I'll be honest with you, absolutely no chance," he stated when asked about his participation. Smith has been in bio-bubble since Australia's limited-overs tour of England in early September.

news_headline: 7.0-magnitude quake in Aegean Sea felt in Turkey & Greece
news_article: A 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck the Aegean Sea on Friday and was felt in both Turkey and Greece, the US Geological Survey said. Videos on social media showed collapsed buildings in Turkey as a result of the earthquake. Reports said the earthquake was also felt on the Greek island of Crete.

news_headline: Death toll from earthquake in Turkey and Greece rises to 19
news_article: Nineteen people have been killed in Turkey and Greece after a 7.0-magnitude earthquake struck the Aegean Sea on Friday. Turkey's disaster management agency said 17 people died, while 709 people were injured. On the Greek island of Samos, two teenagers, a boy and a girl, were found dead in an area where a wall had collapsed.

news_headline: US rapper adopts dog thrown at him by woman during racist attack
news_article: A rapper based in US' Chicago has adopted a dog that was thrown at him by a woman during a racist attack. "First thing I did was pick up the dog, make sure she was ok, and took her with me," Abel Goshu said. "I was sitting in my car, parked. The woman popped up out [of] nowhere," he added.

news_headline: Ant Man actor Paul Rudd gives cookies in rain to US voters in queue; video surfaces
news_article: A video has gone viral on social media, showing 'Ant Man' actor Paul Rudd giving out cookies to people queued up outside a New York voting centre to participate in early voting amid rain. He also got pictures clicked with the voters while sporting an 'I Voted' sticker on his jacket. Several people praised the actor for his efforts.

news_headline: What is WHO's COVID-19 vaccine insurance scheme for poor countries?
news_article: A vaccine scheme co-led by WHO is setting up a compensation fund for people in 92 low-income countries who might suffer any side-effects from COVID-19 vaccines. It would pay a lump sum based on the severity of the harm to victims from side-effects. It would be funded with a levy on vaccines distributed to poor countries and from other sources.

news_headline: There's going to be a whole lot of pain: Fauci warns of COVID-19 spread in US
news_article: Top US infectious diseases expert Dr Anthony Fauci has warned of "unrelenting" spread of coronavirus in the US, adding that the country is "going in the wrong direction". "If things don't change...there’s going to be a whole lot of pain in this country with regard to additional cases and hospitalisations, and deaths," he warned.

news_headline: Police remove posters of French Prez pasted on Mumbai road by protestors
news_article: Mumbai Police has removed the posters of French President Emmanuel Macron which were pasted by protestors on a road. Videos of people walking and cars driving on the posters have surfaced on social media. Protestors called Macron sinful after he termed the Nice knife attack in which a woman was beheaded in a church as an "Islamist terrorist attack".

news_headline: Gamer's livestream captures moment earthquake hits Turkey, video viral
news_article: Footage from a Turkish gamer's livestream has gone viral after it captured the moment a 7.0 magnitude earthquake hit the coastal city of Izmir on Friday. In the footage, 22-year-old Arda Can Özel can be seen sprinting out of the room as he feels the ground beginning to shake. He later said he and his family survived the quake unharmed.

news_headline: Video shows the moment a building collapsed in Turkey during earthquake
news_article: Witnesses have captured the moment a building fell in İzmir during a magnitude 7.0 earthquake in Turkey's Aegean region on Friday. The nation's disaster agency said the quake occurred at 2.51pm at a depth of 10 miles. "Our state has taken action with all its institutions starting from the moment of the earthquake to help those affected," Turkish President said.

news_headline: Paris sees 700-km traffic jams hours before second lockdown
news_article: Paris region saw traffic jams with a combined length of around 700 kilometres on Thursday evening, just hours before France entered its second coronavirus lockdown. Traffic jams were also reported around the cities of Lyon and Bordeaux in the hours prior to the lockdown taking effect. Many Parisians left the city to spend lockdown in the countryside, French media reported.

news_headline: 1st doses of COVID-19 vaccines could be available in Dec, Jan: Fauci
news_article: Top US infectious diseases expert Dr Anthony Fauci said if everything goes well, the first doses of COVID-19 vaccines will be available to some high-risk Americans in late December or early January. "The first interim look (at trial results) should be, we hope, within the next few weeks," he added. US has reported over 89 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

news_headline: Kenya joins global trial of Oxford's COVID-19 vaccine candidate
news_article: Kenya Medical Research Institute has said that Kenya has joined the global clinical trial of Oxford University's vaccine candidate against coronavirus. The candidate, which was jointly developed with AstraZeneca, is already being evaluated in Britain, South Africa and Brazil. The trial in Kenya will initially involve 40 frontline workers while another 360 volunteers will join at a later stage.

news_headline: Policies used in India helped stop abuse before US polls: Zuckerberg
news_article: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the policies that Facebook used during elections in countries like India and Indonesia have helped in stopping abuse ahead of US elections. Zuckerberg noted that the next week will be a test for Facebook in the US. He added Facebook is focused on issues like voter suppression and has worked with experts in the space.

news_headline: Walmart removes firearms from US store floors ahead of election
news_article: Walmart has temporarily removed firearms and ammunition from the sales floors of its US stores as a precaution, citing isolated incidents of civil unrest in some areas. The move comes days ahead of the November 3 presidential election. In June, the retailer pulled the firearms from some stores amid protests over black man George Floyd's death in police custody.

news_headline: Remains of 59 bodies found in hidden graves in Mexico
news_article: The remains of 59 bodies, mostly belonging to young people, have been discovered in hidden graves in the Mexican state of Guanajuato, national authorities said on Wednesday. Violence in Guanajuato has increased in recent months amid a raging turf war between rival drug cartels. The state reported over 2,250 homicides in the first eight months of this year.

news_headline: 6 killed, millions without power as Hurricane Zeta hits US Gulf Coast
news_article: At least six people have been killed in the southeast of the United States after Hurricane Zeta hit the Gulf Coast on Wednesday. Over two million people were left without electricity on Thursday after the power lines snapped due to strong winds and heavy rain. Hurricane Zeta weakened into a tropical storm on Thursday and has moved northeast.

news_headline: 1,119 military personnel killed in conflict so far: Nagorno-Karabakh
news_article: The defence ministry of the Nagorno-Karabakh region on Thursday said that 51 more casualties have taken its military death toll to 1,119. The fighting between Armenian and Azerbaijani forces began on September 27. Earlier, both nations had accused each other of killing civilians by shelling cities in and around the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh.

news_headline: US seizes Iranian missiles, sanctions 11 entities over Iran oil dealings
news_article: The US Justice Department on Thursday revealed that the country had seized Iranian missiles shipped to Yemen and sold 1.1 million barrels of previously seized Iranian oil that was bound for Venezuela. The announcement came on the same day that US Treasury Department and State Department imposed sanctions on 11 entities for buying and selling Iranian petrochemicals.

news_headline: Former Turkish Prime Minister Mesut Yilmaz passes away at 72
news_article: Former Turkish Prime Minister Mesut Yilmaz has passed away aged 72 after a long battle with lung cancer, the official Anadolu news agency reported. He died on Friday in an Istanbul hospital where he was receiving treatment. Yilmaz served as the prime minister three times in the 1990s and had also led the Motherland Party from 1991 to 2002.

news_headline: We're in war against Islamist ideology, more attacks likely: France
news_article: More attacks on the French soil are likely as France is engaged in a "war against Islamist ideology", the country's Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said. "We are in a war against an enemy that is both inside and outside," he added. His comments came a day after a woman was beheaded in a knife attack at a church in Nice.

news_headline: Vote for President Trump is a vote for a better America: Melania
news_article: Speaking at her first joint rally with her husband Donald Trump this year, First Lady Melania Trump said "a vote for President Trump is a vote for a better America." "We've a law and order president. Donald fights to protect and support all our people," she added. She further said that "economy soared and unemployment shrank" during his presidency.

news_headline: Armenia, Azerbaijan meet mediators in Geneva to resolve conflict
news_article: The foreign ministers of Armenia and Azerbaijan met international mediators in Geneva on Friday to resolve the conflict in the Nagorno-Karabakh region. Three previous ceasefires, brokered by Russia and the US, have failed to halt the fighting that began on September 27. Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan said he believed the principle of 'remedial secession' should be applied to Nagorno-Karabakh.

news_headline: 4 killed, 120 injured after 7.0 magnitude earthquake hits Turkey
news_article: Turkey's disaster management authority on Friday said that at least four people were killed and 120 injured after a 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Aegean coast of the country. The death toll included one person who had drowned. Around six buildings collapsed in coastal city of Izmir, the interior ministry said. The earthquake was also felt in parts of Greece.

news_headline: Tanzanian Prez Magufuli wins re-election; opposition alleges fraud
news_article: Tanzania's President John Magufuli has won re-election with a landslide victory that the opposition dismissed as a "travesty". The Election Commission said Magufuli received 12.5 million votes, while his main rival Tundu Lissu secured 1.9 million votes.  Lissu rejected the presidential election results alleging "widespread irregularities" and called for peaceful protests against it.

news_headline: France church attack suspect identified as 21-yr-old Tunisian man
news_article: The man suspected of killing three people in a knife attack at a church in France's Nice on Thursday has been identified as a Tunisian migrant born in 1999. Chief anti-terrorist prosecutor Jean-Francois Ricard said he had arrived in France earlier this month. Tunisia opened an investigation into the suspicion that a Tunisian committed "a terrorist crime" outside national borders.

news_headline: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Keshubhai Patel passes away at 92
news_article: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Keshubhai Patel passed away on Thursday at the age of 92. He was admitted to Sterling Hospital in Ahmedabad following difficulty in breathing. Patel had tested positive for COVID-19 in September however he later tested negative.  Patel served as the Chief Minister of Gujarat in 1995 and from 1998 to 2001.

news_headline: Vijayvargiya's 'Chunnu-Munnu' remark for Nath, Digvijaya violated poll code: EC
news_article: The Election Commission on Friday said the "Chunnu-Munnu" remarks made by BJP's Kailash Vijayvargiya against Congress' Digvijaya Singh and Kamal Nath were in violation of the poll code provisions ahead of bypolls in Madhya Pradesh. Vijayvargiya also called the two leaders traitors. EC advised him not to use "any such word" in his public utterances during the model code period.

news_headline: Project took 9 yrs, 2 govts, 8 chairmen: Gadkari to officials over delay
news_article: While inaugurating the new NHAI headquarters, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari asked, "How can I congratulate you when it took 9 years to finish the project?" Gadkari said two governments and eight chairmen had passed through the organisation. Stating that the current chairman is unrelated to the delay, he requested "photos of the great personalities" responsible for it to be displayed.

news_headline: Keshubhai mentored me, I'm deeply pained: PM on ex-Guj CM's demise
news_article: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday took to Twitter to pay his condolences after the demise of former Gujarat Chief Minister Keshubhai Patel. He wrote, "Keshubhai mentored and groomed many younger Karyakartas including me...I am deeply pained and saddened." PM Modi added, "He resisted the Emergency tooth and nail. Issues of farmer welfare were closest to his heart."

news_headline: WB Deputy Speaker Sukumar Hansda passes away; CM offers condolences
news_article: West Bengal Assembly Deputy Speaker Sukumar Hansda died of cancer at a private hospital in Kolkata on Thursday, a report said. Hansda was diagnosed with prostate cancer earlier this year and was being treated for the last few months, Assembly Speaker Biman Banerjee said. "His relentless service for people shall always be remembered," CM Mamata Banerjee tweeted.

news_headline: Centre has turned J&K into a big jail: Mehbooba Mufti
news_article: PDP President Mehbooba Mufti on Thursday said the Central government is using all its powers to oppress Kashmiris and has turned J&K into a jail. The party leaders were arrested on Thursday morning after they tried to stage a protest against land laws issued by the Centre. "They are not allowing anyone to talk. Their approach is communal," Mufti added.

news_headline: Didn't think Bihar CM could stoop so low: Chirag on viral video
news_article: Reacting to the viral video that showed him instructing a cameraman how to shoot his video in front of his late father Ram Vilas Paswan's portrait, LJP President Chirag Paswan said, "Didn't think that (Bihar's) Chief Minister could stoop so low. It's surprising." "Do I need to prove Nitish Kumar how sad I am about my father's death," Chirag asked.

news_headline: CPI(M) leader's son taken into custody by ED in B'luru drug case
news_article: Bineesh Kodiyeri, son of CPI(M) leader Kodiyeri Balakrishnan, was on Thursday taken into custody by the ED in Bengaluru for his links to an accused in the drug peddling cases. Bineesh has been questioned two times by the ED in relation to this case. His name surfaced when Anoop Mohammed, a native of Kochi, was held by NCB and questioned.

news_headline: Rahul Gandhi has no political 'aukaat' left, says RS Prasad
news_article: Addressing a rally in Bihar amid the Assembly elections on Wednesday, Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "Rahul Gandhi has no political 'aukaat' left... Nobody takes him seriously." Prasad made the statement after Rahul Gandhi said that "It is a matter of worry that the PM’s effigy was being torched" instead of Ravana's during Dussehra.

news_headline: 5 BSP MLAs withdraw support to party’s Rajya Sabha nominee
news_article: Five BSP legislators have withdrawn their support to the party's official candidate, Ramji Gautam, for the Rajya Sabha elections. Aslam Raini, Aslam Chaudhary, Mujtaba Siddiqui, Hakim Lal Bind and Hargovind Bhargava informed the returning officers that their signatures as proposers for Gautam were forged. The by-election to 10 Rajya Sabha seats in Uttar Pradesh will be held on November 9.
